Program Description:
## CrossFit Fitness Maintenance & Health Improvement Program - Intermediate Level (5 Weeks) - Trainer: Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This 5-week program is designed for individuals with some CrossFit experience (Intermediate level) aiming to *maintain* their current fitness level while prioritizing overall health improvement.  It focuses on balanced training, incorporating elements of strength, cardio, gymnastics, and Olympic lifting (scaled appropriately).  Emphasis is placed on proper form and consistent effort. Listen to your body and adjust as needed.  Recovery is paramount!

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts. Consider electrolyte replacement drinks for longer or particularly intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a whole-food diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a daily multivitamin and Omega-3 supplement.
* **Sleep:** Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.
* **Scaling:**  All workouts are designed to be scalable. If an exercise is too difficult, modify it (e.g., jumping pull-ups to banded pull-ups, full push-ups to knee push-ups).
* **Warm-up & Cool-down:** These are *essential* and should not be skipped.
* **Trainer Note:** I, Maria Kuznetsova, recommend consulting your physician before starting any new fitness program.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Consistency**

**Day 1 (Monday): Strength & Core**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout:**
    * Back Squats: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60-90 sec rest)
    * Push-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (As Many Reps As Possible) (60 sec rest)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (60 sec rest)
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 15 reps per side (60 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds) - hamstrings, quads, chest, triceps.
* **Notes:** Focus on maintaining perfect form during squats.  Scale push-ups as needed. Hydrate well post-workout.

**Day 2 (Tuesday):  Metcon - AMRAP**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Rowing machine warm-up (250m easy pace) + dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:** AMRAP (20 minutes)
    * 10 Burpees
    * 15 Kettlebell Swings (moderate weight)
    * 20 Air Squats
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Light rowing (250m easy pace) + static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Pace yourself!  This is about consistent movement, not speed.

**Day 3 (Wednesday): Active Recovery**
* **Workout:** 30-minute brisk walk or light cycling. Focus on enjoying the movement and fresh air.
* **Notes:**  Prioritize recovery.  Consider foam rolling.

**Day 4 (Thursday): Gymnastics & Strength**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Shoulder mobility drills + wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * Pull-up practice (banded or kipping if proficient): 3 sets of AMRAP (60 sec rest)
    * Ring Rows (scaled pull-ups): 3 sets of 8-12 reps (60 sec rest)
    * Deadlifts: 3 sets of 5 reps (90-120 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Shoulder and back stretches.
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements.  Don't push beyond your current pull-up ability.

**Day 5 (Friday):  Short & Sharp - WOD**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks, high knees, butt kicks.
* **Workout:** 3 Rounds for Time:
    * 20 Wall Balls (moderate weight)
    * 15 Box Jumps (scaled to appropriate height)
    * 10 Thrusters (light weight)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Keep the weight manageable to maintain good form throughout.

**Day 6 (Saturday): Long Cardio/Endurance**
* **Workout:** 45-minute run, row, or bike ride at a moderate, sustainable pace.
* **Notes:** Maintain a conversational pace.

**Day 7 (Sunday): Rest** - Complete Rest.



---

**Week 2: Increasing Volume & Intensity**

**Day 8 (Monday): Strength - Lower Body**
* **Warm-up:** Dynamic stretching focusing on legs and hips.
* **Workout:**
    * Front Squats: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (90 sec rest)
    * Lunges (alternating): 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (60 sec rest)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps (60 sec rest)
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 9 (Tuesday): Metcon - Intervals**
* **Warm-up:** Rowing machine warm-up.
* **Workout:** 8 rounds: 30 seconds work / 30 seconds rest
    * Max Effort Calorie Row
* **Cool-down:** Light rowing and stretching.

**Day 10 (Wednesday): Active Recovery** - Yoga or light swimming.

**Day 11 (Thursday): Gymnastics & Upper Body**
* **Warm-up:** Shoulder mobility and wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * Muscle-ups (scaled to ring dips/pull-ups): 3 sets of AMRAP
    * Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60-90 sec rest)
    * Handstand Hold practice: 3 sets, hold for as long as possible (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 12 (Friday): WOD - "Fran" (Scaled)**
* **Warm-up:** Jumping jacks, burpees, and dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:** 21-15-9 reps of:
    * Thrusters (lighter weight than usual)
    * Pull-ups (banded or jumping)
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 13 (Saturday): Long Cardio/Endurance** - Hike with incline.

**Day 14 (Sunday): Rest**



---

**Week 3:  Introducing Olympic Lifting (Scaled) & Complex Movements**

**Day 15 (Monday): Strength - Full Body**
* **Warm-up:** Full-body dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:**
    * Clean & Jerk (PVC pipe or light weight): 3 sets of 5 reps (90 sec rest) – Focus on technique!
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (60-90 sec rest)
    * Deadlifts: 3 sets of 3-5 reps (90-120 sec rest)
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 16 (Tuesday): Metcon - Partner WOD (if possible)**
* **Warm-up:**  Light cardio and dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:** (Partner A & Partner B alternate)
    * 50 Wall Balls
    * 40 Kettlebell Swings
    * 30 Box Jumps
    * 20 Burpees
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 17 (Wednesday): Active Recovery** – Foam rolling and light mobility work.

**Day 18 (Thursday): Gymnastics & Core**
* **Warm-up:** Shoulder and core activation.
* **Workout:**
    * Toes-to-Bar (scaled to knees-to-elbows or hanging leg raises): 3 sets of AMRAP
    * Hollow Rocks: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * V-Ups: 3 sets of 15 reps
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 19 (Friday): WOD – "Helen" (Scaled)**
* **Warm-up:** Running warm-up and dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:** 3 Rounds for Time:
    * 400m Run
    * 21 Kettlebell Swings
    * 12 Pull-ups (banded or jumping)
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching.

**Day 20 (Saturday): Long Cardio/Endurance** – Trail running.

**Day 21 (Sunday): Rest**



---

**Week 4:  Peak Performance & Refinement**

**Day 22 (Monday): Strength - Olympic Lifting Focus**
* **Warm-up:** Specific Olympic lifting warm-up (empty barbell drills).
* **Workout:**
    * Snatch (light weight, focus on technique): 3 sets of 3 reps (90-120 sec rest)
    * Clean & Jerk (

## Ivan Orlov’s Advanced Boxing/Martial Arts Fitness Program – 2 Week Schedule (Weight Loss & Maintenance)

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Goal:** Maintaining Fitness, Weight Loss
**Level:** Advanced
**Duration:** Up to 30 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 5-6 times per week

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for individuals with a solid foundation in boxing/martial arts training. It focuses on high-intensity interval training (HIIT) combined with technique refinement and core strengthening to maximize calorie burn, improve cardiovascular fitness, and maintain/build lean muscle mass.  Expect a challenging two weeks that will push your limits and deliver results. Remember to listen to your body and adjust as needed.  Proper form is *paramount* to prevent injury.



---

**Week 1: Building Intensity & Refining Technique**

**Day 1: Shadow Boxing & Footwork Focus (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks (30 seconds), High knees (30 seconds), Butt kicks (30 seconds), Arm circles (forward & backward - 30 seconds each), Dynamic stretching (torso twists, leg swings - 2 minutes)
* **Workout (20 minutes):**
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 1: Focus on jab-cross combinations (3 minutes).  Visualize an opponent.
    * Footwork Drills – Ladder drills (if available) or cone drills (5 minutes). Focus on speed, agility, and maintaining boxing stance. (e.g., Icky Shuffle, Lateral Shuffle, Forward/Backward Movement)
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 2: Incorporate hooks and uppercuts (3 minutes).  Focus on power generation from the core.
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 3:  Combination work – jab-cross-hook-cross (3 minutes). Increase speed.
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 4: Defensive maneuvers – slips, rolls, and parries (3 minutes).
    * Active Recovery (3 minutes): Light jogging in place, stretching.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches – holding each stretch for 30 seconds (shoulders, triceps, chest, hamstrings, quads, calves).
* **Hydration:** Drink 500ml water before, during, and after workout.
* **Supplement (Optional):**  BCAAs post-workout to aid muscle recovery.
* **Note:** Focus on maintaining proper form throughout. Record yourself to analyze technique.

**Day 2: Bag Work & Core (Tuesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (20 minutes):**
    * Heavy Bag – Round 1: Power punches – focus on technique and generating power (3 minutes).
    * Heavy Bag – Round 2: Combination work – alternating between power punches and quick jabs/crosses (3 minutes).
    * Heavy Bag – Round 3:  Interval training – 30 seconds high intensity, 30 seconds active recovery (light punches/footwork) – repeat 6 times (3 minutes).
    * Core – Plank (3 sets, hold for 60 seconds), Russian Twists (3 sets, 20 reps each side), Bicycle Crunches (3 sets, 20 reps each side), Leg Raises (3 sets, 15 reps). (5 minutes)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches, focusing on core and back.
* **Hydration:**  Maintain consistent hydration throughout the day.
* **Recovery:**  Foam rolling for back and core muscles.

**Day 3: Active Recovery – Light Cardio & Mobility (Wednesday)**

* **Activity:** 30-minute brisk walk or light jog.
* **Mobility Work (10 minutes):** Yoga poses focusing on flexibility and joint mobility (Cat-Cow, Downward-Facing Dog, Pigeon Pose).
* **Hydration:**  Focus on electrolyte replenishment.
* **Note:** This day is about recovery. Don’t push yourself.

**Day 4:  Pad Work & Reflexes (Thursday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (20 minutes):**  (Requires a partner with pads)
    * Pad Work – Round 1: Jab-cross combinations, focusing on speed and accuracy (3 minutes).
    * Pad Work – Round 2:  Hook and uppercut drills, focusing on power and technique (3 minutes).
    * Pad Work – Round 3:  Combination work with partner calling out punches (3 minutes).  Reaction time focus.
    * Reflex Drills – Partner throws light, unpredictable punches – practice slips, rolls, and blocks (5 minutes).
    * Active Recovery (3 minutes): Light shadow boxing, stretching.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches, focusing on shoulders and arms.
* **Hydration:** Drink 500ml water before, during, and after workout.

**Day 5:  Strength & Conditioning – Bodyweight Focus (Friday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (20 minutes):**
    * Push-ups (3 sets, as many reps as possible – AMRAP)
    * Squats (3 sets, 20 reps)
    * Lunges (3 sets, 10 reps per leg)
    * Burpees (3 sets, 10 reps)
    * Mountain Climbers (3 sets, 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches.
* **Hydration:** Replenish electrolytes.
* **Note:** Maintain proper form. Modify exercises if needed.

**Day 6:  Sparring/Light Contact (Saturday) – *Optional & with appropriate safety gear!***

* **Duration:** 20-30 minutes.
* **Focus:**  Technique application, timing, and strategy.
* **Safety:**  Wear headgear, mouthguard, and gloves.  Work with a qualified sparring partner and under the supervision of a coach.
* **Hydration:**  Critical to stay hydrated during and after sparring.
* **Note:** If not sparring, repeat a workout from earlier in the week.

**Day 7: Rest (Sunday)**



---

**Week 2: Increasing Volume & Complexity**

**Day 8:  Shadow Boxing – Advanced Combinations (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Week 1, Day 1.
* **Workout (25 minutes):**
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 1:  Complex combinations – jab-cross-hook-uppercut-cross-hook (4 minutes).
    * Footwork Drills – Agility ladder with increased speed and complexity (5 minutes).
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 2:  Counter-punching drills – visualize opponent attacks and practice responding with counter punches (4 minutes).
    * Shadow Boxing – Round 3:  Clinch work – practice breaking clinches and delivering short punches (4 minutes).
    * Active Recovery (3 minutes): Light jogging, stretching.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches.
* **Hydration:**  Increase water intake.

**Day 9:  Bag Work – Power & Endurance (Tuesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Week 1, Day 2.
* **Workout (25 minutes):**
    * Heavy Bag – Round 1:  Focus on maximum power – short, explosive bursts (3 minutes).
    * Heavy Bag – Round 2:  Interval training – 45 seconds high intensity, 15 seconds active recovery – repeat 8 times (4 minutes).
    * Heavy Bag – Round 3:  Combination work – incorporating head and body shots (4 minutes).
    * Core –  Hanging Leg Raises (3 sets, 10 reps),  Wood Chops (3 sets, 15 reps per side),  Plank with Shoulder Taps (3 sets, 20 reps). (6 minutes)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches.
* **Hydration:**  Electrolyte drink post-workout.

**Day 10: Active Recovery – Swimming/Cycling (Wednesday)**

* **Activity:** 45-minute swim or cycle at a moderate pace.
* **Hydration:**  Maintain consistent hydration.

**Day 11: Pad Work – Speed & Precision (Thursday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Week 1, Day 4.
* **Workout (25 minutes):** (Requires a partner with pads)
    * Pad Work – Round 1:  Rapid-fire jab-cross combinations, focusing on speed and accuracy (4 minutes).
    * Pad Work – Round 2:  Hook and uppercut drills, focusing on precision targeting (4 minutes).
    * Pad Work – Round 3:  Partner calls out combinations – increase complexity and speed (4 minutes).
    * Reflex Drills – Partner throws varied punches – practice slipping, rolling, blocking, and counter-punching (6 minutes).
    * Active Recovery (3 minutes): Light shadow boxing, stretching.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches.

**Day 12: Strength & Conditioning – Weighted Focus (Friday)**

* **Warm-up (5

## CrossFit for Flexibility: 2-Week Intermediate Program - Coached by Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for intermediate CrossFit athletes looking to significantly improve their flexibility and mobility. We’ll blend traditional CrossFit movements with targeted stretching and mobility work.  The focus isn't on max effort strength, but on controlled movements and increasing range of motion.  Consistency is key. Listen to your body, modify exercises as needed, and prioritize proper form over speed or weight. Remember, flexibility is a journey, not a destination.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts. Consider adding electrolytes if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  A post-workout protein shake (20-30g) can aid recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Magnesium glycinate can aid muscle recovery and relaxation. Omega-3 fatty acids can reduce inflammation. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, walking) on rest days is encouraged. Foam rolling and self-massage are excellent tools for muscle recovery.
* **Scaling:** If an exercise feels too difficult, scale it down. Reduce weight, reps, or range of motion.  Never sacrifice form.
* **Warm-up & Cool-down:** *Never* skip these! They are crucial for injury prevention and recovery.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Assessment**

**Day 1: Mobility & Core Activation (25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Arm circles (forward/backward - 10 reps each), Leg swings (forward/sideways - 10 reps each leg), Torso twists (10 reps each side).
* **Workout:**
    * Cat-Cow Stretch: 10 reps
    * Thread the Needle: 10 reps per side
    * World's Greatest Stretch: 5 reps per side (hold each position for 30 seconds)
    * Bird Dog: 10 reps per side
    * Plank: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds hold.
    * Hollow Body Hold: 3 sets of 20-30 seconds hold.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Hamstring stretch (30 seconds per leg), Quadriceps stretch (30 seconds per leg), Triceps stretch (30 seconds per arm), Child’s Pose (60 seconds).
* **Notes:** Focus on breathing deeply throughout each exercise.  Pay attention to any areas of tightness.

**Day 2:  Shoulder & Hip Mobility (30 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (rowing machine - easy pace) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Shoulder dislocations with PVC pipe (10 reps), Hip circles (10 reps each direction).
* **Workout:**
    * Band Pull-Aparts: 3 sets of 15 reps (light resistance band)
    * Cuban Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (light dumbbells)
    * Pigeon Stretch: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds hold per side
    * 90/90 Hip Switch: 3 sets of 10 reps per side
    * Couch Stretch: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds hold per side.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Shoulder cross-body stretch (30 seconds per arm), Hip flexor stretch (30 seconds per leg), Glute stretch (30 seconds per side).
* **Notes:**  Maintain a neutral spine throughout the Cuban Press.  The Pigeon Stretch can be modified by placing a block under the hip.

**Day 3: Active Recovery - Yoga Flow (20 mins)**

* **Workout:** Follow a beginner/intermediate yoga flow focusing on hip openers and spinal twists (YouTube is a great resource - search for "yoga for hip flexibility").  Focus on controlled breathing and mindful movement.
* **Notes:**  This is a day for gentle movement and recovery. Don't push yourself too hard.

**Day 4:  Spinal Mobility & Core Strength (25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (jumping rope) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Spinal rotations (10 reps each side), Cat-Cow (10 reps).
* **Workout:**
    * Superman: 3 sets of 15 reps
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20 reps (can use a light weight)
    * Dead Bugs: 3 sets of 10 reps per side
    * Back Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
    * Foam Rolling (Thoracic Spine): 2 mins.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Lower back stretch (child’s pose), Spinal twist (30 seconds per side).
* **Notes:**  Engage your core throughout all core exercises.  Focus on controlled movements.

**Day 5:  Full Body Mobility Circuit (30 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching (similar to Day 1).
* **Workout:** (Complete 3 rounds with 60 seconds rest between rounds)
    * Inchworm: 5 reps
    * Spiderman Stretch with Rotation: 5 reps per side
    * Downward Dog to Cobra: 5 reps
    * Hip Flexor Lunge Stretch: 30 seconds per side
    * Shoulder Pass Throughs (with band or PVC pipe): 10 reps
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Full body static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds).
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements and deep breathing.

**Day 6: Rest or Light Activity** – Walk, swim, or enjoy a leisurely activity.



---

**Week 2:  Progression & Integration**

**Day 7:  Dynamic Flexibility & Core (25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (burpees – scaled to step-outs if needed) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Arm circles, Leg swings.
* **Workout:**
    * Dynamic Hamstring Stretch (toe touches with slight bounce): 3 sets of 10 reps
    * Walking Lunges with Twist: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg
    *  Renegade Rows with Push-Up: 3 sets of 8-10 reps per side (light dumbbells)
    *  Hanging Knee Raises: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (modify to lying leg raises if needed)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Lat stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on maintaining good form during the Renegade Rows.

**Day 8:  Shoulder & Hip Mobility – Increased Range (30 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (box jumps – scaled to step-ups if needed) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Shoulder dislocations, Hip circles.
* **Workout:**
    * Band Pull-Aparts: 4 sets of 20 reps (slightly heavier resistance band)
    * Cuban Press: 4 sets of 10-15 reps (slightly heavier dumbbells)
    * Deep Pigeon Stretch: 4 sets of 45-60 seconds hold per side (use props for support if needed)
    * 90/90 Hip Switch with Active Reach: 4 sets of 12 reps per side
    * Frog Stretch: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds hold.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Shoulder cross-body stretch, Hip flexor stretch, Glute stretch.
* **Notes:**  Focus on controlled movements and expanding your range of motion.

**Day 9: Active Recovery – Foam Rolling & Stretching (20 mins)**

* **Workout:** Spend 10 minutes foam rolling major muscle groups (legs, back, shoulders). Follow with 10 minutes of static stretching, holding each stretch for 60 seconds.
* **Notes:** This is a day for deep tissue work and recovery.

**Day 10:  Spinal Mobility & Core – Advanced (25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (mountain climbers) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: Spinal rotations, Cat-Cow.
* **Workout:**
    * Superman with Rotation: 3 sets of 12 reps per side
    * Weighted Russian Twists: 4 sets of 20 reps (use a moderate weight)
    * Dead Bugs with Band Resistance: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (use a light resistance band around feet)
    * Back Extensions with Hold: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (hold at the top for 2 seconds)
    * Foam Rolling (Latissimus Dorsi): 2 mins.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: Lower back stretch, Spinal twist.
* **Notes:** Maintain a stable core throughout all exercises.

## 10-Week Advanced Strength Training Program for Health Improvement & Rehabilitation - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This 10-week program is designed for advanced individuals looking to improve overall health, support rehabilitation from minor injuries (always consult a physician first!), and build functional strength. It focuses on full-body movements, incorporating progressive overload to continuously challenge your muscles.  We'll be training 2 times per week, allowing for ample recovery.  Listen to your body and adjust as needed. *Disclaimer: I am an AI and this program should be reviewed by a medical professional before starting, especially if you have pre-existing conditions.*

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova, NASM Certified Personal Trainer (Basic)

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein (1.6-2.2g per kg of body weight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a daily multivitamin.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid in recovery and strength gains.  Whey protein can assist in meeting protein requirements. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep each night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching, foam rolling) on non-workout days is highly recommended.
* **Form over Weight:**  Maintaining proper form is *crucial* to prevent injuries.  If you are unsure about proper form, watch videos or consult with a qualified trainer.
* **Progressive Overload:**  Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets each week to continue challenging your muscles.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Assessment**

**Day 1 (Monday): Full Body – Focus on Form**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching – arm circles, leg swings, torso twists, cat-cow stretch.
* **Workout:**
    * Barbell Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bent-Over Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs): 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching – hamstring stretch, quad stretch, triceps stretch, chest stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on perfecting form. Use a weight that allows you to maintain good technique throughout all sets.

**Day 2 (Thursday): Full Body – Core & Stability**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:**
    * Deadlifts: 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (Increase weight each set - Rest 2 minutes) - *Focus on perfect form!*
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Pull-Ups (or Lat Pulldowns): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Push-Ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Russian Twists (weighted if possible): 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side (Rest 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Foam rolling on back, hamstrings, and quads.
* **Notes:**  Deadlifts are a complex exercise. If you are unsure about your form, start with a very light weight or bodyweight.



---

**Week 2-10: Progressive Overload & Variation**

*(The following structure will be repeated with modifications each week. I will provide a detailed breakdown for Weeks 2, 5, and 8 to illustrate the progression.  The remaining weeks will follow a similar pattern, increasing weight, reps, or sets, and incorporating exercise variations.)*

**Week 2: Increased Volume**

**Day 1 (Monday): Full Body – Volume Increase**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching
* **Workout:** (Increase weight slightly from Week 1 if possible)
    * Barbell Squats: 4 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bench Press: 4 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bent-Over Rows: 4 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Overhead Press: 4 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs): 4 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 4 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching

**Day 2 (Thursday): Full Body – Core & Stability**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio + dynamic stretching
* **Workout:**
    * Deadlifts: 2 sets of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (Increase weight each set - Rest 2 minutes)
    * Walking Lunges: 4 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Pull-Ups (or Lat Pulldowns): 4 sets of AMRAP (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Push-Ups: 4 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Russian Twists (weighted): 4 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Bird Dog: 4 sets of 10-12 reps per side (Rest 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Foam rolling



**Week 5:  Exercise Variation & Intensity**

**Day 1 (Monday): Full Body – Variation & Drop Sets**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching
* **Workout:**
    * Front Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds) - *Variation from back squats*
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds) - *Variation from flat bench*
    * Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps per side (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Arnold Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 seconds) - *Variation from standard overhead press*
    * Good Mornings: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60 seconds) - *Focus on hamstring engagement*
    * Hanging Leg Raises: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 30 seconds)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching

**Day 2 (Thursday): Full Body –  Supersets & Explosiveness**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio + dynamic stretching
* **Workout:**
    * Deadlifts: 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (Increase weight each set - Rest 2 minutes)

## Boxing/Martial Arts Fitness Program: Maintaining Fitness (All Levels) - 2 Weeks

**Trainer:** Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Goal:** Maintaining Fitness – This program focuses on maintaining existing fitness levels, improving cardiovascular health, enhancing coordination, and building lean muscle through boxing and martial arts inspired movements. It’s designed to be adaptable to all levels, with modifications provided.

**Level:** All Levels (Adaptive) – Exercises will include scaling options for beginners, intermediate, and advanced participants.

**Average Duration:** Up to 30 minutes per session.

**Frequency:** 5-6 times per week.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Listen to your body:** If you experience pain, stop immediately and consult a medical professional.
* **Proper Form:** Prioritize proper technique over speed or repetitions. Watch videos and focus on maintaining correct form throughout each exercise. I will provide links to resources where applicable.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water before, during, and after each workout. Aim for at least 8 glasses of water daily. Consider an electrolyte drink after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Supplementing with a daily multivitamin can be beneficial.
* **Recovery:** Adequate sleep (7-9 hours) is crucial for recovery. Incorporate stretching and foam rolling into your routine.
* **Modifications:** I will provide modifications for each exercise to cater to different fitness levels. Don’t hesitate to use them!
* **Equipment:** Minimal equipment is required.  You may want boxing gloves and hand wraps for some sessions, but they aren't essential to start. A jump rope is helpful.



---

### **Week 1: Foundations & Cardio**

**Day 1:  Boxing Basics & Footwork (Monday - 25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks (30 secs), High knees (30 secs), Butt kicks (30 secs), Arm circles (forward & backward - 30 secs each), Dynamic stretching (torso twists, leg swings - 1 min)
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Shadow Boxing (3 rounds x 3 mins):** Focus on basic punches – jab, cross, hook, uppercut.  Beginner: Slow, controlled movements. Intermediate: Add combinations (Jab-Cross, Jab-Cross-Hook). Advanced: Increase speed and incorporate head movement. Rest 60 secs between rounds.
    * **Footwork Drills (3 rounds x 2 mins):**  Forward/Backward shuffle, Side-to-side shuffle, Circle around an imaginary opponent. Beginner: Slow and deliberate. Intermediate: Increase speed. Advanced: Add punches while moving. Rest 45 secs between rounds.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 secs) – Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch, Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Calf stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on maintaining a boxing stance – feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, hands up.  Hydrate well.

**Day 2:  Core & Conditioning (Tuesday - 20 mins)**

* **Warm-up (3 mins):** Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) & dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Plank (3 sets x 30-60 secs):** Beginner: On knees. Intermediate: Full plank. Advanced: Plank with alternating arm/leg lifts. Rest 30 secs between sets.
    * **Russian Twists (3 sets x 15-20 reps):** Beginner: No weight. Intermediate: With light weight (1-3kg). Advanced: With heavier weight. Rest 30 secs between sets.
    * **Mountain Climbers (3 sets x 20 reps):** Beginner: Slow and controlled. Intermediate: Increase speed. Advanced: Explosive movements. Rest 30 secs between sets.
    * **Bicycle Crunches (3 sets x 20 reps):** Rest 30 secs between sets.
* **Cool-down (2 mins):**  Static stretching – focus on core and lower back.
* **Notes:** Engage your core throughout all exercises.  Proper form is crucial to avoid injury.

**Day 3:  Kickboxing Combinations (Wednesday - 25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Kickboxing Combination 1 (5 rounds x 2 mins):** Jab-Cross-Front Kick. Beginner: Slow, focus on technique. Intermediate: Increase speed. Advanced: Add a spinning back kick. Rest 60 secs between rounds.
    * **Kickboxing Combination 2 (5 rounds x 2 mins):** Jab-Hook-Roundhouse Kick. Beginner: Focus on technique. Intermediate: Increase speed. Advanced: Add a jump switch kick. Rest 60 secs between rounds.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – focus on legs and hips.
* **Notes:** Practice proper kicking technique – pivot on your supporting foot and retract your leg quickly.

**Day 4: Active Recovery (Thursday - 15 mins)**

* **Light Cardio (10 mins):** Brisk walking, light jogging, cycling.
* **Foam Rolling (5 mins):** Focus on major muscle groups – legs, back, shoulders.
* **Notes:**  Focus on gentle movement and recovery.  Stay hydrated.

**Day 5:  Boxing Agility & Speed (Friday - 20 mins)**

* **Workout (15 mins):**

    * **Cone Drills (3 rounds x 2 mins):** Set up 4 cones in a square. Sprint between cones, incorporating boxing movements (jab, cross) at each cone. Beginner: Walk between cones. Intermediate: Jog. Advanced: Sprint. Rest 45 secs between rounds.
* **Cool-down (2 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:** Focus on quick footwork and explosive movements.

**Day 6:  Optional – Light Shadow Boxing (Saturday - 15 mins)**

* **Shadow Boxing (3 rounds x 3 mins):** Focus on fluidity and technique.  Low intensity.
* **Cool-down (2 mins):** Static Stretching.

## Ivan Orlov’s 10-Week Advanced Flexibility & Muscle Gain Program

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Goal:** Muscle Gain & Flexibility Improvement
**Level:** Advanced
**Frequency:** 3-4 times/week
**Duration:** 30-45 minutes/session

**Program Overview:** This program combines dynamic and static stretching with targeted muscle activation to enhance flexibility *while* promoting muscle hypertrophy. It’s designed for individuals with a solid fitness base who are comfortable with advanced stretching techniques and resistance training principles.  We will focus on full-body mobility and progressively overload both the stretch and the muscle engagement.  Consistency is key! Listen to your body and don’t push beyond your limits, especially in the initial weeks.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, increasing intake on workout days. Consider electrolyte supplementation post-workout, especially after longer or more intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Prioritize a protein-rich diet (1.6-2.2g protein/kg bodyweight) to support muscle growth.  Consume complex carbohydrates for energy and healthy fats for hormone production.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (5g daily) can aid muscle growth and recovery. Magnesium glycinate can improve sleep and muscle relaxation. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.  Consider active recovery days (light cardio, foam rolling) to reduce muscle soreness.
* **Pain vs. Discomfort:**  You should feel a *stretch*, not pain.  If you experience sharp or intense pain, stop the exercise immediately.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

*Focus: Establishing a baseline, improving core stability, and activating key muscle groups.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Full Body Dynamic Stretch & Core Activation (40 mins)
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + arm circles, leg swings.
    * **Exercises:**
        * Cat-Cow Stretch: 10 reps
        * Thread the Needle: 10 reps per side
        * Hip Circles: 10 reps per direction
        * Dynamic Hamstring Stretch (leg swings): 10 reps per leg
        * Torso Twists: 15 reps per side
        * Plank: 3 sets, 30-60 sec hold, 30 sec rest
        * Bird Dog: 3 sets, 10 reps per side, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches – Child’s Pose (30 sec), Quadriceps Stretch (30 sec per leg), Triceps Stretch (30 sec per arm).
    * **Note:** Focus on controlled movements and proper form.

* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Lower Body Flexibility & Glute Activation (35 mins)
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (high knees, butt kicks) + hip mobility drills.
    * **Exercises:**
        * Pigeon Pose: 3 sets, 30 sec hold per side, 30 sec rest
        * Frog Stretch: 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest
        * Deep Squat Hold: 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest
        * Glute Bridges: 3 sets, 15 reps, 30 sec rest
        * Single Leg Glute Bridge: 3 sets, 10 reps per leg, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches – Hamstring Stretch (30 sec per leg), Calf Stretch (30 sec per leg), Hip Flexor Stretch (30 sec per leg).
    * **Note:**  Engage your core throughout all exercises.

---

**Week 2:  Increasing Range of Motion**

*Focus:  Deepening stretches and introducing more challenging mobility exercises.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Spinal Mobility & Shoulder Flexibility (40 mins)
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, torso twists.
    * **Exercises:**
        * Spinal Waves: 10 reps
        * Shoulder Dislocates (with band or towel): 10 reps
        * Chest Opener (using a wall or doorway): 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest
        * Thread the Needle with Rotation: 10 reps per side
        * Cobra Pose: 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches – Child’s Pose, Triceps Stretch, Shoulder Stretch.

* **Day 3 (Thursday):**  Hamstring & Hip Flexibility with Active Engagement (35 mins)
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** Leg swings, hip circles, light jogging.
    * **Exercises:**
        * Standing Forward Fold with Active Hamstring Engagement: 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest (focus on squeezing glutes)
        * Seated Forward Fold with Band Resistance: 3 sets, 30 sec hold, 30 sec rest (band around feet)
        * Butterfly Stretch with Pulse: 3 sets, 30 sec hold with 10 pulses, 30 sec rest
        * Hip Flexor Stretch with Rotation: 3 sets, 30 sec hold per side, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches – Hamstring Stretch, Calf Stretch, Hip Flexor Stretch.



---

**Weeks 3-10: Progressive Overload & Integration** (Following a similar structure – 3-4 sessions per week)

* **Weeks 3-4:  Adding Resistance Bands & Dynamic Holds.**  Introduce resistance bands to deepen stretches and add a muscular component. Incorporate dynamic holds (e.g., holding a lunge with a stretch).  Increase hold times to 45-60 seconds.
* **Weeks 5-6:  Partner Stretching & Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation (PNF).**  If possible, incorporate partner stretching to help reach deeper ranges of motion.  Introduce basic PNF techniques (contract-relax) for improved flexibility.
* **Weeks 7-8:  Complex Movements & Functional Flexibility.**  Combine stretching with functional movements (e.g., yoga flows, Pilates). Focus on integrating flexibility into everyday activities.  Introduce exercises like Turkish Get-Ups (with light weight) to challenge stability and mobility.
* **Weeks 9-10:  Maintenance & Personalized Adjustments.**  Reduce the frequency to 2-3 sessions per week. Focus on maintaining flexibility gains and addressing any individual areas of tightness.  Experiment with different stretching techniques and find what works best for *you*.

**Example Workout (Week 7 - Tuesday):  Yoga-Inspired Flow & Strength Integration (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Sun Salutations (5 rounds)
* **Flow (25 mins):**
    * Warrior I (30 sec hold per side) -> Warrior II (30 sec hold per side) -> Reverse Warrior (30 sec hold per side) -> Extended Side Angle Pose (30 sec hold per side) – Repeat 3 times.
    * Triangle Pose (30 sec hold per side) -> Half Moon Pose (attempt 3 reps per side, modify if needed)
    * Downward-Facing Dog (60 sec hold) -> Plank (30 sec hold) -> Chaturanga (attempt 5 reps, modify to knee push-ups if needed) -> Upward-Facing Dog (30 sec hold)
* **Strength Integration (10 mins):**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10 reps
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg
    * Push-ups: 3 sets to failure
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Child’s Pose, Supine Spinal Twist (30 sec per side), Savasana (Corpse Pose - 2 mins).

**Throughout Weeks 3-10, continue to prioritize:**

* **Proper Form:**  Maintain correct alignment to prevent injuries.
* **Breathing:**  Deep, controlled breathing enhances relaxation and improves stretch depth.
* **Progressive Overload:**  Gradually increase the intensity, duration, or resistance of your stretches.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Rest when needed and avoid pushing through pain.



This program is a guideline. Feel free to adjust it based on your individual needs and preferences.  The most important thing is to be consistent and enjoy the process of improving your flexibility and building a stronger, more resilient body!  Remember to consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program. Good luck!

## 10-Week Running Rehabilitation Program - Advanced Level - Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for advanced runners recovering from a running-related injury (e.g., stress fracture, tendonitis, muscle strain). It focuses on gradual re-introduction to running, strengthening supporting muscles, improving flexibility, and preventing re-injury.  **Important Disclaimer:** This is a general program. *Always* consult with your physician or physical therapist before starting any new exercise program, especially during rehabilitation.  Listen to your body and stop if you experience pain. This program assumes you have been cleared for *controlled* exercise by a medical professional.  "Advanced" here refers to your pre-injury running experience, *not* your current capacity.

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova, NASM Certified Personal Trainer (Basic)

**Goal:** Full return to pre-injury running capacity with minimized risk of re-injury.

**Frequency:** 1-2 runs per week, supplemented with strength training and cross-training.

**Average Duration:** 60-90 minutes (including warm-up & cool-down) for running days. Strength and cross-training will vary.

**Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on running days. Consider electrolyte replacement during longer runs (over 60 minutes).

**Supplements (Optional, consult with a doctor):**  Vitamin D (especially in winter months), Magnesium, Collagen peptides for joint health.

**Recovery:** Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours), active recovery (light walking, stretching), and proper nutrition. Foam rolling is highly recommended.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Pain Management (Focus: Low Impact)**

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  **Walk/Run Intervals (30 mins)**
    * Warm-up: 5 mins brisk walking, dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles, torso twists).
    * Workout: 2 mins walking, 30 secs very easy jogging (conversational pace). Repeat 8 times. 
    * Cool-down: 5 mins walking, static stretching (hamstrings, quads, calves, hip flexors). Hold each stretch for 30 secs.
    * Notes: Focus on form. Short strides, relaxed shoulders. No pain!  Hydrate with water.
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (45 mins)** – Focus: Core & Glutes
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 secs rest
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 secs, 60 secs rest
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side, 60 secs rest
    * Single Leg Deadlifts (with light weight or bodyweight): 3 sets of 8 reps per side, 60 secs rest
    * Notes: Maintain proper form. Engage core throughout.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (45 mins)** – Cycling (low resistance) or Swimming. Focus on maintaining a consistent, moderate effort.
* **Day 7 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery - Gentle Yoga or Foam Rolling (20 mins)

---

**Week 2: Increasing Jogging Intervals (Focus: Gradual Progression)**

* **Day 8 (Monday):** **Walk/Run Intervals (35 mins)**
    * Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 1.
    * Workout: 2 mins walking, 1 min easy jogging. Repeat 8 times.
    * Cool-down: Same as Week 1, Day 1.
    * Notes:  Maintain conversational pace during jogging.
* **Day 10 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (45 mins)** – Focus: Legs & Core
    * Squats (bodyweight or light weight): 3 sets of 12 reps, 60 secs rest
    * Lunges (alternating): 3 sets of 10 reps per leg, 60 secs rest
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 secs rest
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 15 reps per side, 60 secs rest
    * Notes: Focus on controlled movements.
* **Day 12 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (45 mins)** – Elliptical (moderate resistance).
* **Day 14 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery – Light walk (30 mins) and stretching.

---

**Week 3:  Building Endurance (Focus: Time on Feet)**

* **Day 15 (Monday):** **Walk/Run Intervals (40 mins)**
    * Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 1.
    * Workout: 1.5 mins walking, 1.5 mins easy jogging. Repeat 8 times.
    * Cool-down: Same as Week 1, Day 1.
    * Notes:  Focus on consistent pacing.
* **Day 17 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (50 mins)** – Full Body
    * Push-ups (modified if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 secs rest
    * Rows (with dumbbells or resistance band): 3 sets of 10 reps, 60 secs rest
    * Overhead Press (with light dumbbells): 3 sets of 8 reps, 60 secs rest
    * Core work (Plank variations, bicycle crunches): 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 secs rest
* **Day 19 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (50 mins)** – Swimming (focus on technique).
* **Day 21 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery – Foam rolling and gentle stretching.

---

**Week 4: Introducing Continuous Running (Focus:  Sustained Effort)**

* **Day 22 (Monday):** **Continuous Run (20 mins)** – Very easy pace.  If pain arises, walk.
    * Warm-up: 5 mins brisk walking, dynamic stretching.
    * Run: 20 mins at a conversational pace.
    * Cool-down: 5 mins walking, static stretching.
    * Notes: This is a significant step. Prioritize pain-free running.
* **Day 24 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (45 mins)** – Lower Body Focus. Increase weight slightly if comfortable.
* **Day 26 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (45 mins)** – Cycling (moderate resistance, interval training – 30 secs high intensity, 60 secs recovery).
* **Day 28 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery – Yoga (60 mins).

---

**Week 5:  Increasing Run Duration (Focus:  Endurance)**

* **Day 29 (Monday):** **Continuous Run (25 mins)** – Easy pace.
* **Day 31 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (50 mins)** – Full Body, focusing on eccentric control.
* **Day 33 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (50 mins)** – Rowing (focus on proper form).
* **Day 35 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery – Light walk and foam rolling.

---

**Week 6: Introducing Speed Work (Focus:  Controlled Intensity)**

* **Day 36 (Monday):** **Interval Training (30 mins)**
    * Warm-up: 5 mins easy jogging, dynamic stretching.
    * Workout: 4 x 400m at a comfortably hard pace (not sprinting!), with 2 mins recovery walk between each interval.
    * Cool-down: 5 mins easy jogging, static stretching.
    * Notes: Focus on maintaining good form during intervals.
* **Day 38 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (45 mins)** – Lower Body & Core.
* **Day 40 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (45 mins)** – Swimming (interval training).
* **Day 42 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery –  Massage (if possible) or self-massage.

---

**Week 7:  Building Speed & Endurance (Focus:  Combined)**

* **Day 43 (Monday):** **Continuous Run (30 mins)** – Easy pace.
* **Day 45 (Wednesday):** **Strength Training (50 mins)** – Full Body, incorporating plyometrics (jump squats, box jumps - low height).
* **Day 47 (Friday):** **Cross-Training (50 mins)** – Cycling (longer distance, moderate pace).
* **Day 49 (Sunday):** Rest & Active Recovery –  Light yoga and stretching.

---

**Week 8:  Increasing Interval Intensity (Focus:  Performance)**

* **Day 50 (Monday):** **Interval Training (35 mins)**
    * Warm-up: 5 mins easy jogging, dynamic stretching.
    * Workout: 6 x 400m at a comfortably hard pace, with 2 mins recovery walk between each interval.
    * Cool-down: 5 mins easy jogging, static stretching.
    * Notes: Monitor your heart rate and adjust pace accordingly.

## Rehabilitation Strength Training Program - 5 Weeks (Maria Kuznetsova, NASM)

**Program Overview:** This 5-week program is designed to aid in rehabilitation through progressive strength training. It's adaptive, meaning exercises can be modified based on individual pain levels and progress. *Always listen to your body and consult with your physician before starting any new exercise program.* The focus is on rebuilding strength, improving range of motion, and restoring functional movement. We will prioritize proper form over heavy weight. This program assumes a "basic" level of mobility, meaning you can perform fundamental movements without acute pain. Adjustments are noted throughout for lower starting points.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, and increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein (0.8-1g per lb of bodyweight) to support muscle recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Consider a daily multivitamin and potentially creatine monohydrate (3-5g/day) after consulting your doctor.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Pain Management:** If you experience sharp or increasing pain, STOP the exercise immediately and consult with a healthcare professional. Modify the exercise to a pain-free range of motion.
* **Progression:**  Increase weight, reps, or sets *only* when you can perform the current workload with good form and without pain.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility (Focus: Re-establishing Movement Patterns)**

**Day 1: Full Body - Gentle Activation** (60 mins)
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Arm circles (forward & backward - 20 reps each), Leg swings (forward & sideways - 10 reps each leg), Torso twists (15 reps), Cat-Cow stretch (10 reps).
* **Workout:**
    * Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60s) – *Modification: Squat to a chair if needed.*
    * Wall Push-ups: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest: 60s) – *Modification: Increase distance from the wall for easier execution.*
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (Rest: 45s) – *Focus on core stability.*
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60s)
    * Band Pull-Aparts: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45s) – *Use a light resistance band.*
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretches – Hamstring stretch (30s each leg), Quadriceps stretch (30s each leg), Triceps stretch (30s each arm), Child’s Pose (60s).

**Day 2: Upper Body - Light Resistance** (45 mins)
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Shoulder rotations, wrist circles, elbow bends, light cardio (marching in place).
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (2-5lbs) (Rest: 60s)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (2-5lbs) (Rest: 60s)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-10 reps per side (2-5lbs) (Rest: 60s)
    * Shoulder Raises (Front & Lateral): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (1-3lbs) (Rest: 60s)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Shoulder stretches, triceps stretch, bicep stretch.

**Day 3: Lower Body - Stability & Strength** (45 mins)
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Hip circles, ankle rotations, calf raises, light marching.
* **Workout:**
    * Bodyweight Lunges: 3 sets of 8-10 reps per leg (Rest: 60s) – *Modification: Shorten the lunge step.*
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45s)
    * Hamstring Curls (with resistance band): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60s)
    * Single Leg Balance: 3 sets of 30 seconds per leg (Rest: 30s)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Hamstring stretch, quadriceps stretch, calf stretch.

**Day 4: Active Recovery** – 30 mins of light walking and gentle stretching.

**Day 5: Core & Flexibility** (45 mins)
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Cat-Cow, gentle torso twists, pelvic tilts.
* **Workout:**
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest: 60s) – *Modification: Plank on knees.*
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45s)
    * Russian Twists (no weight): 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest: 45s)
    * Yoga Flow (Sun Salutations – modified): 3 rounds (Rest: 60s between rounds)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Deep breathing exercises, spinal twists, child’s pose.

---

**Week 2: Building Endurance & Control (Focus: Increasing Reps & Time Under Tension)**

*Increase reps by 2-3 per set from Week 1.  Maintain good form. Introduce slightly heavier weights if comfortable.*

**Day 1:** Repeat Day 1 Week 1, increasing reps.
**Day 2:** Repeat Day 2 Week 1, increasing reps & weight (if possible).
**Day 3:** Repeat Day 3 Week 1, increasing reps.
**Day 4:** Active Recovery – 40 mins light cycling or swimming.
**Day 5:** Repeat Day 5 Week 1, increasing hold times for plank & reps for crunches/twists.

---

**Week 3: Progressive Overload & Range of Motion (Focus: Introducing New Variations & Challenges)**

*Introduce variations of exercises.  Focus on controlled movements.*

**Day 1: Full Body - Enhanced** (60 mins)
* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1 Day 1.
* **Workout:**
    * Goblet Squats (with dumbbell): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60s)
    * Incline Push-ups: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest: 60s)
    * Bird Dog with Arm/Leg Extension: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (Rest: 45s)
    * Single Leg Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest: 60s)

    * Arnold Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (3-5lbs) (Rest: 60s)

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1 Day 3.

## 5-Week Beginner HIIT for Muscle Gain - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen to embark on this 5-week HIIT journey to build muscle and improve your overall fitness. This program is designed for beginners, focusing on building a solid foundation while maximizing muscle stimulation through High-Intensity Interval Training. Remember consistency is key! Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and don't be afraid to modify exercises as needed.  We’ll focus on compound movements to get the most ‘bang for your buck’ and stimulate multiple muscle groups simultaneously.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, and increase intake on workout days.  Consider an electrolyte drink post-workout, especially if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:**  Muscle gain requires adequate protein intake. Aim for 0.8-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight.  Focus on whole, unprocessed foods.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid muscle growth and performance.  Whey protein can help meet protein goals. *Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Form Over Everything:** Watch videos of each exercise before attempting it. Focus on controlled movements and proper technique.  If you're unsure, start with bodyweight only.



---

**Week 1: Building the Foundation (3 workouts/week)**

**Day 1: Full Body HIIT**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks (30 secs), High knees (30 secs), Butt kicks (30 secs), Arm circles (forward & backward - 30 secs each), Dynamic stretches (leg swings, torso twists - 1 min)
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (60 secs rest)
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (60 secs rest)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-45 secs (60 secs rest)
    * Burpees (modified - step back instead of jump): 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60 secs rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches (hold each stretch for 30 secs) - Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on mastering the form of each exercise.  Don't push yourself too hard on the first day.

**Day 2: Rest/Active Recovery** – 30-minute brisk walk or light yoga.

**Day 3: Lower Body Focus**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Goblet Squats (hold a light dumbbell or water bottle): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (45 secs rest)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (light weight or bodyweight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Side Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (60 secs rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches focusing on legs and glutes.
* **Notes:** Maintain a neutral spine during Romanian Deadlifts.

**Day 4: Rest**

---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity (4 workouts/week)**

**Day 1: Full Body HIIT** – Repeat Day 1 from Week 1, but aim to increase reps or sets if possible.

**Day 2: Upper Body Focus**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, wrist stretches.
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Dumbbell Rows (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (60 secs rest)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (60 secs rest)
    * Push-ups (progress to full push-ups if possible): 3 sets of AMRAP (60 secs rest)
    * Plank with Shoulder Taps: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (45 secs rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches focusing on arms, shoulders, and chest.

**Day 3: Lower Body HIIT** – Repeat Day 3 from Week 1, increasing intensity.

**Day 4: Core & Cardio**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) and dynamic core activation (torso twists, cat-cow stretch).
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (30 secs rest)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (30 secs rest)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (30 secs rest)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (30 secs rest)
    * Mountain Climbers: 3 sets of 30 secs (30 secs rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches focusing on core.

---

**Week 3: Adding Complexity (4 workouts/week)**

**Day 1: Full Body HIIT** – Increase the intensity by reducing rest times to 45 seconds or adding a jump to the squats and lunges.

**Day 2: Upper Body Focus** – Increase the weight of dumbbells if possible, or increase reps.

**Day 3: Lower Body HIIT** – Introduce Jump Squats (3 sets of 8-10 reps) and Bulgarian Split Squats (3 sets of 8-10 reps per leg).

**Day 4: HIIT Circuit** – 3 rounds of the following circuit with 60 seconds rest between rounds:
    * Burpees: 10 reps
    * Squat Jumps: 10 reps
    * Push-ups: AMRAP
    * Mountain Climbers: 30 secs
    * Plank: 45 secs

---

**Week 4: Pushing Limits (4 workouts/week)**

**Day 1: Full Body HIIT** – Introduce plyometric push-ups (if able) and increase the intensity of burpees. Reduce rest to 30 seconds.

**Day 2: Upper Body Focus** – Focus on controlled negatives during dumbbell exercises.  Consider adding a superset (performing two exercises back-to-back with no rest). Example: Dumbbell Rows followed immediately by Dumbbell Bicep Curls.

**Day 3: Lower Body HIIT** –  Increase the weight for Romanian Deadlifts and Bulgarian Split Squats. Add walking lunges with dumbbells.

**Day 4: Interval Cardio & Core** – 20 minutes of HIIT cardio (sprint for 30 seconds, walk for 30 seconds – repeat) followed by a core workout similar to Week 2 Day 4, but increase reps or sets.

---

**Week 5: Consolidation & Progression (3-4 workouts/week)**

**Day 1: Full Body HIIT** –  Combine the most challenging exercises from previous weeks. Focus on maintaining good form throughout the workout.

**Day 2: Upper Body Focus** –  Continue with supersets and controlled negatives.  Consider adding a drop set (perform reps to failure, then reduce the weight and continue).

**Day 3: Lower Body HIIT** –  Challenge yourself with heavier weights and more complex movements.

**Day 4 (Optional): Active Recovery/Deload** – Light cardio (swimming, cycling) or a full body stretching session. This is a good time to reflect on your progress and plan for continued fitness.

**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing this 5-week program! Remember that fitness is a journey, not a destination. Continue to challenge yourself, prioritize your health, and enjoy the process.  Don't be afraid to experiment with different exercises and training styles to find what works best for you.  I'm incredibly proud of your commitment and dedication. Keep up the amazing work!  If you have any questions or need further guidance, feel free to reach out.



**Disclaimer:** *This workout program is for informational purposes only and does not constitute medical advice. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program.*

## The Phoenix Protocol: 10-Week Bodybuilding & Endurance Rehabilitation Program - Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for advanced individuals aiming to improve muscular endurance, facilitate rehabilitation from previous injuries (assuming clearance from a medical professional), and maintain/slightly build muscle mass. It prioritizes controlled movements, high reps, and active recovery.  The duration is kept to 30 minutes or less to minimize stress on the body while maximizing effectiveness.  Listen to your body, and *always* prioritize form over weight.  This is about rebuilding and becoming stronger, not ego lifting.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Medical Clearance:** *Crucially*, this program assumes you have been cleared by a doctor or physical therapist to engage in bodybuilding and endurance-focused exercises, especially considering the rehabilitation aspect.
* **Nutrition:**  This program is *most* effective when paired with a diet rich in protein (1.6-2.2g/kg bodyweight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Hydration is paramount – aim for at least 3 liters of water daily. Consider supplementing with creatine monohydrate (3-5g/day) for enhanced endurance and recovery, and a multivitamin. Consult with a registered dietitian for personalized nutrition guidance.
* **Form:** Watch videos of each exercise to ensure proper form. Incorrect form can negate benefits and increase injury risk.
* **Progressive Overload:** Gradually increase weight, reps, or sets each week, *only* if your form remains impeccable.
* **Rest & Recovery:**  Adequate sleep (7-9 hours) is non-negotiable.  Active recovery days are vital.  Don't skip them!
* **Listen to Your Body:**  If you experience pain, STOP. Modify the exercise or consult with a professional.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Activation (Focus: Re-establishing Neuromuscular Connection)**

* **Frequency:** 5 days/week
* **Intensity:** Low-Moderate

**Day 1: Upper Body - Push**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min cardio (light jogging/jumping jacks), dynamic stretching (arm circles, shoulder rotations).
* **Exercises:**
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Push-ups (modified on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Triceps Pushdowns (cable or band): 3 sets of 20 reps, 45 sec rest
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching (chest, shoulders, triceps) – hold each stretch for 30 seconds.
* **Note:** Focus on controlled movements. Hydrate well.

**Day 2: Lower Body - Quad Focus**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min cardio (light cycling), dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles).
* **Exercises:**
    * Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 20 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg, 60 sec rest
    * Leg Extensions (light weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 20 reps, 45 sec rest
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching (quads, hamstrings, calves) – hold each stretch for 30 seconds.
* **Note:** Maintain proper squat form – chest up, back straight.

**Day 3: Active Recovery**
* 30 minutes of low-intensity cardio (walking, swimming, cycling).  Focus on blood flow and gentle movement.
* Foam rolling for major muscle groups.

**Day 4: Upper Body - Pull**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min cardio, dynamic stretching (arm circles, torso twists).
* **Exercises:**
    * Lat Pulldowns (light weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per arm, 60 sec rest
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 20 reps, 45 sec rest
    * Bicep Curls (light weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching (back, biceps) – hold each stretch for 30 seconds.

**Day 5: Core & Full Body**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min cardio, dynamic stretching.
* **Exercises:**
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps
* **Cool-down:** Static stretching (core, glutes) – hold each stretch for 30 seconds.

---

**Week 2-10: Progressive Overload & Endurance Building**

*(The following is a summary. Each week will follow a similar structure to Week 1, but with progressive adjustments. I will outline key changes for each week, rather than repeating the full daily schedule.)*

**Weeks 2-4: Increasing Volume**
* **Key Changes:** Increase reps by 2-5 per set.  Introduce supersets (performing two exercises back-to-back with no rest). Reduce rest intervals to 45-60 seconds.  Introduce variations of exercises (e.g., incline dumbbell press to flat dumbbell press).
* **Example (Day 1):** Incline DB Press (3x20), immediately followed by Push-ups (AMRAP) - rest 60 seconds. Repeat 3 times.

**Weeks 5-7: Introducing Weight & Tempo**
* **Key Changes:** Gradually increase weight used, maintaining proper form. Introduce tempo training – slowing down the eccentric (lowering) phase of the exercise (e.g., 3-1-1 tempo: 3 seconds down, 1 second pause, 1 second up).
* **Example (Day 2):** Squats (3x15) with a 3-1-1 tempo.

**Weeks 8-10:  Peak Endurance & Active Recovery Refinement**
* **Key Changes:**  Focus on circuit training – performing a series of exercises with minimal rest between them. Increase cardio duration on active recovery days. Introduce plyometric exercises (jump squats, box jumps – *if* appropriate for rehabilitation).  Focus on mindfulness during recovery.
* **Example (Day 5):** Circuit: Plank (30 sec), Russian Twists (20 reps), Bird Dog (10/side), Glute Bridges (15 reps) – repeat 3-4 times with 60 seconds rest between circuits.



**Sample Weekly Split (Weeks 2-10):**

* **Monday:** Upper Body - Push (Supersets, Tempo)
* **Tuesday:** Lower Body - Quad Focus (Weight Increase, Tempo)
* **Wednesday:** Active Recovery (45 min Cardio, Foam Rolling)
* **Thursday:** Upper Body - Pull (Supersets, Weight Increase)
* **Friday:** Full Body Circuit Training (Plyometrics – *if* appropriate)
* **Saturday:** Rest or Light Activity (Yoga, Walking)
* **Sunday:** Rest



**Final Notes from Anna Smirnova:**

This program is a journey, not a race.  There will be days when you feel fantastic, and days when you struggle.  That’s okay.  The key is consistency and listening to your body.  Don’t be afraid to modify exercises or take extra rest days when needed.  Remember why you started – whether it’s to rebuild strength, improve endurance, or simply feel better in your own skin.  Embrace the process, celebrate your progress, and believe in your ability to achieve your goals.  I’m here to support you on your journey.  Don't hesitate to seek professional guidance if you have any concerns.  You’ve got this!  Stay hydrated, fuel your body, and keep moving forward.  The Phoenix *will* rise.

## Maintaining Fitness: 5-Week Beginner Strength Training Program - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for beginners looking to *maintain* their current fitness level, build a solid foundation, and establish consistent healthy habits. It focuses on full-body strength training with an emphasis on proper form and progressive overload. Remember, consistency is key! Listen to your body, and don't hesitate to modify exercises if needed. I, Maria Kuznetsova, am here to guide you on this journey.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, and increase intake on workout days. Consider adding electrolytes if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. This program doesn’t include a detailed diet plan, but prioritize whole, unprocessed foods.
* **Supplements (Optional):** A daily multivitamin can be beneficial.  Consider a protein supplement if you struggle to meet your protein needs through diet alone. *Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Form Over Everything:** Watch videos of each exercise to ensure proper form. If you’re unsure, consider working with a qualified fitness professional for a session or two.
* **Progressive Overload:**  As exercises become easier, gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets. This is crucial for continued progress.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Rest when you need to. Don't push through pain.  Modify exercises if necessary.



---

**Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Day 1: Full Body Introduction (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Rows (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side, 60 sec rest
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds, 60 sec rest
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds - quads, hamstrings, chest, triceps).
* **Notes:** Focus on form. Choose a dumbbell weight that allows you to maintain good technique.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core (Tuesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio + dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:**
    * Brisk Walking/Jogging: 30 minutes
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest
    * Russian Twists (bodyweight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 45 sec rest
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side, 45 sec rest
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 45 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (abs, lower back).
* **Notes:** Maintain good posture during cardio.  Engage your core throughout all core exercises.

**Day 3: Upper Body Focus (Wednesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, light cardio.
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Bicep Curls (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Triceps Extensions (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Lateral Raises (very light weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (chest, shoulders, biceps, triceps).

**Day 4: Active Recovery (Thursday)**

* Light walk (30 mins) or yoga/stretching session (30 mins). Focus on mobility and relaxation.

**Day 5: Lower Body & Core (Friday)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Leg swings, hip circles, light cardio.
* **Workout:**
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg, 60 sec rest
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Romanian Deadlifts (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds, 60 sec rest
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (quads, hamstrings, calves, lower back).

**Day 6: Rest or Light Activity (Saturday/Sunday)**

---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity**

(Increase weight slightly if possible. Focus on controlled movements.) Repeat the Day structure from Week 1, but with these adjustments:

* **Squats:** 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* **Push-ups:**  Try to do more reps than Week 1, or move to incline push-ups.
* **Dumbbell Rows:** Increase weight if possible.
* **Plank:** Increase hold time to 45 seconds.
* **Cardio:** Increase duration to 35 minutes.
* **Core:** Add 1 set to each core exercise.



---

**Week 3: Adding Variety**

**Day 1: Full Body Circuit (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching.
* **Circuit (Repeat 3 times, 60 sec rest between rounds):**
    * Burpees: 10 reps
    * Dumbbell Squats: 12 reps
    * Push-ups: AMRAP
    * Dumbbell Rows: 10 reps per side
    * Mountain Climbers: 20 reps
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core (Tuesday)**

* Interval Training: 20 mins (30 sec high intensity, 60 sec recovery) – Running, cycling, or jumping jacks.
* Core exercises from Week 2, adding a new exercise:  Reverse Crunches (3 sets of 15-20 reps).

**Day 3: Upper Body (Wednesday)**

* Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps
* Triceps Dips (using a chair): 3 sets of AMRAP
* Face Pulls (with resistance band): 3 sets of 15-20 reps

**Day 4: Active Recovery (Thursday)**

* Foam rolling + light stretching.

**Day 5: Lower Body (Friday)**

* Lunges: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per leg
* Deadlifts (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps
* Glute Bridges (with resistance band): 3 sets of 20-25 reps
* Calf Raises: 3 sets of 20-25 reps
* Hamstring Curls (with resistance band): 3 sets of 15-20 reps

**Day 6: Rest or Light Activity (Saturday/Sunday)**

---

**Week 4: Building Endurance**

(Focus on higher reps and shorter rest periods.) Repeat the Day structure from Week 3, but with these adjustments:

* **Increase reps:** Aim for 15-20 reps for most exercises.
* **Decrease rest:** Reduce rest periods to 45 seconds.
* **Cardio:** Increase duration to 40 minutes.
* **Circuit:** Add another round to the circuit (4 rounds total).



---

**Week 5: Consolidation & Maintenance**

**Day 1-5:** Mix and match your favorite exercises from Weeks 1-4. Focus on maintaining good form and enjoying your workouts.  Experiment with different exercise variations to keep things interesting.  Continue to prioritize hydration, nutrition, and recovery.

**Day 6: Active Recovery & Reflection**

* 45-minute walk or light hike.
* Reflect on your progress over the past 5 weeks. What did you learn? What challenges did you overcome? What are your goals for the future?

**Final Thoughts:**
