## Maria Kuznetsova’s 5-Week Bodybuilding Program: Weight Loss & Muscle Gain (Intermediate)

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)
**Goal:** Weight Loss & Muscle Gain
**Level:** Intermediate
**Duration:** 45-60 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 4 times per week (split routine)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for individuals with some prior weightlifting experience. It focuses on a split routine, targeting different muscle groups on different days to allow for adequate recovery.  We'll combine strength training with principles of progressive overload to build muscle while maintaining a caloric deficit for weight loss.  Consistency, proper form, and adequate nutrition are key to success.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Nutrition:** This program *requires* a calorie-controlled diet with sufficient protein (around 1 gram per pound of body weight). Focus on whole, unprocessed foods.
* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (5g/day) can aid in muscle recovery and performance. Whey protein can help meet protein needs. Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Form over Weight:**  Always prioritize proper form to prevent injuries. Start with a weight you can comfortably lift with good technique.
* **Progressive Overload:** Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets each week to challenge your muscles.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Form Focus**

**Day 1: Upper Body - Chest & Triceps** (Monday)

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching - arm circles, shoulder rotations, torso twists. Light cardio (jumping jacks, high knees).
* **Exercises:**
    * Barbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Dumbbell Incline Press: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Flyes: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45-60 secs)
    * Triceps Pushdowns (cable): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Overhead Dumbbell Triceps Extension: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 45 secs)
* **Cooldown (5 mins):** Static stretching – chest stretch, triceps stretch.
* **Note:** Focus on controlled movements.  Don’t ego lift!

**Day 2: Lower Body - Quads & Calves** (Tuesday)

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching - leg swings, hip circles, bodyweight squats.
* **Exercises:**
    * Barbell Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 secs)
    * Leg Press: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Leg Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Standing Calf Raises: 4 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
    * Seated Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cooldown (5 mins):** Static stretching – quad stretch, calf stretch.
* **Note:** Maintain a neutral spine during squats.

**Day 3: Rest** (Wednesday) – Active recovery: 30 min brisk walk

**Day 4: Upper Body - Back & Biceps** (Thursday)

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching - arm circles, torso twists, scapular retractions.
* **Exercises:**
    * Pull-ups (or Lat Pulldowns): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Barbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Seated Cable Rows: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 45-60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Hammer Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 45 secs)
* **Cooldown (5 mins):** Static stretching – lat stretch, bicep stretch.
* **Note:** Squeeze your shoulder blades together during back exercises.

**Day 5: Shoulders & Abs** (Friday)

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching - arm circles, shoulder rotations, torso twists.
* **Exercises:**
    * Overhead Press (Barbell or Dumbbell): 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Front Raises: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest 30 secs)
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cooldown (5 mins):** Static stretching – shoulder stretch, abdominal stretch.
* **Note:** Control the movement during lateral and front raises.



---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity**

Follow the same split as Week 1, but increase weight by 2.5-5 lbs if possible, while maintaining good form.  Reduce rest times by 15 seconds where possible.

**Day 1:** Increase weight on Bench Press and Triceps Pushdowns.
**Day 2:** Increase weight on Squats and Leg Press.
**Day 4:** Increase weight on Pull-ups/Lat Pulldowns and Barbell Rows.
**Day 5:** Increase weight on Overhead Press.



---

**Week 3: Introducing Supersets**

This week, we'll incorporate supersets to increase workout intensity and calorie burn.

**Day 1: Chest & Triceps (Supersets)**

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1, Day 1.
* **Superset 1 (3 rounds, Rest 60 secs between rounds):**
    * Barbell Bench Press: 8-12 reps
    * Triceps Pushdowns: 12-15 reps
* **Superset 2 (3 rounds, Rest 45 secs between rounds):**
    * Dumbbell Incline Press: 10-15 reps
    * Overhead Dumbbell Triceps Extension: 10-12 reps
* **Dumbbell Flyes:** 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cooldown:** Same as Week 1, Day 1.

**Day 2: Quads & Calves** (Same as Week 2, increase weight if possible)

**Day 4: Back & Biceps (Supersets)**

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1, Day 4.
* **Superset 1 (3 rounds, Rest 60 secs between rounds):**

## The "Forge" Muscle Gain Program - 10 Weeks to Strength with Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Program Overview:** This 10-week program, “Forge,” is designed to build muscle mass progressively, adaptable to all fitness levels. It prioritizes compound movements for maximum efficiency and incorporates periodization to prevent plateaus and optimize results.  We'll start with foundational strength and build towards more challenging variations.  Listen to your body, prioritize form, and remember consistency is key.  This program is designed for 1-2 workouts per week, allowing for adequate recovery.  If you feel exceptionally sore, take an extra rest day.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially on workout days.
* **Nutrition:**  Muscle gain requires a caloric surplus. Aim for 0.8-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight. Prioritize whole, unprocessed foods. Consider a creatine supplement (3-5g daily) for enhanced strength and muscle growth (consult with a healthcare professional first).
* **Warm-up:**  5-10 minutes of light cardio (jumping jacks, high knees, arm circles) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, torso twists, shoulder rotations) before each workout.
* **Cool-down:** 5-10 minutes of static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds) after each workout. Focus on the muscles worked.
* **Progression:**  Each week, aim to increase the weight lifted (even slightly), the number of reps, or the number of sets. If you can comfortably complete all sets and reps with good form, it's time to increase the challenge.
* **Form over Ego:**  Prioritize proper form above lifting heavy weight.  Incorrect form can lead to injury. Watch videos and, if possible, work with a qualified trainer to ensure you are performing exercises correctly.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Familiarization (Focus: Learning Form)**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps per arm (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Overhead Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Focus on controlled movements.  Weight should be light enough to maintain perfect form.

* **Day 2 (Friday): Active Recovery/Light Cardio**
    * 30 minutes of brisk walking, cycling, or swimming.
    * Focus on enjoying the movement and promoting blood flow.



**Week 2: Building Strength (Focus: Increasing Weight)**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Increase weight slightly if possible) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Push-ups (progress to full push-ups if possible): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-10 reps per arm (Increase weight slightly if possible) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Overhead Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Increase weight slightly if possible) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45-75 seconds (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:*  Prioritize controlled negatives (lowering the weight slowly).

* **Day 2 (Friday): Active Recovery/Light Cardio**
    * Yoga or stretching session (30 minutes). Focus on flexibility and recovery.



**Week 3: Introducing Variation (Focus: Muscle Confusion)**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Upper Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Bench Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Bicep Curls (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 45 seconds)
    * Triceps Extensions (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 45 seconds)
    * Cool-down

* **Day 2 (Friday): Lower Body & Core**
    * Warm-up
    * Lunges (Alternating): 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 45 seconds)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Cool-down



**Week 4: Strength Focus (Focus: Lower Reps, Heavier Weight)**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Increase weight significantly) (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bench Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Increase weight significantly) (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Bent-Over Rows: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Increase weight significantly) (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Overhead Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Increase weight significantly) (Rest 90 seconds)
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:*  Focus on explosive power during the concentric (lifting) phase.

* **Day 2 (Friday): Active Recovery/Foam Rolling**
    * 20-30 minutes of foam rolling targeting major muscle groups.



**Week 5: Deload & Recovery (Focus: Reduced Intensity)**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Light Full Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 2 sets of 10-12 reps (50% of previous weight) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Push-ups: 2 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 2 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (50% of previous weight) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Overhead Press (Dumbbells): 2 sets of 10-12 reps (50% of previous weight) (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 2 sets, hold for 30 seconds (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* This week is about recovery. Don’t push yourself.

* **Day 2 (Friday): Active Recovery/Light Cardio**
    * Gentle walk or swim (30 minutes).



**Week 6: Progressive Overload - Upper Body Focus**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Upper Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 seconds)
    * Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60-90 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45-60 seconds)
    * Hammer Curls: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 45-60 seconds)
    * Skullcrushers: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 45-60 seconds)
    * Cool-down

* **Day 2 (Friday): Lower Body & Core**
    * Warm-up
    * Bulgarian Split Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 seconds)
    * Deadlifts: 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (Increase weight each set) (Rest 90-120 seconds)
    * Standing Calf Raises: 4 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 45 seconds)
    * Hanging Leg Raises: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 30 seconds)
    * Cool-down



**Week 7:  Strength & Hypertrophy Blend**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body**
    * Warm-up
    * Front Squats: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest 75 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Chest Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 seconds)

## 10-Week Boxing/Martial Arts Rehabilitation & Muscle Gain Program - Beginner Level

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Goal:** Rehabilitation (focus on joint stability & controlled movement) and foundational muscle gain. This program prioritizes rebuilding strength and range of motion after injury or a period of inactivity, while simultaneously laying the groundwork for future, more intense training.

**Level:** Beginner – No prior boxing/martial arts experience required.  Emphasis on proper form and controlled movements.

**Duration:** Up to 30 minutes per session.

**Frequency:** 2 times per week, with at least one full rest day between sessions. *Listen to your body!* If you experience pain, stop and rest.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a protein-rich diet (approx. 0.8-1 gram of protein per pound of bodyweight) to support muscle recovery and growth. Include complex carbohydrates and healthy fats. Consider a daily multivitamin. *Consult with a registered dietitian for personalized nutrition advice.*
* **Supplements:**  Optional: Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid muscle recovery.  Omega-3 fatty acids can reduce inflammation. *Always consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night).  Foam rolling and light stretching on off-days can aid recovery.  Epsom salt baths can also help soothe sore muscles.
* **Form over Speed:**  The most crucial aspect of this program is maintaining proper form. Watch videos of each exercise (links provided where applicable) and focus on controlled movements.
* **Progression:**  Gradually increase the number of reps, sets, or resistance as you get stronger. *Do not rush the process.*



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

*Focus: Establishing proper posture, joint mobility, and basic movement patterns.*

**Day 1 (Monday):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles (forward/backward - 10 reps each), Shoulder rotations (10 reps each), Wrist rotations (10 reps each), Ankle rotations (10 reps each), Light cardio – Jumping jacks (30 seconds), High knees (30 seconds).
* **Exercises:**
    * **Shadow Boxing (5 mins):** Focus on form – proper stance, guard, jab, cross. Slow and controlled.
    * **Wall Push-ups (3 sets of 8-12 reps):** Rest 60 seconds between sets. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n2wz-pT_94s)
    * **Bodyweight Squats (3 sets of 10-15 reps):** Rest 60 seconds between sets. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YaXPRqUwItQ)

* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – Triceps stretch, Chest stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Hamstring stretch. Hold each stretch for 30 seconds.
* **Note:** Focus on breathing throughout each exercise.

**Day 2 (Thursday):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Same as Day 1.
* **Exercises:**
    * **Shadow Boxing (5 mins):** Focus on footwork - forward, backward, side-to-side.
    * **Incline Push-ups (3 sets of 8-12 reps):** Using a bench or sturdy surface. Rest 60 seconds between sets.
    * **Glute Bridges (3 sets of 15-20 reps):** Rest 60 seconds between sets. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RIBqjW-Pq0w)
    * **Bird Dog (3 sets of 10 reps per side):** Rest 60 seconds between sets. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=whvXjB-mG-U)

* **Note:** Pay attention to your core engagement during the Bird Dog exercise.

## 10-Week Beginner Bodybuilding & Flexibility Program - Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Goal:** Build foundational strength while dramatically improving flexibility. This program is designed for beginners with little to no prior weightlifting experience. We'll focus on proper form, progressive overload, and consistent stretching to achieve both muscle growth and increased range of motion.

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova, NASM Certified Personal Trainer (Basic)

**Important Notes:**

* **Listen to Your Body:** Rest when you need to. Don’t push through pain. Modify exercises if necessary.
* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein (0.8-1g per pound of bodyweight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a basic multivitamin.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid in muscle recovery and growth. Protein powder can help meet daily protein goals. *Consult with a doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep each night. Active recovery (light cardio, walking) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Progressive Overload:** Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets each week as you get stronger.
* **Form Over Weight:** ALWAYS prioritize proper form over lifting heavy weight.  Watch videos, use a mirror, and consider recording yourself to ensure correct technique.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

**Day 1: Full Body – Strength & Static Stretching**
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Overhead Press (light dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest: 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds): Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch, Chest stretch.
* **Note:** Focus on controlled movements and proper form.

**Day 2: Active Recovery & Yoga**
* 30-45 minutes of beginner-level yoga focusing on flexibility and balance.  YouTube is a great resource for guided yoga sessions.
* **Hydration:** Focus on electrolytes after yoga.

**Day 3: Upper Body – Strength & Mobility**
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 secs)
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – focus on chest, shoulders, biceps, and triceps.

**Day 4: Rest**

**Day 5: Lower Body – Strength & Flexibility**
* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Leg swings, hip circles, ankle rotations.
* **Workout:**
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 secs)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – focus on hamstrings, quads, glutes, and calves.

**Day 6:  Light Cardio & Foam Rolling**
* 30 minutes of brisk walking or cycling.
* 15 minutes of foam rolling targeting major muscle groups.



---

**Weeks 2-10: Progressive Overload & Increased Complexity**

*(The following weeks will build upon Week 1, progressively increasing weight, reps, sets, or introducing new exercises. I will provide a summary for each week, highlighting key changes. Detailed daily workouts would be excessively long.  Focus will be on increasing weight by 2.5-5lbs when possible, and adding reps/sets when weight increases are not feasible.)*

**Week 2:** Increase weight slightly on strength exercises. Introduce bird-dogs for core stability.  Increase static stretch hold times to 45 seconds.

**Week 3:** Introduce incline dumbbell press.  Add a superset (two exercises back-to-back with no rest) to one upper body day (e.g., Bicep Curls superset with Triceps Extensions).

**Week 4:**  Increase weight again.  Introduce single-leg Romanian Deadlifts to challenge balance and stability. Focus on controlled eccentric (lowering) phase of each lift.

**Week 5:** Introduce dumbbell shoulder press variations (Arnold Press).  Add a plyometric element to lower body day (e.g., jump squats – 3 sets of 8-10 reps).

**Week 6:** Deload week - reduce weight by 20-30% to allow for recovery. Focus on form and flexibility.  Increase yoga sessions to twice this week.

**Week 7:**  Introduce pull-up negatives (assisted if needed). Increase weight on all exercises where possible.  Add a core circuit (crunches, Russian twists, leg raises).

**Week 8:** Introduce walking lunges. Add a drop set to one exercise per workout (perform a set to failure, then reduce weight and continue for more reps).

**Week 9:** Introduce cable rows.  Increase the intensity of plyometric exercises. Focus on mind-muscle connection during each lift.

**Week 10:**  Test week – re-assess your strength and flexibility.  Continue with the program, maintaining the increased weight and intensity.  Plan for future goals!  Consider adding more advanced exercises or a new program focus.

**Sample Daily Structure (Weeks 2-10):**

* **Warm-up (10-15 mins):** Dynamic stretching and light cardio.
* **Strength Training (45-60 mins):**  Focus on compound exercises first, then isolation exercises.
* **Flexibility Training (15-20 mins):** Static stretching, foam rolling, or yoga.
* **Cool-down (5-10 mins):** Light cardio and deep breathing.



---

**Additional Advice from Maria Kuznetsova:**

* **Consistency is Key:**  The most important factor in achieving your goals is consistency. Stick to the program as much as possible, even when you don't feel motivated.
* **Track Your Progress:** Keep a workout journal to track your weight, reps, and sets. This will help you see how far you've come and motivate you to continue.
* **Don't Be Afraid to Ask for Help:** If you're unsure about proper form or need help with the program, don't hesitate to ask a qualified fitness professional.
* **Celebrate Your Successes:**  Acknowledge and celebrate your accomplishments, no matter how small.  This will help you stay motivated and positive.
* **Enjoy the Process!** Fitness should be enjoyable. Find activities that you like and make them a part of your lifestyle.



This program is a starting point.  It's designed to be adaptable to your individual needs and preferences.  Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and stay consistent.  Good luck on your fitness journey!

## The "Flow State Runner" Program: 5-Week Stress Relief for Advanced Runners - Coached by Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Program Philosophy:** This program isn't about pushing for speed or distance, but about leveraging running as a mindful practice for stress reduction. We’ll focus on building a deep connection with your body, utilizing varied terrains and intensities to promote a "flow state" – that feeling of being completely immersed and energized in the moment. Advanced runners already possess a strong base; we’ll refine it for mental wellbeing. Expect a blend of easy runs, tempo runs (focused on controlled effort, not speed), hill work (for grounding and resilience), and recovery runs.  Mindfulness cues will be integrated throughout.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on run days, especially before, during (if runs exceed 30 minutes), and after. Consider electrolyte replacement for longer or particularly sweaty runs.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on whole, unprocessed foods. Prioritize complex carbohydrates, lean protein, and healthy fats.  Avoid excessive caffeine and sugar, which can exacerbate stress.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Magnesium glycinate can aid muscle recovery and promote relaxation. Ashwagandha may help manage cortisol levels. *Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (yoga, stretching, walking) is crucial.  Listen to your body and take rest days when needed. Don’t push through pain.
* **Mindfulness:**  Before each run, take 2-3 deep breaths, focusing on the sensation of your breath. During your run, pay attention to your surroundings, your body’s movements, and your breath.  Let go of thoughts as they arise, gently redirecting your focus back to the present moment.



---

**Week 1: Reconnecting with the Rhythm**

*Focus: Establishing a mindful running practice and building a base.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Easy Run + Mindfulness**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes of dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles, torso twists).
    * Run: 30 minutes easy pace (conversational pace – you should be able to hold a conversation). Focus on your breathing.  Count your breaths – inhale for 4, exhale for 6.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes of walking and static stretching (hamstring stretch, quad stretch, calf stretch).
    * Notes: Hydrate well.  Reflect on how the run *felt*, not how fast you went.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday): Strength & Core** (Non-Running Recovery)
    * Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 15 reps
    * Push-ups: 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45-60 seconds
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * Notes: Focus on proper form.  Hydrate.
* **Day 3 (Friday): Hill Repeats (Mindful Ascent)**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes of jogging and dynamic stretching.
    * Hill Repeats: 6-8 repetitions of running up a moderate hill (60-90 seconds) at a comfortably hard effort, followed by walking down for recovery.  Focus on maintaining good posture and a strong core. Visualize releasing tension with each stride uphill.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes of walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: Choose a hill that challenges you without being overwhelming.
* **Day 4 (Sunday): Rest/Active Recovery** - Gentle Yoga or a leisurely walk.

---

**Week 2:  Building Endurance & Grounding**

*Focus: Increasing run duration and incorporating terrain variation.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Easy Run – Trail Exploration**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes of dynamic stretching.
    * Run: 35 minutes easy pace on a trail. Pay attention to the textures underfoot. Notice the sounds of nature.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes of walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: Trail running engages more muscles and requires more focus, promoting mindfulness.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday): Strength & Core**
    * Lunges (alternating legs): 3 sets of 12 reps per leg
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10 reps per arm
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side
    * Notes: Focus on controlled movements.
* **Day 3 (Friday): Tempo Run (Controlled Effort)**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes easy jogging and dynamic stretching.
    * Tempo Run: 20 minutes at a comfortably hard effort (you should be able to speak in short sentences).  Focus on maintaining a consistent pace and a relaxed upper body.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes easy jogging and static stretching.
    * Notes: This isn’t about speed; it’s about sustained effort and mental discipline.
* **Day 4 (Sunday): Rest/Active Recovery** - Foam rolling and light stretching.

---

**Week 3:  Deepening the Connection – Long Run & Body Awareness**

*Focus:  Extending the long run and refining body awareness.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Easy Run – Body Scan**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes dynamic stretching.
    * Run: 30 minutes easy pace.  Throughout the run, perform a mental body scan.  Start at your toes and work your way up to your head, noticing any tension or discomfort.  Consciously relax those areas.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: This cultivates a deeper connection with your body.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday): Strength & Core**
    * Deadlifts (light weight): 3 sets of 8 reps
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8 reps
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps
    * Side Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds per side
    * Notes: Proper form is crucial for deadlifts.
* **Day 3 (Friday): Long Run (Mindful Exploration)**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes easy jogging and dynamic stretching.
    * Long Run: 45-60 minutes at an easy pace.  Choose a scenic route.  Focus on your surroundings and your breath.  Break the run into smaller segments and set mini-goals for each segment (e.g., "Run to that tree," "Maintain a steady breath for the next 5 minutes").
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: Carry water and a small snack if needed.
* **Day 4 (Sunday): Rest/Active Recovery** – Gentle swimming or cycling.

---

**Week 4:  Resilience & Grounding – Hill Work & Interval Training**

*Focus:  Building mental and physical resilience through challenging workouts.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Easy Run – Gratitude Run**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes dynamic stretching.
    * Run: 30 minutes easy pace.  During the run, focus on things you are grateful for.  Let gratitude fill your mind and body.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: Positive emotions can counteract stress.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday): Strength & Core**

    * Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP
    * Hanging Leg Raises: 3 sets of 10 reps
    * Superman: 3 sets of 15 reps
    * Notes: Focus on explosive movements.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Hill Intervals (Power & Presence)**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes jogging and dynamic stretching.

    * Cool-down: 5 minutes walking and static stretching.
    * Notes: This builds both physical strength and mental fortitude.
* **Day 4 (Sunday): Rest/Active Recovery** - Deep tissue massage or self-massage.

---

**Week 5:  Integration & Flow – Maintaining the Practice**

*Focus: Consolidating gains and establishing a sustainable mindful running routine.*

## 5-Week Intermediate Strength Training Program for Health Improvement - with Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for individuals with some prior strength training experience (intermediate level) aiming to improve overall health, increase strength, and enhance functional fitness. It focuses on full-body workouts performed 3-4 times per week, lasting up to 30 minutes each session.  Consistency is key!  Listen to your body, prioritize proper form over weight, and don’t hesitate to modify exercises if needed.  I, Anna Smirnova, will guide you through this journey, emphasizing sustainable habits and long-term well-being.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a protein supplement (whey, casein, or plant-based) post-workout to aid muscle recovery. (Consult with a registered dietitian for personalized advice.)
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light cardio like walking or yoga) on rest days is highly recommended.
* **Form:** Watch videos of each exercise before attempting it. Focus on controlled movements and proper technique to prevent injuries.
* **Progression:**  Gradually increase weight, reps, or sets as you get stronger. Don’t rush the process.
* **Listen to Your Body:** Rest when you need to. Don’t push through pain.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Form**

**Day 1: Full Body – Focus: Compound Movements**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) & dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout (20-25 minutes):**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm, 60 sec rest
    * Overhead Press (with dumbbells): 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds – quads, hamstrings, chest, triceps, shoulders).
* **Notes:** Focus on perfect form. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain control.

**Day 2: Active Recovery**

* 30-minute brisk walk or light cycling. Focus on enjoying the movement and fresh air.

**Day 3: Full Body – Focus: Isolation & Core**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Day 1.
* **Workout (20-25 minutes):**
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg, 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 60 sec rest
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Same as Day 1.
* **Notes:**  Control the movement during isolation exercises.  Engage your core throughout.

**Day 4: Rest**



---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity**

**Day 1: Full Body – Compound Focus (Increase Weight/Reps)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 1.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Push-ups (progress to full push-ups if possible): 3 sets of AMRAP, 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per arm, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45-60 seconds, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 1.

**Day 2: Active Recovery**

* Yoga or Pilates class (30-45 minutes).

**Day 3: Full Body – Isolation & Core (Increase Weight/Reps)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 3.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):**
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per leg, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20-25 reps per side, 60 sec rest (Increase weight if possible)
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per side, 60 sec rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 3.

**Day 4: Rest**



---

**Week 3: Adding Variation & Challenge**

**Day 1: Full Body –  Superset Focus**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 1.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):**  Perform supersets (exercises back-to-back with no rest)
    * Superset 1: Squats (12-15 reps) + Push-ups (AMRAP) – 3 sets, 60 sec rest between sets.
    * Superset 2: Dumbbell Rows (12-15 reps per arm) + Overhead Press (10-12 reps) – 3 sets, 60 sec rest between sets.
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 60 seconds, 60 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 1.

**Day 2: Active Recovery**

* Swimming (30 minutes) or a long walk.

**Day 3: Full Body –  Isolation & Core – Circuit Training**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 3.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):** Circuit training – perform each exercise for 45 seconds, followed by 15 seconds rest. Repeat the circuit 3 times.
    * Lunges (alternating legs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions
    * Russian Twists
    * Bird Dog
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 3.

**Day 4: Rest**



---

**Week 4:  Power & Endurance**

**Day 1: Full Body –  Tempo Training**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 1.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):** Focus on controlled tempo (e.g., 3 seconds down, 1 second pause, 1 second up).
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (3-1-1 tempo), 60 sec rest
    * Push-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (3-1-1 tempo), 60 sec rest
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (3-1-1 tempo), 60 sec rest
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (3-1-1 tempo), 60 sec rest
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 60-75 seconds, 60 sec rest

* Hiking or a longer bike ride (60 minutes).

**Day 3: Full Body –  Drop Sets & Core**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Same as Week 1, Day 3.
* **Workout (25-30 minutes):**  Use drop sets (perform an exercise to failure, then reduce the weight and continue).
    * Lung

## 5-Week Cycling Fitness Maintenance Program – Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed to help you maintain your current fitness level through consistent cycling. It’s adaptable for all levels, meaning modifications are provided to scale the intensity up or down based on your experience and how you're feeling.  The focus is on building endurance, maintaining leg strength, and enjoying the ride!  We'll aim for 3-4 sessions per week, each lasting up to 30 minutes. Listen to your body and don’t hesitate to adjust.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 16oz of water before, during (especially on longer rides), and after each session. Consider an electrolyte drink for rides exceeding 45 minutes.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in carbohydrates for energy, protein for muscle recovery, and healthy fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  A multivitamin can be beneficial. Consider creatine (3-5g daily) if you’re looking to maintain muscle mass, and beta-alanine (2-5g daily) for buffering lactic acid during high-intensity efforts. *Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regime.*
* **Recovery:** Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night).  Foam rolling and stretching are crucial for muscle recovery.
* **Bike Fit:** Ensure your bike is properly fitted to avoid injuries.
* **Safety:** Always wear a helmet! Be aware of your surroundings and follow traffic laws.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Re-Establishment**

This week focuses on getting back into a consistent routine and establishing a base level of fitness.

* **Day 1 (Monday): Easy Spin - 20 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light pedaling at low resistance. Focus on smooth cadence.
    * **Workout (10 minutes):**  Maintain a comfortable pace where you can easily hold a conversation.  Cadence: 80-90 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Slow pedaling at very low resistance.
    * **Notes:** Focus on proper form – back straight, core engaged. Hydrate well.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):  Hill Repeats (Light) - 25 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):** Find a gentle incline.  Cycle up the hill at a moderate effort for 30 seconds, then recover with easy spinning down for 60 seconds. Repeat 8 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Don’t push too hard on the hills. Focus on maintaining consistent power.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Recovery Ride - 15 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (3 minutes):** Very light spinning.
    * **Workout (9 minutes):**  Extremely easy pace.  Focus on active recovery – just keep the legs moving. Cadence: 90-100 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (3 minutes):**  Very slow spinning.
    * **Notes:** This ride is about flushing out lactic acid and promoting recovery.

---

**Week 2: Building Endurance**

We’ll increase the duration of rides and introduce some slight variations in intensity.

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Steady State Ride - 25 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):** Maintain a moderate, consistent pace.  You should be able to speak in short sentences.  Cadence: 85-95 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining a consistent power output.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):  Intervals (Moderate) - 28 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (18 minutes):**  Alternate between 1 minute of high-intensity cycling (challenging but sustainable) and 2 minutes of easy recovery spinning. Repeat 6 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  High-intensity should feel like you’re working hard, but not sprinting.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Longer Easy Spin - 30 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light pedaling.
    * **Workout (20 minutes):**  Maintain a comfortable pace.  Focus on enjoying the ride. Cadence: 80-90 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Focus on breathing deeply and maintaining good posture.

---

**Week 3:  Increasing Intensity & Strength**

This week introduces more challenging intervals and focuses on building leg strength.

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Tempo Ride - 25 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):**  Ride at a “tempo” pace – comfortably hard.  You should be able to say a few words, but not hold a conversation. Cadence: 90-100 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:** Tempo rides are great for building endurance and improving your lactate threshold.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):  Hill Repeats (Moderate) - 30 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):** Find a moderate incline.  Cycle up the hill at a challenging effort for 45 seconds, then recover with easy spinning down for 60 seconds. Repeat 8 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Engage your core and maintain good form on the hills.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Strength & Spin - 25 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):** Alternate between 2 minutes of high-resistance, low-cadence cycling (focus on leg strength – imagine pushing heavy gears) and 1 minute of easy spinning. Repeat 5 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  High resistance should feel challenging, but maintain control.

---

**Week 4:  Peak Performance & Variation**

This week pushes your limits with longer intervals and incorporates some variation to prevent plateaus.

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Intervals (High) - 30 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (20 minutes):**  Alternate between 2 minutes of very high-intensity cycling (near maximal effort) and 2 minutes of easy recovery spinning. Repeat 5 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  These intervals should be challenging.  Focus on maintaining good form even when fatigued.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):  Long Ride (Steady State) - 30 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (20 minutes):**  Maintain a moderate, consistent pace.  Focus on endurance. Cadence: 85-95 RPM.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Practice pacing yourself.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Variable Terrain Ride - 28 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (18 minutes):**  Find a route with varying terrain (hills, flats, etc.).  Adjust your effort to match the terrain.  Focus on responding to changes in elevation and resistance.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:** This ride simulates real-world cycling conditions.

---

**Week 5:  Maintenance & Active Recovery**

This week focuses on consolidating your gains and preparing for continued fitness maintenance.

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Tempo Ride (Reduced Intensity) - 20 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (10 minutes):**  Ride at a slightly reduced tempo pace compared to Week 3.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining good form and breathing.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):  Hill Repeats (Light) - 25 minutes**
    * **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Easy spinning.
    * **Workout (15 minutes):**  Gentle hill repeats – 30 seconds up, 60 seconds down. Repeat 6 times.
    * **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Slow pedaling.
    * **Notes:**  Focus on recovery between repeats.
* **Day 3 (Friday):  Active Recovery Spin - 15 minutes**

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen this program to boost your fitness and endurance. This 2-week HIIT plan is designed to be adaptable to *all* levels. Listen to your body, modify exercises as needed, and prioritize proper form. Consistency is key, and remember, even small improvements add up to significant results! This program focuses on maintaining current fitness while gently improving your cardiovascular endurance. We'll achieve this through varied HIIT workouts, active recovery, and a focus on mindful movement.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** Fuel your body with a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a post-workout protein shake (20-30g protein) to aid recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Creatine (3-5g daily) can help with power output and recovery. Electrolytes are helpful during intense sweating. *Always consult with your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery days are crucial for muscle repair. Don’t skip them!
* **Modifications:**  I'll suggest modifications for each exercise. Don't hesitate to use them!  Lower impact options are always available.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Pain is a signal. Stop if you feel sharp or persistent pain.



---

* **Workout (20 minutes):**

## 10-Week Bodybuilding Program for Weight Loss & Fitness Maintenance – with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for intermediate lifters aiming to shed weight while maintaining and building lean muscle mass. It focuses on a balanced approach combining strength training with cardio, prioritizing proper form and progressive overload.  Remember to listen to your body, adjust weights as needed, and stay consistent! I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm here to guide you through this journey.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** This program works best with a calorie-controlled diet focused on whole foods, lean protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consult a nutritionist for personalized dietary advice.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Consider a protein supplement (whey, casein, or plant-based) to support muscle recovery. Creatine can also be beneficial for strength and performance, but research and consult a healthcare professional before use.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Form over Weight:** Always prioritize proper form to prevent injuries. Watch videos and practice in front of a mirror if needed.
* **Progressive Overload:**  Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets each week to challenge your muscles and continue making progress.



---

**Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Day 1: Full Body Strength (30 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks (30 secs), High knees (30 secs), Butt kicks (30 secs), Arm circles (30 secs forward/backward), Dynamic stretching (leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (Rest 60 secs)
    * Overhead Press (Dumbbells): 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 secs (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 secs) – Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements.  Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain good form.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core (25 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light jogging in place, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:**
    *  Brisk Walking/Jogging: 20 minutes at a moderate intensity (you should be able to hold a conversation, but with some effort).
    *  Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
    *  Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
    *  Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – lower back stretch, abdominal stretch.

**Day 3: Rest/Active Recovery** – Light walk or yoga.

**Day 4:  Upper Body Focus (30 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 45 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – chest stretch, bicep stretch, tricep stretch, shoulder stretch.



---

**Week 2-10: Progressive Overload & Variation**

The following weeks will build on Week 1, progressively increasing the intensity and introducing new exercises. I'll outline the key changes for each week.

**Weeks 2-4: Increasing Volume**

* **Strength Training:** Increase weight slightly if possible. If not, increase reps by 1-2 per set. Add one set to each exercise (e.g., from 3 sets to 4 sets).
* **Cardio:** Increase duration of cardio by 5 minutes each week.  Introduce interval training (e.g., 30 seconds sprint, 60 seconds walk) for 10-15 minutes of your cardio session.
* **Core:**  Add more challenging core exercises like bicycle crunches, hanging leg raises (if you have access to a pull-up bar).

**Example - Week 3, Day 1 (Full Body):**

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1.
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 4 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Push-ups: 4 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 4 sets of 12-15 reps per arm (Rest 60 secs)
    * Overhead Press: 4 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Plank: 4 sets, hold for 45-60 secs (Rest 30 secs)
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down:** Same as Week 1.

**Weeks 5-7: Introducing New Exercises & Techniques**

* **Strength Training:** Replace some exercises with variations. For example, swap regular squats for front squats or goblet squats. Introduce supersets (performing two exercises back-to-back with no rest).
* **Cardio:** Experiment with different cardio modalities - cycling, swimming, elliptical.
* **Core:** Incorporate exercises with resistance (e.g., weighted Russian twists).

**Example – Week 6, Day 4 (Upper Body):**

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1.
* **Workout:**
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Hammer Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Triceps Dips (using a chair): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 secs)
    *  Rear Delt Flyes: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest 45 secs)
    *  Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 secs) – *Superset with Face Pulls*
* **Cool-down:** Same as Week 1.

**Weeks 8-10:  Peak & Maintain**

* **Strength Training:** Focus on heavier weights with lower reps (6-8 reps) for some exercises to build strength. Continue to incorporate supersets and variations.
* **Cardio:** Maintain cardio intensity and duration.  Consider adding one longer cardio session per week (45-60 minutes).
* **Core:** Continue challenging your core with advanced exercises.

**Example – Week 9, Day 3 (Full Body):**

* **Warm-up:** Same as Week 1.
* **Workout:**
    * Deadlifts: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Rest 90 secs) – *Focus on perfect form!*
    * Bench Press: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (Rest 90 secs)
    * Pull-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60 secs)
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
    *  Plank with Shoulder Taps: 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cool-down:** Same as Week 1.



---

**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing the 10-week program! Remember that fitness is a journey, not a destination. Continue to prioritize consistency, proper form, and a healthy lifestyle.  Don’t be afraid to experiment with new exercises and challenges to keep things interesting.  I am proud of your dedication, and I hope this program has helped you achieve your goals.  Keep pushing yourself, stay motivated, and enjoy the process!  If you have any questions or need further guidance, don’t hesitate to reach out.  Good luck!

## Running for Stress Relief: 2-Week Intermediate Program – with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed to harness the power of running, not for speed or distance, but for *stress relief*.  We'll focus on mindful movement, breathing techniques, and enjoying the process. As your trainer, I, Maria Kuznetsova, will guide you through this journey. Remember, consistency is key, but listening to your body is paramount. This program is for intermediate runners – meaning you can comfortably run for at least 20 minutes without stopping.  Adjust as needed!  

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on running days. Consider electrolyte drinks for runs longer than 25 minutes.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on whole, unprocessed foods.  Prioritize complex carbohydrates for energy, lean protein for recovery, and healthy fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Magnesium glycinate can aid in muscle recovery and relaxation.  Consider Vitamin D, especially during winter months. *Always consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:**  Sleep 7-9 hours per night.  Active recovery (walking, yoga) is encouraged on rest days.  Foam rolling is your friend!
* **Listen to Your Body:** Pain is a signal.  Don’t push through it.  Modify exercises or take a rest day if needed.
* **Mindfulness:** This isn't about beating your personal best. It’s about being present, connecting with your breath, and letting go of stress with each stride.



---

**Week 1: Building a Foundation of Calm**

**Day 1: Gentle Introduction & Breathing Focus (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretches – arm circles (20 reps forward/backward), leg swings (10 reps each leg, forward/sideways), torso twists (15 reps).
* **Run/Walk Intervals (20 minutes):** 2 minutes run at a conversational pace, 1 minute walk. Repeat 6 times.  Focus on deep, diaphragmatic breathing during the run – inhale through your nose, exhale through your mouth.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches – hamstring stretch (30 seconds each leg), quad stretch (30 seconds each leg), calf stretch (30 seconds each leg), shoulder stretch (30 seconds each arm).
* **Notes:**  Focus on your form – relaxed shoulders, upright posture, gentle foot strike.  Hydrate with water post-run.

**Day 2:  Hill Repeats for Mental Resilience (Tuesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Brisk walking uphill, followed by dynamic stretches.
* **Hill Repeats (20 minutes):** Find a moderate incline hill. Run *up* the hill at a comfortably challenging pace for 30 seconds. Walk *down* the hill for 60 seconds. Repeat 8 times.  Visualize leaving your stress at the bottom of the hill with each ascent.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking on flat ground, static stretches (focus on calves and hamstrings).
* **Notes:**  Maintain good form even when fatigued.  Don’t sprint up the hill – controlled effort is key.

**Day 3:  Active Recovery – Yoga for Runners (Wednesday)**

* **Yoga (30 minutes):**  Focus on poses that improve flexibility and promote relaxation. Include: Cat-Cow, Downward-Facing Dog, Warrior II, Triangle Pose, Child’s Pose, and Savasana (Corpse Pose – 5 minutes).  Numerous free yoga for runners videos are available online.
* **Notes:**  This is a rest day for running muscles, but an active day for recovery.  Focus on your breath throughout the yoga practice.

**Day 4:  Easy Pace, Mindful Awareness (Thursday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light jogging, dynamic stretches.
* **Easy Run (25 minutes):** Run at a very comfortable pace where you can easily hold a conversation.  Practice mindful running – pay attention to your surroundings, the feeling of your feet on the ground, and your breath.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  This run is about enjoyment, not intensity.  If you find yourself thinking about stressful things, gently redirect your focus back to your body and your surroundings.

**Day 5:  Interval Training with Positive Affirmations (Friday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jogging, dynamic stretches.
* **Intervals (20 minutes):** 1 minute run at a slightly faster pace, 2 minutes walk. Repeat 6 times. During the running intervals, silently repeat a positive affirmation (e.g., "I am strong," "I am capable," "I am at peace").
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:** The affirmations are designed to boost your mood and counteract negative thoughts.

**Day 6:  Longer Slow Distance (Saturday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Brisk walk, dynamic stretches.
* **Slow Run (30 minutes):** Maintain a conversational pace. This is about time on your feet, not speed.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Choose a scenic route to enhance the stress-relieving benefits.



---

**Week 2: Deepening the Connection & Building Endurance**

**Day 7:  Tempo Run with Focused Breathing (Monday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jogging, dynamic stretches.
* **Tempo Run (20 minutes):**  Run at a comfortably hard pace (you should be able to say a few words, but not hold a full conversation) for 10 minutes.  Walk for 5 minutes. Run at the same tempo for another 5 minutes. Focus on controlled, rhythmic breathing.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Tempo runs build endurance and mental toughness.  Don’t push yourself too hard – maintain a sustainable pace.

**Day 8:  Fartlek Training – Playful Speed (Tuesday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jogging, dynamic stretches.
* **Fartlek (25 minutes):** “Speed play” – alternate between short bursts of faster running and periods of easy jogging. Example: Run fast for 30 seconds, jog for 1 minute, run fast for 1 minute, jog for 2 minutes, repeat. Vary the duration of the fast and slow intervals.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Fartlek is a fun way to improve speed and endurance without the pressure of structured intervals.

**Day 9:  Active Recovery – Foam Rolling & Stretching (Wednesday)**

* **Foam Rolling (20 minutes):** Focus on major muscle groups – quads, hamstrings, calves, glutes, back.
* **Static Stretching (10 minutes):** Hold each stretch for 30-60 seconds.
* **Notes:**  This is a crucial day for muscle recovery and injury prevention.

**Day 10:  Trail Running – Nature Immersion (Thursday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Walking, dynamic stretches.
* **Trail Run (25 minutes):**  Run on a soft trail. The uneven terrain will challenge your muscles and provide a mental break from the monotony of road running.  Pay attention to the sights, sounds, and smells of nature.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Wear appropriate trail running shoes. Be mindful of your surroundings and potential hazards.

**Day 11:  Intervals with Gratitude Practice (Friday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jogging, dynamic stretches.
* **Intervals (20 minutes):** 90 seconds run at a challenging pace, 2 minutes walk. Repeat 5 times. During the walking intervals, think of three things you are grateful for.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Gratitude is a powerful stress reliever.

**Day 12:  Longer Slow Distance – Reflective Run (Saturday)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Brisk walk, dynamic stretches.
* **Slow Run (35 minutes):** Maintain a conversational pace. Use this time to reflect on your week, your goals, and your accomplishments.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Walking, static stretches.
* **Notes:**  Consider running in a quiet location where you can enjoy your thoughts.



**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing this 2-week program! Remember that running for stress relief is a journey, not a destination. Continue to incorporate running into your routine, and don’t be afraid to experiment with different routes, paces, and mindfulness techniques.  Prioritize self-care, listen to your body, and enjoy the process.  I am here to support you – feel free to reach out with any questions or concerns.  Keep running, keep breathing, and keep finding your calm.

## Competition Preparation & Rehabilitation: 5-Week Beginner Bodybuilding Program - Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for beginner bodybuilders aiming for competition preparation *while simultaneously* addressing rehabilitation needs. It prioritizes building a foundational strength base, proper form, and muscle recovery.  It acknowledges that rehabilitation requires a cautious and progressive approach, so intensity will be carefully managed.  We'll focus on full-body workouts initially, gradually increasing volume and introducing isolation exercises.  This program assumes a basic level of mobility and no acute injuries. *Always consult with a physician before starting any new exercise program.*

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:**  A protein-rich diet (around 1 gram per pound of bodyweight) is crucial for muscle recovery and growth.  Focus on whole, unprocessed foods. Consider a creatine supplement (3-5g daily) *after consulting with a healthcare professional*.
* **Sleep:** Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep each night.
* **Recovery:** Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) is vital. Listen to your body and take rest days when needed.  Foam rolling is highly recommended.
* **Form over Weight:**  Prioritize perfect form over lifting heavy weight. This is especially critical during rehabilitation.
* **Progressive Overload:**  Gradually increase weight, reps, or sets each week as you get stronger.  Small increments are key.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

*Focus: Establishing proper form, building core stability, and improving range of motion.*

**Day 1: Full Body - Form Focus**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes of light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (bodyweight or light dumbbells), 60 sec rest.
* Push-ups (knees on the ground if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm, 60 sec rest.
* Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: 5 minutes of static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds).
* Notes: Focus on controlled movements.  Record your reps to track progress.

**Day 2: Active Recovery**
* 30 minutes of light cardio (walking, cycling).
* 15 minutes of foam rolling (legs, back, shoulders).

**Day 3: Upper Body - Light Weight**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes of cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 4: Lower Body & Core**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes of cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg, 60 sec rest.
* Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 5: Rest**

**Day 6: Full Body Circuit**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes of cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Circuit (repeat 3 times with 60 seconds rest between circuits):
    * Bodyweight Squats: 10 reps
    * Push-ups (modified if needed): AMRAP
    * Dumbbell Rows: 10 reps per arm
    * Plank: 30 seconds
    * Jumping Jacks: 20 reps
* Cool-down: Static stretching.




---

**Week 2: Increasing Volume**

*Focus: Building upon the foundation, increasing sets and reps slightly.*

**Day 8: Full Body - Increased Volume**
* Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 1.
* Squats: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Push-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per arm, 60 sec rest.
* Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45-60 seconds, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 9: Active Recovery**
* 40 minutes of light cardio.
* 20 minutes of foam rolling.

**Day 10: Upper Body - Adding Weight**
* Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 3.
* Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest. *Increase weight if possible.*
* Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest. *Increase weight if possible.*
* Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 11: Lower Body & Core - Adding Weight**
* Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 4.
* Lunges: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per leg, 60 sec rest. *Add dumbbells if comfortable.*
* Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest. *Add a resistance band around thighs.*
* Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest. *Add weight if possible.*
* Crunches: 3 sets of 20-25 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 12: Rest**

**Day 13: Full Body Circuit - Increased Intensity**
* Warm-up: Same as Week 1, Day 6.
* Circuit (repeat 4 times with 60 seconds rest between circuits):
    * Bodyweight Squats: 12 reps
    * Push-ups (modified if needed): AMRAP
    * Dumbbell Rows: 12 reps per arm
    * Plank: 45 seconds
    * Jumping Jacks: 25 reps
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

---

**Week 3: Isolation Exercises & Controlled Tempo**

*Focus: Introducing isolation exercises to target specific muscle groups and emphasizing controlled movements.*

**Day 15: Chest & Triceps - Tempo Focus**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (2-1-2 tempo – 2 seconds lowering, 1 second pause, 2 seconds lifting), 75 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Flyes: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Triceps Pushdowns (with resistance band): 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Overhead Dumbbell Triceps Extension: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 16: Back & Biceps**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Lat Pulldowns (using resistance band anchored overhead): 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 75 sec rest.
* Seated Cable Rows (resistance band): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Hammer Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Cool-down: Static stretching.

**Day 17: Legs & Shoulders**
* Warm-up: 5 minutes cardio + dynamic stretching.
* Goblet Squats (holding dumbbell): 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 75 sec rest.
* Romanian Deadlifts (light dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 60 sec rest.
* Lateral Raises: 3 sets

## 5-Week Beginner Boxing/Martial Arts Competition & Health Improvement Program – Coached by Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for individuals new to boxing and martial arts, aiming to build a foundation for potential competition while significantly improving overall health and fitness. We'll focus on technique, endurance, strength, and flexibility, gradually increasing intensity over the 5 weeks.  Consistency is key! Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and don't hesitate to modify exercises if needed.  Remember to consult your physician before starting any new exercise program.

**Important Notes Throughout:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days. Consider electrolyte replenishment after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in lean protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Avoid processed foods, sugary drinks, and excessive saturated/trans fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):** A multivitamin can be beneficial. Consider creatine (after week 3, 3-5g daily) for power output if cleared by a doctor.  Protein powder can aid recovery.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) is encouraged on rest days.  Foam rolling can help alleviate muscle soreness.
* **Form over Speed:**  Always prioritize correct technique. Incorrect form can lead to injuries. Watch videos and practice in front of a mirror.
* **Maria’s Motivation:** "Believe in yourself! Progress isn't always linear. Some days will be harder than others, but every workout brings you closer to your goals. Stay dedicated, stay focused, and enjoy the journey!"



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Technique** (Focus: Learning basic stances, punches, footwork)

**Day 1 (Monday – 25 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks (30 sec), High knees (30 sec), Butt kicks (30 sec), Arm circles (forward & backward – 30 sec each), Dynamic stretches (leg swings, torso twists – 1 min).
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Stance & Footwork Drill:** Shadow boxing, focusing on proper stance (feet shoulder-width apart, knees bent, weight balanced) and basic forward/backward/lateral movement (5 mins).
    * **Jab Practice:**  Jab with proper form (extend lead hand straight, rotate fist at the end) – 3 sets of 10 reps per arm, 30 sec rest.
    * **Cross Practice:** Cross with proper form (extend rear hand straight, rotate fist at the end) – 3 sets of 10 reps per arm, 30 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches (hold each for 30 sec) – Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch.

**Day 2 (Wednesday – 20 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (10 mins):**
    * **Combination Drill:** Jab-Cross combination – 3 sets of 8 reps, 45 sec rest. Focus on smooth transitions.
    * **Core Work:** Plank (30 sec hold, 3 sets), Crunches (15 reps, 3 sets), Russian Twists (10 reps per side, 3 sets).
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 3 (Friday – 25 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Day 1.
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Footwork Ladder Drill (if available, otherwise shadow box with footwork focus):**  Various footwork patterns (in-in-out-out, lateral shuffles) – 5 mins.
    * **Jab-Cross-Hook (Beginner Hook - slight bend in elbow, rotate body) Practice:** 3 sets of 6 reps per side, 60 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.



---

### **Week 2: Building Endurance & Power** (Focus: Increasing round duration, introducing basic defensive moves)

**Day 1 (Monday – 30 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Similar to Week 1, adding jump rope (1 min).
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * **Shadow Boxing Rounds:** 3 rounds of 2 minutes with 1-minute rest. Focus on maintaining proper form and incorporating Jab, Cross, and Hook.
    * **Slip Drill:** Practice slipping punches (moving head off-line) – 3 sets of 10 slips per side, 30 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 2 (Wednesday – 25 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Week 1.
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Combination Drill:** Jab-Cross-Hook-Jab – 3 sets of 6 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * **Core Work:** Plank (45 sec hold, 3 sets), Bicycle Crunches (15 reps per side, 3 sets), Leg Raises (15 reps, 3 sets).
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 3 (Friday – 30 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Week 1, adding shadow boxing with defensive movements.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * **Partner Drill (Light Contact – focus on technique):** Partner holds pads, you practice Jab-Cross combinations (3 rounds of 1 minute, 1-minute rest). *If no partner, continue shadow boxing with increased intensity.*
    * **Push-ups:** 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 45 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.



---

### **Week 3:  Introducing Combinations & Reflexes** (Focus: More complex combinations, reaction drills)

**Day 1 (Monday – 30 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jump rope (2 mins), Dynamic stretches.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * **Shadow Boxing Rounds:** 4 rounds of 2.5 minutes with 1-minute rest. Incorporate all learned punches and footwork.
    * **Reaction Drill (with partner or using a tennis ball):** Partner throws slow, predictable punches (or bounces a tennis ball), you practice blocking/slipping/parrying – 5 mins.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 2 (Wednesday – 25 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Week 1.
* **Workout (15 mins):**
    * **Combination Drill:** Jab-Cross-Hook-Cross-Jab – 3 sets of 8 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * **Core Work:** Plank with shoulder taps (30 sec, 3 sets), Flutter Kicks (20 reps, 3 sets), Supermans (15 reps, 3 sets).
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 3 (Friday – 30 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Week 1.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * **Partner Drill (Light Contact):** Partner holds pads, you practice various combinations (Jab-Cross-Hook, Cross-Hook-Cross) – 4 rounds of 1 minute, 1-minute rest.
    * **Squats:** 3 sets of 12 reps, 45 sec rest.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.



---

### **Week 4:  Increasing Intensity & Sparring Preparation** (Focus:  Conditioning, simulated sparring, refining technique)

**Day 1 (Monday – 30 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jump rope (3 mins), Dynamic stretches.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * **Interval Training:**  High-intensity shadow boxing (30 sec) followed by active recovery (30 sec) – 8 rounds.
    * **Defensive Footwork Drill:**  Practice circling and pivoting, maintaining a good guard – 5 mins.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 2 (Wednesday – 25 mins):**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Similar to Week 1.

    * **Combination Drill:**  Longer, more complex combinations (e.g., Jab-Cross-Hook-Cross-Jab-Hook) – 3 sets of 6 reps, 75 sec rest.
    * **Core Work:**  Russian Twists with weight (if available) – 3 sets of 15 reps per side.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.
