## Functional Training for Competition Preparation: 2-Week Beginner Program – Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Program Overview:** This 2-week program is designed to build a foundational level of functional fitness, preparing you for more advanced competition training. We'll focus on movements that mimic real-life activities, improving strength, endurance, balance, and coordination.  It's crucial to listen to your body and modify exercises as needed. Consistency is key! Remember, proper form is *always* more important than lifting heavy or doing more reps.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days. Consider electrolyte replenishment after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Fuel your body for performance and recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  A daily multivitamin can be beneficial.  Creatine (3-5g daily) can aid in strength and power development, but consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.  Protein powder can help meet daily protein needs.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours).  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.  Consider foam rolling for muscle soreness.
* **Disclaimer:** This program is a general guideline. Consult your doctor before starting any new exercise program.



---

**Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Day 1: Lower Body & Core – Monday (40 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching – Arm circles (20 reps forward/backward), Leg swings (10 reps each leg, forward/sideways), Torso twists (15 reps each side), High knees (20 reps), Butt kicks (20 reps).
* **Workout:**
    * **Bodyweight Squats:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest. *Focus on maintaining a straight back and pushing your hips back as if sitting in a chair.*
    * **Glute Bridges:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 60 sec rest. *Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.*
    * **Walking Lunges:** 3 sets of 10 reps per leg, 60 sec rest. *Keep your front knee behind your toes.*
    * **Plank:** 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds, 60 sec rest. *Maintain a straight line from head to heels.*
    * **Bird Dog:** 3 sets of 10 reps per side, 60 sec rest. *Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.*
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching – Quadriceps stretch (30 sec each leg), Hamstring stretch (30 sec each leg), Calf stretch (30 sec each leg), Lower back stretch (30 sec).
* **Note:** Focus on proper form. If squats are difficult, start with box squats (squatting down to a chair).

**Day 2: Upper Body & Core – Wednesday (35 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Arm circles, Shoulder rotations, Wrist rotations, Cat-cow stretch (10 reps).
* **Workout:**
    * **Wall Push-ups:** 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60 sec rest. *Modify to incline push-ups if wall push-ups become too easy.*
    * **Dumbbell Rows (light weight - 5-8lbs):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm, 60 sec rest. *Keep your back straight and pull with your back muscles.*
    * **Overhead Press (light weight - 3-5lbs):** 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 60 sec rest. *Maintain a stable core and avoid arching your back.*
    * **Crunches:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest. *Focus on contracting your abdominal muscles.*
    * **Russian Twists (no weight):** 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 45 sec rest. *Engage your core and twist from side to side.*
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Triceps stretch (30 sec each arm), Chest stretch (30 sec), Shoulder stretch (30 sec each arm).
* **Note:** Choose a weight that allows you to maintain good form throughout the entire set.

**Day 3: Full Body Circuit – Friday (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks (30 reps), High knees (20 reps), Butt kicks (20 reps), Arm circles.
* **Circuit (Repeat 3 times with 2 minutes rest between rounds):**
    * **Squats:** 10 reps
    * **Push-ups (wall or incline):** 8 reps
    * **Dumbbell Rows:** 10 reps per arm
    * **Plank:** Hold for 30 seconds
    * **Walking Lunges:** 10 reps per leg
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Full body static stretching – Hold each stretch for 30 seconds.
* **Note:** Focus on maintaining a consistent pace throughout the circuit.



---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Complexity**

**Day 4: Lower Body & Core – Monday (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretching – Similar to Day 1, but add hip circles (10 reps each direction).
* **Workout:**
    * **Bodyweight Squats:** 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * **Glute Bridges (with band around knees):** 3 sets of 20-25 reps, 60 sec rest. *The band adds resistance, engaging the glutes more.*
    * **Reverse Lunges:** 3 sets of 10 reps per leg, 60 sec rest. *More challenging than walking lunges.*
    * **Side Plank:** 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds per side, 60 sec rest. *Strengthens obliques.*
    * **Dead Bug:** 3 sets of 10 reps per side, 60 sec rest. *Focus on maintaining core engagement.*
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching – Similar to Day 1.
* **Note:**  Focus on controlled movements.  If you have knee pain, modify lunges to a shorter range of motion.

**Day 5: Upper Body & Core – Wednesday (40 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Arm circles, Shoulder rotations, Wrist rotations, Scapular retractions (15 reps).
* **Workout:**
    * **Incline Push-ups:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest. *Progress from wall push-ups.*
    * **Dumbbell Rows (slightly heavier weight - 8-10lbs):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm, 60 sec rest.
    * **Overhead Press (slightly heavier weight - 5-8lbs):** 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * **Bicycle Crunches:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 45 sec rest. *More challenging than regular crunches.*
    * **Leg Raises:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest. *Focus on controlling the movement.*
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Triceps stretch, Chest stretch, Shoulder stretch.
* **Note:**  Increase weight only if you can maintain good form.

**Day 6: Full Body Circuit – Friday (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, High knees, Butt kicks, Mountain climbers (20 reps).
* **Circuit (Repeat 4 times with 2 minutes rest between rounds):**
    * **Squats:** 12 reps
    * **Push-ups (incline or knee push-ups):** 10 reps
    * **Dumbbell Rows:** 12 reps per arm
    * **Plank:** Hold for 45 seconds
    * **Reverse Lunges:** 10 reps per leg
    * **Burpees (modified – no push-up):** 8 reps
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Full body static stretching.
* **Note:**  Burpees are a challenging exercise. Modify by stepping back instead of jumping.

**Day 7: Active Recovery – Sunday (30 minutes)**

* **Activity:** Light cardio – Walking, cycling, swimming at a comfortable pace.
* **Stretching:** Focus on holding each stretch for 30-60 seconds.
* **Foam Rolling:** Spend 10-15 minutes foam rolling major muscle groups.
* **Note:** This day is about recovery and preparing your body for the next phase of training.  Listen to your body and don't push yourself too hard.



---

**Progression:** After completing these two weeks, you'll be ready to progress to more challenging exercises

## Rehabilitation Strength Training Program – 10 Weeks (Ivan Orlov, ACE, Advanced)

**Program Overview:** This 10-week program is designed to guide individuals through a progressive rehabilitation strength training journey. It’s adaptable for all levels, focusing on rebuilding strength, improving mobility, and reducing pain.  Listen to your body, and *always* prioritize proper form over weight or repetitions.  This program assumes you've received clearance from a medical professional to begin exercise.  If you experience pain beyond typical muscle soreness, *stop* and consult your doctor or physical therapist.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a protein supplement (whey, casein, or plant-based) post-workout to aid muscle recovery.
* **Sleep:** Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider Vitamin D, Magnesium, and Omega-3 fatty acids for overall health and recovery. *Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Active recovery (light cardio like walking or swimming) on rest days is encouraged.  Foam rolling and stretching are also beneficial.
* **Progression:** The program is designed to be progressive.  Increase weight, reps, or sets *only* when you can maintain proper form throughout the entire exercise.
* **RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion):**  We’ll use RPE on a scale of 1-10, where 1 is resting and 10 is maximal effort. Aim for an RPE of 5-7 during most sets.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility (Focus: Pain Reduction & Range of Motion)**

* **Frequency:** 5 days/week (Mon, Tue, Thu, Fri, Sat)
* **Duration:** 30-45 minutes

**Day 1 (Monday): Upper Body – Gentle Activation**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min light cardio (walking), arm circles, shoulder rotations.
* **Exercises:**
    * Wall Slides: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
    * Band Pull-Aparts: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
    * Seated Rows (light resistance band): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (RPE 4-5) - Rest 60s
    * Bicep Curls (light dumbbells/band): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (RPE 4-5) - Rest 60s
* **Cool-down:** 5 min static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds): chest stretch, tricep stretch, bicep stretch.
* **Note:** Focus on controlled movements and pain-free range of motion.

**Day 2 (Tuesday): Lower Body – Stability & Activation**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min light cardio (walking), leg swings, ankle rotations.
* **Exercises:**
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
    * Bodyweight Squats (assisted if needed): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (RPE 4-5) - Rest 60s
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
    * Hamstring Curls (band): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (RPE 4-5) - Rest 60s
* **Cool-down:** 5 min static stretching: hamstring stretch, quad stretch, calf stretch.

**Day 3 (Thursday): Core & Stability**
* **Warm-up:** 5 min light cardio, cat-cow stretch, torso twists.
* **Exercises:**
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
    * Plank (modified on knees if needed): 3 sets, hold for 20-30 seconds (RPE 4-5) - Rest 60s
    * Dead Bugs: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side (RPE 3-4) - Rest 60s
* **Cool-down:** 5 min static stretching: lower back stretch, side bend.

**Day 4 (Friday): Full Body – Integration**
* Repeat exercises from Days 1 & 2, reducing reps if fatigued.

**Day 5 (Saturday): Active Recovery**
* 20-30 min light walking or swimming. Foam rolling of major muscle groups.



---

**Week 2-4: Progressive Strengthening (Focus: Building Endurance & Control)**

* **Frequency:** 6 days/week (Mon-Sat)
* **Duration:** 45-60 minutes
* **Progression:** Increase weight/resistance slightly each week if form is maintained. Add one rep per set each week.

* **Days 1 & 2:**  Upper Body – Increase resistance band strength or dumbbell weight. Add incline dumbbell press (light).
* **Days 3 & 4:** Lower Body – Progress to goblet squats (light dumbbell). Add lunges (assisted if needed).
* **Day 5:** Core & Stability – Increase plank hold time. Add Russian Twists (no weight or light weight).
* **Day 6:** Full Body – Circuit training combining exercises from previous days. 3 rounds, 60 seconds rest between rounds.

**Key additions during these weeks:**

* **Incline Dumbbell Press:** 3 sets of 8-12 reps.
* **Goblet Squats:** 3 sets of 8-12 reps.
* **Lunges (assisted):** 3 sets of 8-10 reps per leg.
* **Russian Twists:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps.




---

**Week 5-7: Increasing Strength & Stability (Focus: Building Power & Functionality)**

* **Frequency:** 6 days/week
* **Duration:** 50-60 minutes
* **Progression:** Continue increasing weight/resistance. Introduce more challenging variations of exercises.

* **Days 1 & 2:**  Upper Body – Add push-ups (modified on knees if needed). Introduce overhead press (light dumbbells).
* **Days 3 & 4:** Lower Body – Progress to Romanian Deadlifts (light weight). Add step-ups.
* **Day 5:** Core & Stability – Add side planks. Introduce bicycle crunches.
* **Day 6:** Full Body – Focus on compound movements like squats with overhead press and lunges with bicep curls.

**Key additions during these weeks:**

* **Push-ups (modified):** 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP).
* **Overhead Press:** 3 sets of 8-12 reps.
* **Romanian Deadlifts:** 3 sets of 8-12 reps.
* **Step-ups:** 3 sets of 8-10 reps per leg.
* **Side Planks:** 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds per side.
* **Bicycle Crunches:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps.




---

**Week 8-10:  Consolidation & Maintenance (Focus:  Refining Technique & Long-Term Sustainability)**

* **Frequency:** 5-6 days/week
* **Duration:** 45-60 minutes
* **Progression:** Focus on maintaining strength gains and refining technique.  Introduce plyometric exercises (jumping jacks, box step-ups) if appropriate and pain-free.

* **Days 1 & 2:** Upper Body – Continue with established exercises, focusing on controlled movements and full range of motion.
* **Days 3 & 4:** Lower Body – Continue with established exercises, adding plyometric variations.
* **Day 5:** Core & Stability – Focus on challenging core exercises and maintaining stability.
* **Day 6 (Optional):** Active Recovery or Full Body Circuit.

**Key Considerations:**

* **Plyometrics (if appropriate):** Start with low-impact variations and gradually increase intensity.
* **Mindful Movement:** Pay attention to your body and adjust exercises as needed.
* **Long-Term Planning:**  Develop a plan for continuing your strength training routine after the 10 weeks are complete.



**Final Note:** This program is a guideline.  Individual needs and progress will vary.  Listen to your body, be patient, and celebrate your achievements along the way.  Consistent effort and proper technique are key to a successful rehabilitation journey.  I, Ivan Orlov, am here to support you.  Don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.  You've got this!

## 5-Week Beginner Swimming Program for Endurance & Stress Relief – with Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Welcome!** I’m Anna Smirnova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen to embark on this journey to improved endurance and stress relief through swimming. This program is designed for beginners, focusing on building a solid foundation and fostering a love for the water. Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and enjoy the process! Consistency is key, but don’t hesitate to adjust the schedule if needed.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, especially before, during, and after your swims.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and whole grains. Consider a light carbohydrate snack 30-60 minutes before your swim for energy.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Magnesium can aid in muscle recovery and stress reduction. Consult with your doctor before starting any new supplements.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours) and active recovery (light stretching, walking) on your rest days. Epsom salt baths can also help soothe muscles.
* **Form over Speed:**  Always prioritize correct technique. Poor form can lead to injuries. Watch videos, consider a lesson or two with a swim instructor, and focus on efficiency.
* **Breathing:**  Mastering rhythmic breathing is crucial. Exhale fully underwater and inhale quickly and efficiently during your turns.



---

### **Week 1: Building the Foundation (2 Swims)**

**Goal:** Familiarization with the water, basic technique, and building comfort.

**Day 1 (Monday): Introduction to Water Comfort & Freestyle Basics (60 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * Light cardio: 2 lengths easy swim (any stroke)
    * Dynamic stretching: Arm circles (forward & backward – 10 reps each), Leg swings (forward & sideways – 10 reps each), Torso twists (10 reps each side).
* **Main Set (35 mins):**
    * Kickboard drills: 4 x 25m kick with board, focusing on streamlined body position. (Rest: 20 seconds between each)
    * Freestyle with focus on body position: 4 x 25m freestyle, concentrating on keeping your body horizontal and rotating from side to side. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * Freestyle with focus on arm recovery: 4 x 25m freestyle, emphasizing a high elbow recovery. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * Breathing practice: 4 x 25m freestyle, alternating breathing every 3 strokes. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy freestyle.
    * Static stretching: Shoulder stretches, triceps stretches, hamstring stretches (hold each for 30 seconds).
* **Notes:** Focus on relaxing in the water. Don’t worry about speed.  Pay attention to your breathing.

**Day 2 (Thursday): Backstroke Introduction & Endurance Building (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * Light cardio: 2 lengths easy swim (any stroke)
    * Dynamic stretching: Shoulder rotations, back extensions, hip circles.
* **Main Set (25 mins):**
    * Backstroke kickboard: 4 x 25m backstroke kick with board, maintaining a straight body line. (Rest: 20 seconds between each)
    * Backstroke with focus on arm motion: 4 x 25m backstroke, concentrating on a smooth arm pull and recovery. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * Freestyle: 4 x 50m freestyle at a comfortable pace. (Rest: 45 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy backstroke.
    * Static stretching: Back stretches, shoulder stretches, quad stretches (hold each for 30 seconds).
* **Notes:** Backstroke requires good body awareness. Focus on keeping your hips high and rotating your shoulders.



---

### **Week 2: Refining Technique & Increasing Distance (2 Swims)**

**Goal:** Improve freestyle and backstroke technique, and gradually increase swimming distance.

**Day 3 (Monday): Freestyle Focus – Drills & Distance (60 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * 4 x 25m freestyle, easy pace.
    * Dynamic stretching: Arm circles, torso twists, leg swings.
* **Main Set (35 mins):**
    * Catch-up drill: 4 x 25m freestyle, one arm extends forward while the other completes its pull. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * Fingertip drag drill: 4 x 25m freestyle, drag your fingertips along the water surface during the recovery phase. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * 4 x 50m freestyle, building pace gradually. (Rest: 45 seconds between each)
    * 2 x 75m freestyle, maintaining a consistent pace. (Rest: 60 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy freestyle.
    * Static stretching: Shoulder, triceps, and lat stretches.
* **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining a high elbow during the pull phase.

**Day 4 (Thursday): Backstroke & Mixed Stroke (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * 4 x 25m backstroke, easy pace.
    * Dynamic stretching: Shoulder rotations, back extensions.
* **Main Set (25 mins):**
    * 4 x 25m backstroke, focusing on body rotation. (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
    * 2 x 50m backstroke, maintaining a consistent pace. (Rest: 45 seconds between each)
    * 4 x 25m Freestyle / 25m Backstroke (alternate strokes). (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy backstroke.
    * Static stretching: Back, shoulder, and hamstring stretches.
* **Notes:**  Think about pressing your chest up towards the surface in backstroke.



---

### **Week 3: Building Endurance & Introducing Breaststroke (2 Swims)**

**Goal:** Increase continuous swimming distance and introduce the basics of breaststroke.

**Day 5 (Monday): Endurance Freestyle (60 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * 4 x 50m freestyle, easy pace.
    * Dynamic stretching: Full body mobility exercises.
* **Main Set (35 mins):**
    * 1 x 150m freestyle, continuous swim, moderate pace. (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * 2 x 100m freestyle, moderate pace. (Rest: 60 seconds between each)
    * 4 x 50m freestyle, building speed. (Rest: 45 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy freestyle.
    * Static stretching: Full body stretching.
* **Notes:** Focus on maintaining good form even as you fatigue.

**Day 6 (Thursday): Breaststroke Introduction & Mixed Set (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):**
    * 4 x 25m freestyle, easy pace.
    * Dynamic stretching: Arm circles, leg swings.
* **Main Set (25 mins):**
    * Breaststroke kickboard: 4 x 25m breaststroke kick with board, focusing on the whip kick. (Rest: 20 seconds between each)
    * Breaststroke pull with board: 4 x 25m breaststroke pull with board, focusing on the arm pull and glide. (Rest: 20 seconds between each)
    * 4 x 25m Freestyle / 25m Breaststroke (alternate strokes). (Rest: 30 seconds between each)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**
    * Easy swim: 2 lengths easy freestyle.
    * Static stretching: Hamstring, quad, and chest stretches.
* **Notes:** Breaststroke is a technically demanding stroke. Focus on the coordination of the arms, legs, and breathing.



---

### **Week 4: Increasing Intensity & Refining Breaststroke (2 Swims)**

**Goal:** Increase swimming intensity and improve breaststroke technique.

## Functional Training for Stress Relief: 5-Week Beginner Program - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen to prioritize your well-being. This program is designed specifically for beginners looking to leverage functional training to reduce stress and build a healthier, more resilient you.  Functional training focuses on movements that mimic everyday activities, improving strength, balance, and coordination – all while promoting mindfulness and stress reduction. We’ll be moving 3-4 times a week, focusing on quality over quantity, and listening to your body.  Remember, consistency is key, and progress, not perfection, is our goal.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Consult your doctor:** Before starting any new fitness program, please consult with your physician.
* **Listen to your body:**  Pain is a signal.  Modify exercises or rest if you experience discomfort.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially before, during, and after workouts. Aim for at least 8 glasses daily.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in whole foods, lean protein, and healthy fats.  Consider a magnesium supplement (consult with a healthcare professional) as magnesium is often depleted during stress.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours) and incorporate active recovery days (gentle walking, stretching, yoga) into your routine.
* **Mindfulness:**  Focus on your breath during exercises.  This helps ground you in the present moment and reduce stress.



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Body Awareness**

This week focuses on establishing proper form and building a foundation of strength and stability. We'll emphasize bodyweight exercises and gentle movements.

**Day 1 (Monday):  Grounding & Core Activation (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Arm circles (forward & backward – 10 reps each), leg swings (forward & sideways – 10 reps each leg), torso twists (10 reps each side).
* **Workout:**
    * **Cat-Cow Stretch:** 10 reps, slow and controlled. (Rest 30 sec)
    * **Bird Dog:** 3 sets of 8 reps per side. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Glute Bridge:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Bodyweight Squats:** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Plank (on knees if needed):** 3 sets, hold for 20-30 seconds. (Rest 60 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Child's pose (30 seconds), hamstring stretch (30 seconds per leg), quad stretch (30 seconds per leg).
* **Notes:** Focus on engaging your core throughout each exercise.

**Day 2 (Wednesday):  Mobility & Gentle Strength (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Dynamic stretching - hip circles, shoulder rotations, wrist and ankle rotations.
* **Workout:**
    * **Wall Slides:** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Standing Rows with Resistance Band:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Reverse Lunges (assisted if needed):** 3 sets of 8 reps per leg. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Modified Push-ups (on knees):** 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP). (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Side Plank (on knees if needed):** 3 sets, hold for 20 seconds per side. (Rest 60 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Gentle spinal twists, deep breathing exercises.
* **Notes:**  Use a light resistance band for the standing rows. Focus on controlled movements.

**Day 3 (Friday):  Balance & Coordination (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Marching in place, high knees, butt kicks.
* **Workout:**
    * **Single Leg Stance:** 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds per leg. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Heel-to-Toe Walk:** 3 sets, 10 steps forward and back. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Bodyweight Squats with Overhead Reach:** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Supermans:** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Calf Raises:** 3 sets of 15 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Static stretches - hamstring stretch, calf stretch, shoulder stretch.
* **Notes:**  Have a chair or wall nearby for balance support during single-leg exercises.



---

### **Week 2:  Building Strength & Endurance**

This week we'll increase the intensity slightly by adding more reps and introducing new exercises.

**Day 1 (Monday): Core & Lower Body Focus (50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light cardio - jogging in place, jumping jacks (modified if needed).
* **Workout:**
    * **Glute Bridge with Band:** 3 sets of 15 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Bodyweight Squats:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Walking Lunges:** 3 sets of 10 reps per leg. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Plank:** 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Russian Twists (no weight):** 3 sets of 15 reps per side. (Rest 45 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Hip flexor stretch, hamstring stretch, lower back stretch.
* **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining proper form throughout the lunges.

**Day 2 (Wednesday):  Upper Body & Core Stability (50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Arm circles, shoulder rotations, wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * **Wall Push-ups:** 3 sets of AMRAP. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Resistance Band Rows:** 3 sets of 15 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Bicep Curls with Resistance Band:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Tricep Extensions with Resistance Band:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Dead Bug:** 3 sets of 10 reps per side. (Rest 45 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Tricep stretch, bicep stretch, shoulder stretch.
* **Notes:**  Increase resistance band tension if exercises become too easy.

**Day 3 (Friday):  Full Body Flow (50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Dynamic stretching - arm swings, leg swings, torso twists.
* **Workout:**
    * **Squat to Overhead Press (with light weight or no weight):** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Reverse Lunge with Twist:** 3 sets of 8 reps per leg. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Bird Dog:** 3 sets of 10 reps per side. (Rest 45 sec)
    * **Plank Jacks (modified if needed):** 3 sets of 10 reps. (Rest 60 sec)
    * **Supermans:** 3 sets of 12 reps. (Rest 45 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):**  Deep breathing exercises, gentle stretching.
* **Notes:**  Focus on connecting your breath with each movement.



---

### **Week 3-5: Progressive Overload & Refinement**

These weeks will build upon the foundation established in weeks 1 & 2. We’ll gradually increase the difficulty by:

* **Increasing reps/sets:**  Adding 1-2 reps or sets each week.
* **Increasing resistance:**  Using heavier resistance bands or adding light dumbbells (1-5 lbs).
* **Introducing more challenging variations:**  Progressing to more difficult exercise variations (e.g., from knee push-ups to full push-ups).
* **Decreasing rest intervals:**  Reducing rest intervals by 15-30 seconds.

**Key Focus:** Continue to prioritize form and listen to your body.  Don't be afraid to modify exercises as needed.  We'll also integrate more mindful movement and breathwork.

**(Detailed day-by-day schedules for weeks 3-5 will follow the same format as weeks 1 & 2, with incremental increases in difficulty.  I will provide a summary of the progression below, rather than repeating the full schedule for each day.)**

**Week 3:**

* **Focus:** Increasing reps and sets.  Introduce light dumbbells (1-3 lbs) for squats and overhead presses

## 10-Week Bodybuilding Program for Endurance & Weight Loss – Intermediate Level

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Goal:** Improve endurance, promote weight loss, and build lean muscle mass.

**Level:** Intermediate (comfortable with basic weightlifting exercises and possesses some existing fitness base)

**Duration:** 10 Weeks (70 Days)

**Frequency:** 5-6 times per week (allowing for adequate rest and recovery)

**Average Workout Duration:** 25-30 minutes (excluding warm-up & cool-down)

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:**  This program is most effective when paired with a calorie-controlled diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Aim for 0.8-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Consider a multivitamin, creatine (for performance), and a whey protein supplement to support muscle recovery. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Rest when needed. Don’t push through pain. Adjust the weight or intensity if you feel overwhelmed.
* **Progressive Overload:**  Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets each week to continue challenging your muscles.
* **Form Over Weight:** Maintaining proper form is crucial to prevent injuries. Watch videos and prioritize technique.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Consider active recovery days (light cardio, stretching, yoga).



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Activation**

*Focus: Establishing proper form, activating core, and building a baseline of endurance.*

* **Day 1: Full Body Circuit**
    * Warm-up: 5 min light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
    * Squats: 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Push-ups (knees or toes): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 12 reps per side (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Cool-down: 5 min static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds)
* **Day 2: Cardio & Core**
    * 20 minutes of moderate-intensity cardio (brisk walking, cycling, elliptical)
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
* **Day 3: Rest or Active Recovery** (light walk, yoga)
* **Day 4: Upper Body Focus**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
* **Day 5: Lower Body & Core**
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (light weight): 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
* **Day 6: Active Recovery** (Swimming, light cycling)

---

**Week 2-3: Building Strength & Endurance**

*Focus: Increasing weight/resistance, introducing new exercises, and improving cardio endurance.*

* **Days 1-6:**  Follow a similar structure to Week 1, but:
    * Increase weight/resistance by 5-10% if possible.
    * Introduce new exercises:
        * **Full Body:** Burpees (3 sets of 8-10 reps)
        * **Cardio:** Interval training (30 seconds high intensity, 60 seconds recovery x 10 rounds)
        * **Upper Body:**  Dumbbell Flyes (3 sets of 10-12 reps)
        * **Lower Body:** Glute Bridges (3 sets of 15-20 reps)
    *  Slightly increase cardio duration to 25 minutes.
    * Focus on controlled movements and maintaining proper form.



---

**Week 4-5: Intensification & Variety**

*Focus:  Increasing intensity, incorporating supersets, and challenging different muscle groups.*

* **Days 1-6:**
    * **Supersets:** Perform two exercises back-to-back with no rest in between.  Example: Squats followed immediately by Push-ups. Rest 60 seconds after the superset.
    * **Workout Split:**
        * **Day 1: Legs & Glutes** (Squats, Lunges, Romanian Deadlifts, Glute Bridges, Calf Raises)
        * **Day 2: Chest & Triceps** (Bench Press, Dumbbell Flyes, Triceps Extensions, Dips)
        * **Day 3: Back & Biceps** (Dumbbell Rows, Pull-ups (assisted if needed), Bicep Curls, Hammer Curls)
        * **Day 4: Cardio & Core** (30 min HIIT Cardio, Plank variations, Russian Twists, Leg Raises)
        * **Day 5: Shoulders & Arms** (Shoulder Press, Lateral Raises, Front Raises, Bicep Curls, Triceps Kickbacks)
        * **Day 6: Active Recovery** (Yoga, Stretching)
    * Increase weight/resistance where possible.



---

**Week 6-7:  Peak Endurance & Muscle Definition**

*Focus: High-rep training, circuit training, and refining muscle definition.*

* **Days 1-6:**
    * **Circuit Training:** Perform a series of exercises with minimal rest between exercises, and a longer rest period after completing the circuit.  Example: 5 exercises, 15-20 reps each, 30 seconds rest between exercises, 2 minutes rest after the circuit. Repeat 3-4 times.
    * **High-Rep Training:** Focus on 15-20 reps per set with a lighter weight.
    * **Cardio:** Incorporate incline walking or running to increase intensity.
    * **Nutrition:** Pay close attention to protein intake to support muscle recovery.



---

**Week 8-9:  Deload & Refocus**

*Focus:  Reducing intensity to allow for recovery and prevent plateaus.  Maintaining muscle mass while focusing on endurance.*

* **Days 1-6:**
    * Reduce weight/resistance by 20-30%.
    * Increase reps to 12-15.
    * Focus on form and controlled movements.
    * Incorporate more active recovery days.
    * Continue with cardio, but reduce intensity slightly.
    * **Mental Focus:** Reflect on your progress and set new goals for the final week.



---

**Week 10:  Test & Sustain**

*Focus:  Testing your progress, solidifying habits, and planning for long-term sustainability.*

* **Days 1-6:**
    * **Test Day (Day 1 or 2):**  Re-test your initial baseline measurements (weight lifted, reps completed, cardio endurance).
    * **Maintain Intensity:** Continue with the Week 8-9 routine, gradually increasing weight/resistance if you feel comfortable.
    * **Variety:** Introduce new exercises or workout formats to keep things interesting.
    * **Long-Term Planning:**  Develop a plan to continue your fitness journey beyond the 10 weeks.  Consider joining a gym, working with a personal trainer, or continuing with a self-directed program.
    * **Celebrate Your Success!** You've completed a challenging 10-week program.  Acknowledge your hard work and dedication.



**Final Thoughts from Maria Kuznetsova:**

Consistency is key.  Don’t get discouraged if you miss a workout or don’t see results immediately.  Focus on making healthy habits a part of your lifestyle.  Remember to listen to your body, prioritize recovery, and enjoy the process!  I am confident that with dedication and perseverance, you will achieve your fitness goals.  Good luck!

## Running for Rehabilitation & Stress Relief: 2-Week Advanced Program – with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for advanced runners looking to incorporate running as a tool for rehabilitation from minor injuries (cleared by a medical professional) and stress relief. It focuses on low-impact running, mindful movement, and recovery. *Important Disclaimer: This program is for individuals with a pre-existing running base. If you are new to running or have significant injuries, consult a physician before starting.*  We’ll prioritize form over speed, listening to your body, and building a sustainable routine.  Hydration and mindful recovery are crucial throughout.

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Goal:** Rehabilitation, Stress Relief
**Level:** Advanced
**Avg Duration:** Up to 30 minutes
**Frequency:** 3-4 times/week



---

**Week 1: Re-establishing Base & Mindful Movement**

**Day 1: Monday - Gentle Re-Introduction & Body Scan (30 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching – Leg swings (forward & sideways - 10 reps each leg), Arm circles (forward & backward - 10 reps each arm), Torso twists (10 reps each side), High knees (20 reps), Butt kicks (20 reps).
*   **Workout (20 mins):**
    *   Walk/Run Intervals: 2 mins walk, 1 min very easy jog (conversational pace), repeat 6 times. Focus on soft landings.
    *   Body Scan Meditation (5 mins): After the run, lie down and perform a body scan meditation, focusing on sensations in your feet, legs, core, and upper body.  Notice any tension and consciously release it.
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – Calf stretch (30 sec each leg), Hamstring stretch (30 sec each leg), Quad stretch (30 sec each leg), Hip flexor stretch (30 sec each leg).
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water before, during, and after. Consider electrolyte replenishment if sweating heavily.
*   **Recovery:** Epsom salt bath or foam rolling focusing on calves, hamstrings, and quads.
*   **Note:**  This day is about re-establishing the movement pattern and reconnecting with your body.  Don't push the pace.



**Day 2: Wednesday - Strength & Stability (30 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio – brisk walking, marching in place. Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (20 mins):** (Focus on core and lower body stability)
    *   Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps (focus on squeezing glutes) - 60 sec rest
    *   Single Leg Deadlifts (with or without light weight): 3 sets of 10 reps per leg - 60 sec rest
    *   Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds - 60 sec rest
    *   Calf Raises: 3 sets of 20 reps - 45 sec rest
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – Focus on glutes, hamstrings, and calves.
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water.
*   **Recovery:** Gentle stretching and mindful breathing.
*   **Note:** Strength training is vital for injury prevention and rehabilitation. Focus on proper form.



**Day 3: Friday - Mindful Run & Visualization (25 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (15 mins):** Continuous easy jog at a conversational pace.  Focus on your breathing and the sensation of your feet hitting the ground.  Practice visualization – imagine yourself running smoothly and effortlessly.
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching as Day 1.
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water.
*   **Recovery:**  Journaling - write down your thoughts and feelings after the run.
*   **Note:**  This run is about being present and using running as a moving meditation.  Leave your worries behind.

**Day 4: Sunday - Rest or Active Recovery (optional 30 min walk)**

*   Complete rest or a very gentle walk. Focus on non-impact activity.



---

**Week 2: Building Endurance & Deepening Mindfulness**

**Day 5: Monday - Interval Progression & Gratitude (30 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (20 mins):**
    *   Walk/Run Intervals: 1.5 mins walk, 1.5 mins easy jog, repeat 6 times. Slightly increase the pace of the jog if comfortable.
    *   Gratitude Practice (5 mins): After the run, spend 5 minutes writing down things you are grateful for.
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching as Day 1.
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water.
*   **Recovery:**  Magnesium supplement (consult with a doctor before starting any new supplement).
*   **Note:**  We're gradually increasing the running intervals.  Continue to listen to your body.



**Day 6: Wednesday - Strength & Proprioception (30 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio. Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (20 mins):**
    *   Single Leg Squats (assisted if needed): 3 sets of 8-10 reps per leg - 60 sec rest
    *   Hip Thrusts (with band around knees): 3 sets of 15 reps - 60 sec rest
    *   Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side - 45 sec rest
    *   Toe Raises: 3 sets of 20 reps - 45 sec rest
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching – Focus on glutes, hamstrings, and calves.
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water.
*   **Recovery:** Foam rolling and self-massage.
*   **Note:**  Proprioception exercises (like single leg squats and bird dog) help improve balance and coordination.



**Day 7: Friday - Hill Repeats & Positive Affirmations (25 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (15 mins):** Find a gentle hill. Run up the hill at a moderate effort for 30 seconds, then walk down for recovery. Repeat 6-8 times.  While running, repeat positive affirmations (e.g., "I am strong," "I am capable," "I am healing").
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching as Day 1.
*   **Hydration:** 500ml water.
*   **Recovery:**  Relaxation techniques – deep breathing exercises or progressive muscle relaxation.
*   **Note:**  Hill repeats build strength and endurance.  Focus on maintaining good form.



**Day 8: Sunday - Long Slow Distance & Reflection (30-40 mins)**

*   **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching as Day 1.
*   **Workout (25-30 mins):**  Continuous easy jog at a conversational pace. Aim for a slightly longer distance than previous runs.  Use this time for reflection – think about your progress and goals.
*   **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching as Day 1.
*   **Hydration:** 750ml water.
*   **Recovery:**  Gentle yoga or stretching.
*   **Note:**  This run is about building endurance and mental resilience.  Enjoy the process!




**General Advice Throughout the Program:**

*   **Listen to Your Body:** This is paramount. If you experience pain, stop and rest. Don't push through discomfort.
*   **Proper Footwear:** Ensure you are wearing well-fitting running shoes appropriate for your foot type.
*   **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and healthy fats.
*   **Sleep:** Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.
*   **Stress Management:** Incorporate other stress-reducing activities into your routine, such as yoga, meditation, or spending time in nature.
*   **Supplements:** Consider a Vitamin D supplement, especially during winter months (consult with a doctor).
* **Progression:** This is a guide. Adjust the intensity and duration based on your individual needs and progress. If a day feels too challenging, scale it back. If it feels too easy, slightly increase the intensity or duration.



This program is designed to be a starting point.  Remember that consistency, mindful movement, and listening to your body are the keys to successful rehabilitation and stress relief through running.  Good luck, and enjoy the journey!

## Ivan Orlov's 10-Week Intermediate Swimming Fitness Program

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Goal:** Maintaining Fitness
**Level:** Intermediate
**Frequency:** 1-2 times/week
**Avg. Duration:** 60-90 minutes

**Program Philosophy:** This program is designed for intermediate swimmers looking to *maintain* a solid fitness base. We’ll focus on variety, technique refinement, and building endurance without pushing for massive gains. Consistency is key. Listen to your body, and don’t hesitate to adjust the intensity or duration if needed. Remember, fitness is a journey, not a race!  We'll incorporate different stroke drills, interval training, and distance sets to keep things engaging and prevent plateaus.

**Important Notes Before Starting:**

* **Hydration:** Drink water consistently throughout the day, especially before, during, and after your swims. Aim for at least 8 glasses daily. Consider an electrolyte drink post-workout, particularly for longer sessions.
* **Nutrition:** Fuel your body with a balanced diet rich in protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Focus on whole, unprocessed foods.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours) and active recovery (light stretching, walking) on non-swim days.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Consider a multivitamin and potentially creatine (consult your doctor) to support muscle recovery.
* **Technique:** If possible, schedule a session with a swim coach to review your technique. Even minor adjustments can significantly improve efficiency and prevent injuries.
* **Warm-up/Cool-down:** *Never* skip these! They are crucial for injury prevention and recovery.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Technique Focus**

* **Day 1 (60 mins):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, 100m pull buoy, 100m kickboard.
    * **Drill Set (20 mins):** 4 x 50m freestyle with fingertip drag drill (focus on high elbow catch), 4 x 50m freestyle with catch-up drill (focus on full extension), 4 x 50m kick with board, focusing on small, fast kicks. Rest 15 seconds between each.
    * **Main Set (20 mins):** 4 x 100m freestyle @ comfortable pace, rest 20 seconds. 2 x 200m freestyle @ moderate pace, rest 30 seconds.
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** Focus on proper form over speed.  Hydrate well after.

* **Day 2 (Optional - 60 mins):**  Active Recovery Swim - 30 minutes easy freestyle, interspersed with 10 x 25m kickboard with focus on body position.



**Week 2: Building Endurance**

* **Day 1 (75 mins):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull, 100m kick.
    * **Drill Set (15 mins):** 6 x 50m freestyle with rotation drill (focus on body roll), 4 x 50m backstroke with one-arm drill. Rest 15 seconds between each.
    * **Main Set (30 mins):** 1 x 400m freestyle @ moderate pace. 4 x 100m freestyle @ slightly faster pace, rest 20 seconds. 2 x 200m freestyle @ moderate pace, rest 30 seconds.
    * **Cool-down (20 mins):** 400m easy freestyle, focusing on long, relaxed strokes.
    * **Notes:** Pay attention to your breathing pattern.



**Week 3: Interval Training – Speed & Stamina**

* **Day 1 (60 mins):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull, 100m kick.
    * **Main Set (30 mins):** 8 x 50m freestyle @ fast pace, rest 30 seconds. 6 x 75m freestyle @ moderate pace, rest 20 seconds. 4 x 100m freestyle @ comfortable pace, rest 30 seconds.
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** Push yourself during the 50s, but maintain good form.



**Week 4: Mixed Stroke & Distance**

* **Day 1 (75 mins):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull, 100m kick.
    * **Main Set (45 mins):** 4 x 100m freestyle, 4 x 100m backstroke, 4 x 100m breaststroke, 4 x 100m butterfly (or dolphin kick if butterfly is not comfortable). Rest 20 seconds between each.  Focus on maintaining consistent pace across all strokes.
    * **Cool-down (20 mins):** 400m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** This week challenges your versatility.



**Week 5:  Technique Refinement & Pull Focus**

* **Day 1 (60 mins):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull, 100m kick.
    * **Drill Set (20 mins):** 8 x 25m freestyle with high elbow catch drill, 6 x 25m backstroke with body rotation drill, 6 x 25m breaststroke with pull-buoy, focusing on a strong pull. Rest 15 seconds between each.

    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** Pull buoy isolates your upper body, allowing you to focus on technique.

* **Day 2 (Optional - 60 mins):**  Distance Freestyle - 1500m continuous freestyle at a comfortable pace.



**Week 6:  Pyramid Set & Endurance**

    * **Main Set (45 mins):** Pyramid Set: 50m, 100m, 150m, 200m, 150m, 100m, 50m – Freestyle. Rest increases with distance (10s, 15s, 20s, 30s, 20s, 15s, 10s).
    * **Cool-down (20 mins):** 400m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** This set builds endurance and challenges your pacing.

    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** Strong legs and core are vital for efficient swimming.



**Week 8:  Tempo Training & Interval Variety**
