## 10-Week Boxing/Martial Arts Competition & Fitness Program – Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed to prepare individuals for boxing/martial arts competition *or* to significantly improve fitness using boxing/martial arts principles. It’s adaptive, meaning exercises can be modified based on skill level (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced – adjustments noted).  The focus is on building endurance, strength, power, technique, and mental fortitude.  Frequency is 3-4 times per week, with workouts lasting up to 30 minutes.  Prioritize proper form over speed or weight.

**Important Considerations:**
* **Hydration:** Drink water *before*, *during*, and *after* each workout. Aim for at least 8 glasses of water daily. Consider electrolyte replacement drinks for longer/intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Supplementation (creatine, protein powder) is optional and should be discussed with a healthcare professional.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) is encouraged on rest days. Listen to your body and don’t push through pain.
* **Disclaimer:**  Consult your doctor before starting any new fitness program.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Technique (Building the Base)**

**Day 1:  Footwork & Shadow Boxing (25 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jumping jacks (30 secs), High knees (30 secs), Butt kicks (30 secs), Arm circles (forward/backward - 30 secs each), Dynamic stretching (leg swings, torso twists – 1 min).
* **Footwork Drills (10 mins):**  Forward/backward shuffles, lateral shuffles, pivot drills. (2 rounds of 3 mins each, 30 sec rest) – *Beginner: Focus on balance. Intermediate: Add speed. Advanced: Add changes in direction.*
* **Shadow Boxing (5 mins):**  Basic punches (jab, cross, hook, uppercut). Focus on form, not power. (3 rounds of 1 min, 30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 secs): Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Calf stretch, Shoulder stretch, Triceps stretch.
* **Note:** Visualize an opponent during shadow boxing.

**Day 2: Strength & Core (20 mins)**
* **Warm-up (3 mins):** Light cardio (jogging in place), Dynamic stretching.
* **Bodyweight Circuit (12 mins):** Push-ups (3 sets of as many reps as possible - AMRAP), Squats (3 sets of 15 reps), Lunges (3 sets of 10 reps per leg), Plank (3 sets, hold for 30-60 secs). 30 sec rest between sets. *Beginner: Modified push-ups (on knees). Intermediate: Standard push-ups. Advanced: Decline push-ups.*
* **Core Work (5 mins):** Crunches (3 sets of 20 reps), Russian Twists (3 sets of 15 reps per side), Leg Raises (3 sets of 15 reps).
* **Cool-down (2 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 3:  Bag Work (20 mins)**
* **Warm-up (3 mins):**  Jumping rope (2 mins), Arm rotations.
* **Bag Combinations (12 mins):** Jab-Cross-Hook (3 rounds of 3 mins, 30 sec rest). Focus on technique and rotation. *Beginner: Slow and controlled. Intermediate: Increase speed. Advanced: Add power and footwork.*
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching, focusing on shoulders and back.



---

**Week 2:  Increasing Intensity & Coordination**

**Day 1:  Footwork & Shadow Boxing (28 mins)** – Increase duration of footwork drills to 12 mins. Introduce in-and-out movement.
**Day 2: Strength & Core (25 mins)** – Add weighted squats (using dumbbells or kettlebell - 3 sets of 12 reps). Increase plank hold to 60-90 secs.
**Day 3: Bag Work (25 mins)** – Introduce Jab-Cross-Hook-Uppercut combination. Add defensive slips and rolls to bag work.



---

**Week 3:  Power & Endurance**

**Day 1:  Interval Training (30 mins)** – Shadow boxing intervals: 30 secs high intensity, 30 secs rest (8 rounds).
**Day 2:  Strength & Core (30 mins)** – Introduce dumbbell rows (3 sets of 12 reps), increase weight if possible. Add bicycle crunches (3 sets of 20 reps).
**Day 3: Pad Work (with partner, if available) (30 mins)** – Focus on reactive drills, responding to partner’s commands.



---

**Week 4:  Refinement & Sparring Prep (Light)**

**Day 1:  Technical Shadow Boxing (25 mins)** – Focus on specific weaknesses identified in previous weeks.
**Day 2:  Strength & Core (20 mins)** – Focus on explosive power: Jump squats (3 sets of 10 reps), plyometric push-ups (3 sets of AMRAP).
**Day 3:  Light Sparring (15 mins) / Bag Work (25 mins)** – *Sparring: Controlled, technical sparring with a focus on defense. Bag Work: Incorporate sparring combinations.*



---

**Week 5-10:  Competition Specific Training (Progressive Overload)**

These weeks build on the foundation established in the first four weeks. The key is *progressive overload* – gradually increasing the intensity, duration, or difficulty of your workouts.

**General Structure (repeat 3-4 times/week):**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Dynamic stretching, jump rope.
* **Skill Development (10-15 mins):**
    * **Weeks 5-6:**  Complex combinations (4-5 punch/kick combos), focus on fluidity and speed.  Pad work with increasing resistance.
    * **Weeks 7-8:**  Sparring (increasing intensity and duration), focusing on game plan execution.  Bag work simulating competition rounds.
    * **Weeks 9-10:**  Tapering (reducing volume, maintaining intensity).  Mental preparation.  Light sparring, focusing on timing and precision.
* **Strength & Conditioning (10-15 mins):**
    * **Weeks 5-6:**  Weighted circuits (squats, lunges, push-ups, rows). Focus on strength endurance.
    * **Weeks 7-8:**  Power exercises (plyometrics, medicine ball throws). Focus on explosive power.
    * **Weeks 9-10:**  Maintenance workouts (lighter weights, higher reps). Focus on recovery and preventing injury.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching, foam rolling.

**Specific Exercise Examples (rotating throughout the weeks):**

* **Footwork:** Cone drills, ladder drills, reactive footwork drills.
* **Shadow Boxing:**  Visualization exercises, focusing on opponent tendencies.
* **Bag Work:**  Round simulations, incorporating defensive maneuvers.
* **Pad Work:**  Reactive drills, counter-punching drills, combination drills.
* **Sparring:**  Controlled sparring, focusing on specific goals (e.g., working the jab, defending against hooks).
* **Strength:**  Deadlifts, bench press, overhead press, pull-ups (assisted if needed).
* **Core:**  Hanging leg raises, ab wheel rollouts, wood chops.
* **Cardio:**  Sprints, interval running, jump rope.

**Week 10 (Tapering & Competition/Assessment):**

* **Days 1-3:** Reduced volume, focusing on technique and mental preparation.  Light sparring, focusing on timing and precision.
* **Day 4 (Competition/Assessment):** Execute your game plan with confidence.
* **Days 5-7:** Active recovery (light cardio, stretching, foam rolling).



---

**Final Thoughts:**

This program is a guideline.  Adjust it based on your individual needs and progress.  Consistency is key.  Listen to your body, prioritize recovery, and stay motivated.  Remember, the goal is not just to prepare for competition, but to develop a lifelong commitment to fitness and well-being.  Good luck!  And remember, I'm here to support you on your journey.

## 14-Day Advanced HIIT Program for Health Improvement - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen this program to elevate your health and fitness. This 14-day HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training) plan is designed for advanced individuals looking to push their limits and achieve significant improvements in cardiovascular health, strength, and endurance.  Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and stay hydrated.  We're aiming for progress, not perfection!

**Important Considerations:**

* **Medical Clearance:**  Before starting any new fitness program, consult with your doctor, especially if you have any underlying health conditions.
* **Proper Form:**  Maintaining correct form is *crucial* to prevent injuries.  If you're unsure about proper technique, research online using reputable sources (NASM, ACE Fitness, etc.) or consider working with a qualified trainer for a session or two.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially before, during, and after workouts. Aim for at least 8 glasses (64oz) daily. Consider adding electrolytes if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:**  This program works best when combined with a balanced and nutritious diet. Focus on whole, unprocessed foods, lean protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider a multivitamin, creatine (for performance enhancement, consult with a doctor first), and protein powder to support muscle recovery.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night) and active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days.



---

### **Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Focus:** Establishing a strong base for high-intensity intervals, focusing on full-body movements and core stability.

**Day 1: Full Body Blast (45-50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping Jacks (30 seconds), High Knees (30 seconds), Butt Kicks (30 seconds), Arm Circles (forward & backward - 30 seconds each), Dynamic Stretching (Torso Twists, Leg Swings - 1 minute)
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Burpees: 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Mountain Climbers: 3 sets of 30 seconds (Rest: 45 seconds)
    * Jump Squats: 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Push-ups (Advanced - decline if possible): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45 seconds (Rest: 45 seconds)
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 20 reps (10 each side) (Rest: 45 seconds)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Hold each stretch for 30 seconds - Hamstrings, Quads, Calves, Chest, Triceps, Shoulders)
* **Notes:** Focus on explosive movements during the work intervals. Maintain a tight core throughout each exercise. Hydrate with water and consider a post-workout protein shake.

**Day 2: Active Recovery (30 minutes)**

* Light Jogging or Brisk Walking: 20 minutes
* Foam Rolling: 10 minutes (Focus on legs, back, and shoulders)
* **Notes:** This is about loosening up muscles and promoting blood flow. Keep the intensity low.

**Day 3: Lower Body Power (45-50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Day 1, focusing on leg mobility.
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg): 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 12 reps per leg (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Box Jumps: 3 sets of 8 reps (Rest: 60 seconds) – *Ensure box height is appropriate for your skill level.*
    * Glute Bridges (weighted optional): 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45 seconds)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest: 45 seconds)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Focus on legs and glutes)
* **Notes:**  Control the descent during lunges and split squats to protect your knees.

**Day 4: Rest**

* Prioritize sleep and hydration. Gentle stretching is encouraged.

**Day 5: Upper Body & Core Challenge (45-50 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, dynamic chest stretches.
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Diamond Push-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Dumbbell Rows (each arm): 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Plank with Shoulder Taps: 3 sets of 30 seconds (Rest: 45 seconds)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest: 45 seconds)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Focus on chest, back, shoulders, and arms)
* **Notes:**  Engage your core during all upper body exercises.

**Day 6 & 7: Rest & Recovery**



---

### **Week 2: Intensifying the Challenge**

**Focus:** Increasing the intensity and complexity of the HIIT intervals, incorporating plyometrics and advanced core work.

**Day 8: Full Body HIIT Circuit (50-55 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Similar to Day 1, but add dynamic planks.
* **Workout (35 minutes):** *Perform each exercise for 45 seconds, followed by 15 seconds of rest. Complete 4 rounds with 2 minutes rest between rounds.*
    * Thrusters (Squat + Overhead Press with dumbbells)
    * Spiderman Push-ups
    * Renegade Rows (Plank with dumbbell rows)
    * Plyometric Lunges (alternating)
    * Burpee Box Jumps (if appropriate)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Full body)
* **Notes:** Focus on maintaining proper form even when fatigued. Choose a dumbbell weight that challenges you.

**Day 9: Active Recovery (30 minutes)**

* Yoga or Pilates: 30 minutes (Focus on flexibility and core strength)
* **Notes:**  A great way to promote recovery and improve mobility.

**Day 10: Lower Body Plyometrics (50-55 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic leg stretches, jump rope.
* **Workout (35 minutes):**
    * Depth Jumps: 3 sets of 5 reps (Rest: 90 seconds) *Start with a low box and gradually increase height.*
    * Single Leg Hops (each leg): 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Jump Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Pistol Squats (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Weighted Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 45 seconds)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Focus on legs and glutes)
* **Notes:** Plyometrics are high-impact. Ensure you have a solid foundation of strength before attempting these exercises.

**Day 11: Rest**

* Prioritize sleep and hydration.

**Day 12: Advanced Core & Upper Body (50-55 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Dynamic stretches for core and upper body.
* **Workout (35 minutes):**
    * Muscle-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 90 seconds)
    * Handstand Push-ups (against a wall): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 90 seconds)
    * Dragon Flags: 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest: 90 seconds)
    * Hanging Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
    * Russian Twists (with heavy weight): 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest: 60 seconds)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static Stretching (Focus on core, back, and arms)
* **Notes:**  These exercises are very challenging. Modify as needed and prioritize proper form.

**Day 13: HIIT Finisher (45 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light cardio and dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 minutes):** *Tabata Protocol – 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest, 8 rounds per exercise. Complete 3 exercises.*

## CrossFit for Stress Relief & Muscle Gain: 2-Week Intermediate Program - Coached by Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for intermediate CrossFit athletes looking to build muscle, improve strength, *and* significantly reduce stress. We'll be focusing on functional movements, moderate intensity, and mindful recovery. Remember, consistency is key, and listening to your body is paramount. Don't push through pain; modify exercises as needed.  I'm Anna Smirnova, and I’ll be guiding you through this journey.  Let's build a stronger, calmer you!

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3 liters of water daily, especially on workout days. Consider adding electrolytes after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Prioritize protein intake (around 0.8-1 gram per pound of body weight) to support muscle recovery. Focus on whole, unprocessed foods.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid in muscle growth and recovery. Magnesium glycinate can promote relaxation and sleep.  *Always consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light walking, yoga) on rest days is encouraged. Foam rolling and stretching are vital.
* **Scaling:**  If an exercise is too challenging, scale it down.  For example, use lighter weights, modify movements (e.g., knee push-ups instead of full push-ups), or reduce the number of reps.



---

### **Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Day 1: (Monday) – Strength & Mobility Focus (40 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (jumping jacks, high knees) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: arm circles, leg swings, torso twists (3 mins).
* **Strength (20 mins):**
    * Back Squats: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60-90 sec rest) – Focus on form!
    * Push-Ups: 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (60 sec rest) – Scale to knees if needed.
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (60 sec rest) – Maintain a flat back.
* **WOD (Workout of the Day) (10 mins):** AMRAP 10 mins: 5 Burpees, 10 Kettlebell Swings (moderate weight), 15 Air Squats.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching: hamstring stretch, quad stretch, tricep stretch, shoulder stretch. Hold each stretch for 30 seconds.
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements.  Pay attention to your breathing.

**Day 2: (Wednesday) – Cardio & Core (35 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Rowing machine (light intensity) 3 mins. Dynamic stretching: hip circles, cat-cow stretch (2 mins).
* **Cardio (15 mins):**  Intervals: 30 seconds Sprint/Run, 60 seconds Rest x 10 rounds.  (Can be done on treadmill, bike, or outdoors).
* **Core (10 mins):**
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (30 sec rest)
    * Russian Twists (with or without weight): 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (30 sec rest)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Foam rolling (back, legs) and light stretching.
* **Notes:**  Engage your core throughout all exercises.  Maintain proper form during intervals.

**Day 3: (Friday) –  Full Body & Stress Release (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Jump rope 2 mins. Dynamic stretching: inchworms, bear crawls (3 mins).
* **Strength/Skill (20 mins):**
    * Deadlifts: 3 sets of 5-7 reps (90-120 sec rest) – Prioritize form above all else.
    * Box Jumps: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60 sec rest) – Choose a box height appropriate for your level.
* **WOD (15 mins):**  “Cindy” – AMRAP 20 mins: 5 Pull-Ups (scale to ring rows or assisted pull-ups), 10 Push-Ups, 15 Air Squats.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Deep breathing exercises (box breathing – inhale for 4, hold for 4, exhale for 4, hold for 4) and static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Focus on controlled descent during deadlifts.  This workout is designed to be challenging, but don't sacrifice form for speed.



---

### **Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Refining Technique**

**Day 4: (Monday) – Strength & Power (40 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio (rowing) 2 mins. Dynamic stretching:  shoulder dislocations with a PVC pipe, thoracic spine rotations (3 mins).
* **Strength (20 mins):**
    * Front Squats: 3 sets of 6-8 reps (75-90 sec rest)
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (60-90 sec rest)
    * Pull-Ups (or Ring Rows): 3 sets of AMRAP (60-90 sec rest)
* **WOD (10 mins):**  3 rounds for time: 10 Thrusters (moderate weight), 15 Wall Balls (moderate weight), 20 Box Jump Overs.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching focusing on legs, shoulders, and back.
* **Notes:**  Maintain a tight core during front squats.  Focus on controlled movements during thrusters.

**Day 5: (Wednesday) – Endurance & Core Stability (35 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Burpees 10 reps. Dynamic stretching:  mountain climbers, plank jacks (2 mins).
* **Endurance (15 mins):**  Run or row 800m, 3 rounds with 2 minutes rest between rounds. Focus on maintaining a consistent pace.
* **Core (10 mins):**
    * Hollow Body Holds: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (30 sec rest)
    * V-Ups: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (30 sec rest)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20-25 reps per side (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Yoga flow focusing on core and flexibility.
* **Notes:**  Engage your core throughout the endurance workout.  Focus on proper form during core exercises.

**Day 6: (Friday) –  Complex & Mindful Movement (45 mins)**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light jogging 2 mins. Dynamic stretching:  Spiderman lunges, hip flexor stretch (3 mins).
* **Strength/Skill (20 mins):**
    * Clean & Jerk (light weight, focus on technique): 3 sets of 3-5 reps (90-120 sec rest) – Break down the movement into segments if needed.
    * Muscle-Ups (or progressions): 3 sets of AMRAP (60-90 sec rest) – Scale to jumping muscle-ups or strict pull-ups/dips.
* **WOD (15 mins):** "Fran" – 21-15-9 reps of Thrusters (lighter weight than earlier in the week) and Pull-Ups (scale as needed).
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Meditation (5-10 minutes) focusing on breath awareness and body scan. Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Prioritize technique over weight.  "Fran" is a benchmark workout; focus on completing it with good form. The meditation is crucial for stress relief.



**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing this 2-week program!  Remember to continue prioritizing consistency, proper form, and mindful recovery.  Don't be afraid to challenge yourself, but always listen to your body.  This is just the beginning of your fitness journey.  I’m here to support you every step of the way.  Keep pushing, keep growing, and keep finding joy in movement!  

**Disclaimer:** *This workout program is intended as a general guide and should be adapted to your individual needs and abilities. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program.*

## The "Orlov Ascent" - 2-Week Advanced Running & Strength Program (Weight Loss & Muscle Gain)

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Goal:** Weight Loss & Muscle Gain (Synergistic Approach)
**Level:** Advanced (Requires existing running base & strength training experience)
**Frequency:** 6 times/week
**Avg. Duration:** 60-90 minutes per session

**Program Philosophy:** This program isn’t just about logging miles. It’s about strategically combining high-intensity running with targeted strength training to maximize fat burn, preserve and build lean muscle mass, and elevate your overall athletic performance. We’ll focus on interval training, tempo runs, long runs, and complementary strength work to achieve a holistic transformation.  Recovery is paramount; listen to your body and adjust as needed.

**Important Notes BEFORE Starting:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3-4 liters of water daily, especially on workout days. Consider electrolyte supplementation (sodium, potassium, magnesium) during and after longer/intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Prioritize a diet rich in lean protein (1.6-2.2g/kg bodyweight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  A slight caloric deficit (250-500 calories) is recommended for weight loss, but *never* compromise protein intake.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid muscle recovery and performance.  Branched-Chain Amino Acids (BCAAs) can be taken intra-workout to reduce muscle soreness. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Warm-up/Cool-down:**  These are NON-NEGOTIABLE.  Don't skip them!
* **Listen to Your Body:** Pain is a signal. Don’t push through it.  Modify exercises or take a rest day if needed.
* **Form Over Everything:**  Prioritize proper form during strength training to prevent injuries.  Watch videos, use a mirror, or consider working with a trainer for form checks.



---

### **Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Day 1: Interval Training & Upper Body Strength**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Dynamic stretching – arm circles, leg swings, torso twists, high knees, butt kicks.
* **Running (30 mins):** 8 x 400m repeats at 5k race pace with 400m recovery jog between each.
* **Strength (30 mins):**
    * Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Pull-ups (or Lat Pulldowns): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-15 reps per side (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – holding each stretch for 30 seconds (chest, shoulders, back, biceps, triceps).
* **Hydration:** Electrolyte drink post-workout.

**Day 2: Tempo Run & Core**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Light jog, dynamic stretching.
* **Running (40 mins):** 20-minute tempo run at comfortably hard pace (you should be able to say a few words, but not hold a conversation). 10-minute easy jog warm-up and cool-down.
* **Core (20 mins):**
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 60-90 seconds (Rest 30 secs)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 30 secs)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – focusing on core and lower back.
* **Recovery:** Foam rolling lower back and abs.

**Day 3: Long Run & Active Recovery**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Easy jog, dynamic stretching.
* **Running (60-75 mins):**  Long run at conversational pace. Focus on maintaining consistent effort.
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – full body.
* **Hydration:**  Hydrate well before, during, and after the run.
* **Recovery:**  Light walk for 15-20 minutes.

**Day 4: Lower Body Strength**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Dynamic stretching – squats, lunges, leg swings.
* **Strength (45 mins):**
    * Back Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 90 secs)
    * Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs): 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 45 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching – focusing on quads, hamstrings, glutes, calves.
* **Nutrition:**  Protein-rich meal post-workout.

**Day 5: Easy Recovery Run**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light jog, dynamic stretching.
* **Running (30-40 mins):**  Easy recovery run at a very comfortable pace.  Focus on maintaining good form.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 6: Rest or Cross-Training (Swimming, Cycling)**

* **Rest:** Complete rest is important for recovery.
* **Cross-Training (Optional):** 45-60 minutes of low-impact cross-training.



---

### **Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Volume**

**Day 7:  Hill Repeats & Upper Body Strength**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Dynamic stretching, light jog to hill.
* **Running (35 mins):** 6-8 hill repeats (moderate incline) – run up hard for 60-90 seconds, jog down for recovery.
* **Strength (30 mins):** (Increase weight from Week 1 if possible)
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Chin-ups (or Assisted Chin-ups): 3 sets of AMRAP (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Arnold Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 8:  Fartlek Training & Core**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Light jog, dynamic stretching.
* **Running (45 mins):** Fartlek run – 2 minutes hard, 1 minute easy, repeat 10-12 times.  Vary the "hard" intervals (e.g., some at 5k pace, some slightly faster).
* **Core (20 mins):** (Increase difficulty from Week 1)
    * Weighted Plank: 3 sets, hold for 60-90 seconds (Rest 30 secs)
    * Hanging Leg Raises: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 30 secs)
    * Cable Woodchops: 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 9: Long Run & Active Recovery**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Easy jog, dynamic stretching.
* **Running (75-90 mins):**  Long run at conversational pace.  Try to increase distance slightly from Week 1.
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Hydration:**  Focus on consistent hydration throughout the day.

**Day 10: Lower Body Strength (Focus on Power)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Dynamic stretching.
* **Strength (45 mins):**
    * Jump Squats: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest 60-90 secs)
    * Deadlifts: 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (increase weight each set) (Rest 2-3 mins)
    * Walking Lunges with Dumbbells: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
    * Box Jumps: 3 sets of 8-10 reps (Rest 60 secs)

## 10-Week Endurance Strength Training Program – with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed to build your endurance through strength training, adaptable to all fitness levels. We’ll focus on progressive overload – gradually increasing the challenge to continually improve.  Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and remember consistency is key.  I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'll be guiding you every step of the way.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider a multivitamin, creatine (for enhanced performance, consult your doctor), and protein powder to support muscle recovery.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light walking, stretching) is encouraged on rest days.
* **Form over Weight:** Always maintain proper form. If you're unsure, watch videos online or consult a professional.
* **Adaptation:** This is an adaptive program.  If an exercise is too difficult, modify it (see exercise variations below). If it's too easy, increase the weight, reps, or sets.



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Familiarization** (Focus: Building a base, learning proper form)

**Day 1: Full Body – Introduction**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) + dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings).
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Rows (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds – quads, hamstrings, chest, triceps).
* **Note:** Focus on controlled movements.  Hydrate well post-workout.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio + dynamic stretching.
* **Workout:**
    * Brisk Walking/Jogging: 20 minutes at a moderate pace.
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 30 secs)
    * Russian Twists (no weight or light weight): 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest: 30 secs)
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (Rest: 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Static stretching.

**Day 3: Upper Body**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Arm circles, shoulder rotations.
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press (light weight): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Bicep Curls (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Tricep Extensions (light weight): 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 4: Rest or Active Recovery (Light walk/Yoga)**

**Day 5: Lower Body & Core**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Leg swings, hip circles.
* **Workout:**
    * Lunges (alternating legs): 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds (Rest: 60 secs)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest: 30 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 6:  Light Cardio (30 mins)**



---

### **Week 2-10: Progressive Overload & Variation** (Focus: Increasing intensity, introducing new exercises)

**(The following structure will be repeated for Weeks 2-10, with adjustments to exercises, sets, reps, and rest periods to ensure progressive overload.  I will provide a detailed overview for Weeks 2, 5, and 8, then summarize the changes for the remaining weeks.)**

**Week 2: Increasing Volume**
* **Increase reps by 2-3 per set where possible.**
* **Reduce rest periods by 15 seconds.**
* **Introduce new exercise variations:**  Goblet Squats instead of regular squats, Incline Push-ups.

**Day 1: Full Body** (Similar to Week 1, but with increased reps and variations)
* Squats: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* Push-ups (Incline): 3 sets of AMRAP
* Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per side
* Plank: 3 sets, hold for 45 seconds
* Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 20 reps

**Day 2: Cardio & Core** (Increase cardio duration to 25 minutes)

**Day 3: Upper Body** (Add Dumbbell Flyes)

**Day 4: Rest or Active Recovery**

**Day 5: Lower Body & Core** (Add Romanian Deadlifts with light weight)

**Day 6: Light Cardio (30 mins)**

**Week 5: Introducing Supersets & Intensity**
* **Introduce supersets:** Perform two exercises back-to-back with no rest in between.
* **Increase weight slightly if possible.**
* **Introduce new exercises:**  Burpees (modified if needed), Walking Lunges.

**Day 1: Full Body (Supersets)**
* **Superset 1:** Squats (3 sets of 10-12 reps) + Push-ups (3 sets of AMRAP) – Rest 60 secs between supersets
* **Superset 2:** Dumbbell Rows (3 sets of 10-12 reps per side) + Plank (3 sets of 45-60 seconds) – Rest 60 secs between supersets

**Day 2: Cardio & Core (Interval Training)**

**Day 3: Upper Body (Supersets)**

**Day 4: Rest or Active Recovery**

**Day 5: Lower Body & Core (Walking Lunges)**

**Day 6: Light Cardio (30 mins)**

**Week 8:  Peak Endurance & Challenge**
* **Increase weight further if possible.**
* **Reduce rest periods to the minimum (30-45 seconds).**
* **Introduce complex movements:**  Thrusters (Squat + Shoulder Press).

**Day 1: Full Body (Complex Movements)**
* Thrusters (light to moderate weight): 3 sets of 8-10 reps
* Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of AMRAP
* Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps per side
* Plank: 3 sets, hold for 60 seconds
* Glute Bridges with weight: 3 sets of 20 reps

**Day 2: Cardio & Core (HIIT - High-Intensity Interval Training)**

**Day 3: Upper Body (Heavy Weight, Lower Reps)**

**Day 4: Rest or Active Recovery**

**Day 5: Lower Body & Core (Romanian Deadlifts with increased weight)**

**Day 6: Light Cardio (30 mins)**



**Weeks 3, 4, 6, 7, 9 & 10:  Summary of Changes**

* **Week 3 & 4:** Continue increasing reps and decreasing rest. Introduce variations like Bulgarian Split Squats.
* **Week 6 & 7:** Focus on tempo training – slow down the eccentric (lowering) phase of the exercises.  Add more core work.
* **Week 9 & 10:**  Deload week – reduce weight and volume by 20-30% to allow for recovery and prevent overtraining. Focus on form and mindfulness.



---

**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing this 10-week program!  Remember that fitness is a journey, not a destination. Continue to challenge yourself, listen to your body, and prioritize your health and well-being.  Don't hesitate to consult with a healthcare professional or certified trainer for personalized guidance.  I'm proud of your dedication and commitment!  Keep pushing forward! – Maria Kuznetsova.

## Maria Kuznetsova’s 10-Week Advanced Bodybuilding & Flexibility Program

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)
**Goal:** Flexibility Improvement & Fitness Maintenance
**Level:** Advanced
**Frequency:** 1-2 times/week (with active recovery days outlined)
**Avg. Duration:** 60-90 minutes

**Program Philosophy:** This program blends traditional bodybuilding principles with a strong focus on dynamic and static stretching to enhance flexibility, prevent injury, and optimize performance. It’s designed for individuals with a solid fitness base who are looking to maintain muscle mass while significantly improving their range of motion.  We’ll prioritize compound movements for strength and hypertrophy, coupled with dedicated flexibility sessions.  Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and adjust weights/resistance as needed.  Progressive overload is key, but so is respecting your limits.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 3-4 liters of water daily, especially on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Maintain a balanced diet rich in protein (1.6-2.2g/kg body weight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a post-workout protein shake (20-30g protein) to aid recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine (3-5g daily) can support strength and muscle recovery.  Magnesium and Zinc can contribute to muscle function and overall health. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery days (walking, yoga, light cardio) are crucial for reducing muscle soreness and promoting recovery.
* **Warm-up:**  5-10 minutes of light cardio (jumping jacks, high knees, butt kicks) followed by dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Cool-down:** 5-10 minutes of static stretching, holding each stretch for 30-60 seconds.
* **RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion):**  Use a scale of 1-10, where 1 is minimal effort and 10 is maximal effort. Aim for an RPE of 7-9 during working sets.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body Strength & Dynamic Flexibility**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Deadlifts: 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (Rest: 2 min) – *Focus on perfect form!*
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Barbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Dynamic Stretching:  Leg swings (forward/sideways – 10 reps each leg), Arm circles (forward/backward – 10 reps each arm), Torso twists (10 reps each side).
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday): Active Recovery & Static Flexibility**
    * 30-minute brisk walk.
    * Static Stretching: Hamstring stretch (30 sec each leg), Quadriceps stretch (30 sec each leg), Calf stretch (30 sec each leg), Triceps stretch (30 sec each arm), Shoulder stretch (30 sec each arm), Chest stretch (30 sec).

**Week 2:  Increasing Volume & Range of Motion**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Upper Body Focus & Shoulder Mobility**
    * Warm-up
    * Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest: 75 sec)
    * Pull-ups (or Lat Pulldowns): 3 sets to failure (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest: 75 sec)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-15 reps per arm (Rest: 75 sec)
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 60 sec) – *Focus on scapular retraction.*
    * Shoulder Dislocates (with PVC pipe): 3 sets of 10-15 reps.
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday): Lower Body & Hip Flexibility**
    * Warm-up
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg (Rest: 75 sec)
    * Romanian Deadlifts: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
    * Leg Press: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 75 sec)
    * Calf Raises: 4 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Pigeon Pose (30 sec each side), Butterfly Stretch (60 sec), Hip Flexor Stretch (30 sec each side).
    * Cool-down

**Week 3:  Strength & Deep Stretching**

* **Day 1 (Monday):  Compound Movements & Spinal Mobility**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 4 sets of 6-10 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
    * Deadlifts: 3 sets of 3-5 reps (Rest: 2 min)
    * Bench Press: 4 sets of 6-10 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 6-10 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
    * Cat-Cow Stretch (10 reps), Thread the Needle Stretch (30 sec each side), Spinal Twists (10 reps each side).
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday): Isolation Work & Full Body Static Stretch**
    * Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 10-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Hamstring Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Full body static stretching holding each stretch for 60 seconds.

**Week 4: Deload & Active Recovery**

* **Day 1 (Monday): Light Full Body Circuit & Foam Rolling**
    * Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 15-20 reps
    * Push-ups: 3 sets to failure
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per arm (light weight)
    * Plank: 3 sets, holding for 30-60 seconds
    * Foam Rolling: Quads, Hamstrings, Calves, Back, Shoulders (2 minutes per muscle group)
* **Day 2 (Thursday): Yoga or Pilates (60 minutes)** – Focus on flexibility and core strength.

**Weeks 5-10: Progressive Overload & Refinement**

(These weeks follow a similar structure to Weeks 1-3, but with progressive increases in weight, reps, or sets.  Focus on adding 2.5-5 lbs to lifting weights each week if possible.  Also, incorporate more advanced flexibility techniques.)

* **Weeks 5-6:** Increase weight on compound lifts.  Introduce unilateral exercises (single-leg squats, single-arm dumbbell rows) to address imbalances. Add banded stretches for increased resistance.
* **Weeks 7-8:** Implement drop sets (reducing weight mid-set) on isolation exercises.  Introduce plyometric exercises (jump squats, box jumps) for power. Focus on PNF stretching (Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation) with a partner.
* **Weeks 9-10:** Peak week – reduce volume slightly while maintaining intensity. Focus on refining form and maximizing mind-muscle connection.  Continue advanced flexibility work.  Prioritize sleep and nutrition for optimal recovery.

**Sample Workout (Week 7 – Monday):**

* **Warm-up**
* Squats: 4 sets of 5-8 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
* Deadlifts: 3 sets of 3-5 reps (Rest: 2 min)
* Bench Press: 4 sets of 5-8 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
* Overhead Press: 3 sets of 5-8 reps (Rest: 120 sec)
* Pull-ups: 3 sets to failure (Rest: 90 sec)
* Barbell Rows: 3 sets of 8-12 reps (Rest: 90 sec)
* **Flexibility:** Dynamic hamstring stretches with a band, PNF hamstring stretch with partner assistance, deep hip flexor stretch, shoulder dislocates with resistance band.
* **Cool-down**



**Final Thoughts:**

Consistency is paramount.  Don’t skip workouts

## CrossFit for Beginners: 2-Week Endurance & Health Improvement Program - Coached by Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I’m Maria Kuznetsova, and I’m thrilled you’ve chosen to embark on this CrossFit journey with me. This program is designed for absolute beginners aiming to improve their endurance and overall health. We'll focus on building a solid foundation of movement, strength, and cardiovascular fitness. Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form over speed, and celebrate every accomplishment, no matter how small. Consistency is key!

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Consult your doctor:** Before starting any new exercise program, it’s crucial to get medical clearance.
* **Proper Form:** Watch videos and understand the correct technique for each exercise *before* attempting it. There are many excellent resources on YouTube (search for "CrossFit beginner form").  I recommend checking out videos from reputable CrossFit athletes and coaches.
* **Scaling:** Don’t be afraid to modify exercises to suit your current fitness level.  We'll discuss scaling options throughout the program.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially before, during, and after workouts. Aim for at least 8 glasses.
* **Nutrition:**  Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a post-workout protein shake to aid recovery.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night) and active recovery (light stretching or walking) on rest days.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  A multivitamin can be beneficial. Creatine can help with muscle recovery, but is not essential at this stage. Discuss with your doctor before starting any supplements.



---

### **Week 1: Building the Foundation**

**Focus:**  Movement patterns, foundational strength, and establishing a consistent routine.

**Day 1: Introduction to CrossFit - Bodyweight Basics** (40 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jumping jacks (30 seconds), High knees (30 seconds), Butt kicks (30 seconds), Arm circles (forward & backward - 30 seconds each), Dynamic stretching (leg swings, torso twists - 2 minutes).
* **Workout (25 minutes):**
    * Air Squats: 3 sets of 10 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), Rest: 60 seconds
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Sit-ups: 3 sets of 15 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static stretching (hold each stretch for 30 seconds): Quadriceps stretch, Hamstring stretch, Calf stretch, Triceps stretch, Shoulder stretch.
* **Notes:** Focus on form!  Keep your back straight during squats and lunges.  Engage your core during planks and sit-ups. Hydrate well.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core** (35 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light jogging in place (2 minutes), Dynamic stretching (arm circles, torso twists, leg swings - 3 minutes).
* **Workout (25 minutes):**
    * Jumping Rope: 3 sets of 60 seconds, Rest: 30 seconds
    * Burpees (modified - step back instead of jumping): 3 sets of 8 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15 reps per side, Rest: 45 seconds
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps, Rest: 45 seconds
    * Mountain Climbers: 3 sets of 30 seconds, Rest: 45 seconds
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focus on core and legs).
* **Notes:**  If you don't have a jump rope, substitute with high knees or jumping jacks.  Focus on controlled movements.

**Day 3: Rest or Active Recovery** (30 minutes)

* **Active Recovery:**  Light walk, yoga, or stretching. Focus on mobility and relaxation.

**Day 4: Strength & Stability** (40 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jumping jacks, arm circles, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Wall Sit: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Superman: 3 sets of 15 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Dumbbell Rows (light weight - 5-10lbs): 3 sets of 10 reps per arm, Rest: 60 seconds
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focus on back, glutes, and hamstrings).
* **Notes:**  Focus on engaging your core throughout each exercise.  Maintain proper form.

**Day 5:  AMRAP Challenge – Beginner Edition** (30 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Light cardio and dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (20 minutes):**  AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) in 20 minutes:
    * 5 Air Squats
    * 5 Push-ups (on knees if needed)
    * 10 Sit-ups
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:** This is about pacing yourself.  Don't go out too fast.  Focus on completing as many rounds as possible with good form.

**Day 6:  Rest**



---

### **Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Introducing New Movements**

**Focus:** Building on the foundation, increasing reps/sets, and introducing slightly more complex movements.

**Day 7: Bodyweight Strength & Endurance** (45 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jumping jacks, high knees, butt kicks, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Air Squats: 4 sets of 12 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Push-ups (on knees or toes): 4 sets of AMRAP, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Plank: 4 sets, hold for 45 seconds, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Walking Lunges: 4 sets of 12 reps per leg, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Sit-ups: 4 sets of 20 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Try to increase the number of push-ups you can do. Focus on controlled movements.

**Day 8: Cardio & Core - Interval Training** (40 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light jogging, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 minutes):**
    * Interval Training: 30 seconds of high intensity (e.g., jumping jacks, burpees, mountain climbers) followed by 30 seconds of rest. Repeat for 15 minutes.
    * Russian Twists: 4 sets of 20 reps per side, Rest: 45 seconds
    * Bicycle Crunches: 4 sets of 25 reps, Rest: 45 seconds
    * Flutter Kicks: 4 sets of 30 seconds, Rest: 45 seconds
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:** Adjust the intensity of the intervals to your fitness level.

**Day 9: Rest or Active Recovery** (30 minutes)

* **Active Recovery:**  Yoga, swimming, or a leisurely bike ride.

**Day 10:  Strength & Stability - Adding Resistance** (45 minutes)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jumping jacks, arm circles, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (35 minutes):**
    * Wall Sit: 4 sets, hold for 45 seconds, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Glute Bridges (with light weight – water bottle or book): 4 sets of 15 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Superman: 4 sets of 20 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Bird Dog: 4 sets of 12 reps per side, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Dumbbell Rows (5-10lbs): 4 sets of 12 reps per arm, Rest: 60 seconds
    * Bicep Curls (light weight - 5lbs): 3 sets of 10 reps, Rest: 60 seconds
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Focus on controlled movements and proper form.

**Day 11:  AMRAP Challenge – Increasing Complexity** (35 minutes)

## 5-Week HIIT Rehabilitation & Weight Loss Program - Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Program Overview:** This program is designed for individuals with an intermediate fitness level seeking rehabilitation alongside weight loss. It utilizes High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) principles, modified to prioritize joint health and recovery while maximizing caloric expenditure.  We’ll focus on low-impact variations where necessary and progressive overload to continually challenge your body.  Listen to your body, and *always* prioritize form over speed.  This program is designed to be completed 3-4 times per week, with rest days crucial for recovery.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Consult Your Doctor:** Before starting any new exercise program, consult with your physician, especially if you have pre-existing medical conditions or are undergoing rehabilitation.
* **Proper Form:** Maintaining correct form is paramount. Watch videos of each exercise if you are unsure. Focus on controlled movements.
* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, and increase intake on workout days. Consider electrolytes, especially after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** This program is most effective when combined with a healthy, balanced diet. Focus on whole foods, lean protein, and complex carbohydrates.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider a multivitamin, Omega-3 fatty acids, and potentially a protein supplement to support recovery and muscle repair. (Discuss with a healthcare professional).
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  If you experience pain, stop the exercise and consult with a healthcare professional. Modify exercises as needed.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Low-Impact Focus (3 Workouts)**

**Day 1: Lower Body & Core - 35 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (marching in place, arm circles), dynamic stretching (leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-45 secs (Rest 60 secs)
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (quad stretch, hamstring stretch, calf stretch, lower back stretch).
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements.  Engage your core throughout all exercises. Hydrate well post-workout.

**Day 2: Upper Body & Cardio - 30 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, light jogging in place.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * Wall Push-ups: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs) – Modify to incline if needed.
    * Dumbbell Rows (light weight): 3 sets of 10 reps per arm (Rest 60 secs)
    * Bicep Curls (light weight): 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Tricep Dips (using a chair): 3 sets of 10 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Jumping Jacks (low impact – step outs): 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Static stretching (tricep stretch, bicep stretch, chest stretch, shoulder stretch).
* **Notes:**  Maintain good posture throughout. Focus on squeezing the muscles during each exercise.

**Day 3: Full Body & Active Recovery - 40 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio (walking), dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists).
* **Workout (30 mins):**
    * Modified Burpees (step back instead of jump): 3 sets of 8 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Mountain Climbers (slow and controlled): 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Russian Twists (no weight or light weight): 3 sets of 15 reps per side (Rest 60 secs)
    * Superman: 3 sets of 15 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching (full body).
* **Notes:**  Focus on core engagement.  Control your breathing.



---

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Introducing Intervals (4 Workouts)**

**Day 4: Lower Body HIIT - 35 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Squats: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
    * Walking Lunges: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
    * Glute Bridges: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
    * Calf Raises: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Focus on explosive movements during work intervals.

**Day 5: Upper Body & Core HIIT - 30 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations.
* **Workout (20 mins):**
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
    * Dumbbell Rows: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds per arm
    * Plank: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
    * Crunches: 30 secs work / 30 secs rest x 5 rounds
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Maintain good form.

**Day 6: Full Body Circuit - 40 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 mins):**  Circuit – Perform each exercise for 45 secs, rest 15 secs between exercises. Repeat circuit 3 times.
    * Burpees (modified)
    * Mountain Climbers
    * Squat Jumps (low impact option: regular squats)
    * Push-ups
    * Russian Twists
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.
* **Notes:**  Push yourself during each interval, but prioritize form.

**Day 7: Active Recovery - 30 mins:**  Light walk, yoga, or foam rolling.



---

**Week 3: Progressive Overload & Increased Complexity (4 Workouts)**

**Day 8: Lower Body Strength & HIIT - 40 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (30 mins):**
    * Weighted Squats (light dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Bulgarian Split Squats: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Rest 60 secs)
    * Hip Thrusts (weighted): 3 sets of 12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * HIIT: Lunges – 40 secs work / 20 secs rest x 5 rounds
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 9: Upper Body & Core Strength - 35 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations.
* **Workout (25 mins):**
    * Dumbbell Chest Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Pull-ups (assisted if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest 60 secs)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest 60 secs)
    * Plank with shoulder taps: 3 sets of 10 reps per side (Rest 60 secs)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 10: Full Body HIIT - 45 minutes**

* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Light cardio, dynamic stretching.
* **Workout (35 mins):**
    * Burpees (full or modified): 40 secs work / 20 secs rest x 6 rounds
    * Mountain Climbers: 40 secs work / 20 secs rest x 6 rounds
    * Squat Jumps: 40 secs work / 20 secs rest x 6 rounds
    * Push-ups: 40 secs work / 20 secs rest x 6 rounds
    * Russian Twists (weighted): 40 secs work / 20 secs rest

## 10-Week Swimming Program for Weight Loss & Health Improvement - Intermediate Level

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Goal:** Weight Loss, Health Improvement
**Level:** Intermediate
**Duration:** 30-45 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 3-4 times per week

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Consult Your Doctor:** Before starting any new fitness program, consult your physician to ensure you are healthy enough to participate.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially before, during, and after your swim sessions. Aim for at least 8 glasses of water daily. Consider an electrolyte drink post-workout if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:** This program is most effective when combined with a healthy, balanced diet. Focus on lean proteins, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Don’t push yourself too hard, especially in the beginning. Rest when you need to, and don't hesitate to modify exercises if you experience pain.
* **Proper Form:** Maintaining correct swimming technique is crucial to prevent injuries and maximize results. Consider a session with a swim coach to refine your form.
* **Supplements (Optional):** A multivitamin can support overall health.  Creatine can help with muscle recovery, but is not essential for this program.  Discuss supplement use with your doctor.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night) and active recovery (light stretching, walking) on your off days.



---

**Week 1: Building Endurance & Technique**

*Focus: Establishing a baseline, refining technique, and building initial endurance.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, 100m pull buoy, 100m kickboard.
    * **Main Set (20 mins):** 8 x 50m freestyle @ moderate pace (10s rest), 4 x 100m freestyle @ easy pace (15s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy breaststroke or backstroke.
    * **Notes:** Focus on long strokes and efficient breathing. Hydrate with water and a small snack post-workout.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** *Rest or Active Recovery - 30 min walk*
* **Day 3 (Friday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, 100m arm circles, 100m leg swings.
    * **Main Set (20 mins):** 6 x 75m freestyle @ moderate pace (12s rest), 4 x 50m backstroke @ easy pace (10s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:** Pay attention to your body position in the water.  Keep your core engaged.

---

**Week 2: Increasing Distance & Introducing Intervals**

*Focus: Gradually increasing swimming distance and introducing interval training for enhanced calorie burn.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull buoy, 100m kickboard.
    * **Main Set (25 mins):** 6 x 100m freestyle @ moderate pace (15s rest), 4 x 50m sprint freestyle (20s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy breaststroke.
    * **Notes:**  The sprint sets should be challenging but maintain good form.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** *Rest or Active Recovery - Yoga/Stretching*
* **Day 3 (Friday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m freestyle, dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings).
    * **Main Set (25 mins):** 8 x 75m freestyle @ moderate pace (12s rest), 4 x 25m sprint freestyle (15s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy backstroke.
    * **Notes:**  Focus on a strong kick during the sprint sets.

---

**Week 3:  Variety & Technique Refinement**

*Focus: Incorporating different strokes and drills to improve overall technique and prevent boredom.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m freestyle, 100m pull buoy, 100m kickboard.
    * **Main Set (25 mins):** 4 x 100m freestyle @ moderate pace (15s rest), 4 x 50m butterfly (or dolphin kick with board) @ easy pace (20s rest), 4 x 50m breaststroke @ moderate pace (15s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.
    * **Notes:**  Don't be afraid to modify the butterfly if it's challenging. Focus on proper form.
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** *Rest or Active Recovery - Light Cycling*
* **Day 3 (Friday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 200m freestyle, drill work (finger drag drill, catch-up drill).
    * **Main Set (25 mins):** 6 x 75m freestyle with drill work every other length (12s rest), 4 x 50m backstroke @ moderate pace (10s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy breaststroke.
    * **Notes:** Drill work helps improve technique.



---

**Week 4:  Increasing Intensity & Distance**

*Focus: Pushing your limits with longer intervals and increased overall distance.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 300m freestyle, 100m pull buoy.
    * **Main Set (30 mins):** 4 x 150m freestyle @ moderate pace (20s rest), 4 x 75m sprint freestyle (30s rest).

* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** *Rest or Active Recovery - Foam Rolling*
* **Day 3 (Friday):**
    * **Warm-up (5 mins):** 300m freestyle, dynamic stretching.
    * **Main Set (30 mins):** 6 x 100m freestyle @ moderate pace (15s rest), 4 x 50m IM (Individual Medley - Butterfly, Backstroke, Breaststroke, Freestyle) @ easy pace (20s rest).
    * **Cool-down (5 mins):** 200m easy freestyle.

---

**Week 5-10: Progressive Overload & Maintenance**

*Focus: Continually challenging your body by increasing distance, intensity, and incorporating more complex sets.  Maintain hydration and nutrition.*

* **Distance:** Increase the length of the intervals (e.g., 100m to 150m, 150m to 200m).  Increase the total distance of the main set.
* **Intensity:** Reduce rest intervals. Increase the speed during sprint sets.
* **Complexity:** Introduce more challenging drills.  Incorporate more IM sets.  Add sets with varying stroke types.

* **Week 6:** Reduce rest intervals by 5 seconds. Add 2 x 100m freestyle pull buoy with paddles.
* **Week 7:** Increase distance of sprint intervals. Introduce pyramid sets (e.g., 50m, 100m, 150m, 100m, 50m).
* **Week 8:** Focus on technique refinement.  Record yourself swimming and analyze your form.
* **Week 9:**  Increase overall distance of the workout by 15%.  Incorporate more challenging IM sets.
* **Week 10:**  Taper week – reduce volume by 20-30% to allow for recovery. Focus on maintaining technique and enjoying your progress.

## Ivan Orlov's 2-Week Health Improvement Bodybuilding Program (Intermediate)

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Goal:** Health Improvement (Focus on building lean muscle, improving strength endurance, and overall well-being)
**Level:** Intermediate (Assumes some prior weightlifting experience and familiarity with basic exercises)
**Duration:** 30-45 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 3 times per week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday – adjustable to your schedule)

**Important Considerations Before Starting:**

* **Consult Your Doctor:**  Before beginning any new exercise program, consult your physician to ensure you are healthy enough to participate.
* **Proper Form:**  Prioritize proper form over lifting heavy weight. Incorrect form can lead to injuries. Watch videos and, if possible, work with a trainer to learn the correct technique.
* **Listen to Your Body:**  Rest when you need to. Don't push through pain.  Soreness is normal, but sharp or persistent pain is a sign to stop.
* **Nutrition is Key:** This program is most effective when combined with a healthy, balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Aim for at least 0.8-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight.
* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially before, during, and after workouts.  Aim for at least half your body weight in ounces.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider a creatine supplement (3-5g daily) for enhanced performance and recovery.  Whey protein can help meet your daily protein needs.  Always research and consult with a healthcare professional before taking any supplements.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize sleep (7-9 hours per night) and active recovery (light cardio, stretching, foam rolling) on rest days.



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Muscle Activation**

**Warm-up (5 minutes - before each workout):**
* Jumping Jacks: 30 seconds
* High Knees: 30 seconds
* Butt Kicks: 30 seconds
* Arm Circles (forward & backward): 30 seconds each
* Dynamic Stretching:  Torso Twists, Leg Swings (forward & side) - 10 reps each leg

**Cool-down (5 minutes - after each workout):**
* Static Stretching: Hold each stretch for 30 seconds. Focus on major muscle groups worked during the session (chest, back, legs, shoulders, arms).  Examples: Hamstring stretch, Quadriceps stretch, Triceps stretch, Chest stretch, Shoulder stretch.



**Day 1 (Monday): Upper Body – Push Focus**

* **Exercise:** Bench Press (Barbell or Dumbbell) – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Incline Dumbbell Press – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Dumbbell Shoulder Press – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Triceps Pushdowns (Cable or Resistance Band) – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Lateral Raises – 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Notes:** Focus on controlled movements.  Choose a weight that challenges you while maintaining good form. Hydrate well before, during, and after.

**Day 2 (Wednesday): Lower Body & Core**

* **Exercise:** Squats (Barbell or Goblet Squat) – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs) – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Leg Press – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Walking Lunges – 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Plank – 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds, 30 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Russian Twists (with or without weight) – 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side, 30 seconds rest
* **Notes:** Maintain a neutral spine during squats and RDLs.  Focus on engaging your core throughout the workout.

**Day 3 (Friday): Upper Body – Pull Focus**

* **Exercise:** Pull-ups (Assisted if needed) – 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Bent-Over Rows (Barbell or Dumbbell) – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Lat Pulldowns – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Bicep Curls (Barbell or Dumbbell) – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Face Pulls – 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Notes:**  Squeeze your shoulder blades together during rows and lat pulldowns.  Control the eccentric (lowering) phase of each exercise.




---

### **Week 2: Progressive Overload & Intensity**

**Warm-up (5 minutes - before each workout):**  Same as Week 1.

**Cool-down (5 minutes - after each workout):** Same as Week 1.  Consider adding foam rolling for key muscle groups.

**Day 4 (Monday): Upper Body – Push Focus (Progressive Overload)**

* **Exercise:** Bench Press (Barbell or Dumbbell) – 3 sets of 6-10 reps (increase weight slightly from Week 1), 75-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Incline Dumbbell Press – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Arnold Press – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Close-Grip Bench Press – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Front Raises – 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining proper form with the increased weight.  If you can easily complete all reps, increase the weight further next session.

**Day 5 (Wednesday): Lower Body & Core (Progressive Overload)**

* **Exercise:** Back Squats (Barbell) – 3 sets of 6-10 reps (increase weight slightly from Week 1), 75-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Deadlifts – 1 set of 5 reps, 1 set of 3 reps, 1 set of 1 rep (work up to a challenging weight), 90-120 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Leg Extensions – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Hamstring Curls – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Hanging Leg Raises – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Bicycle Crunches – 3 sets of 20-30 reps per side, 30 seconds rest
* **Notes:**  Deadlifts require strict form.  Watch videos and consider getting guidance from a trainer.  Focus on controlled movements.

**Day 6 (Friday): Upper Body – Pull Focus (Progressive Overload)**

* **Exercise:** Weighted Pull-ups (if possible) or Assisted Pull-ups – 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 75-90 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Chest-Supported Rows – 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Seated Cable Rows – 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Hammer Curls – 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Exercise:** Rear Delt Flyes (Dumbbell or Machine) – 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 seconds rest
* **Notes:**  Focus on contracting your back muscles during pulling exercises.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to protect your joints.



**Post-Program Advice:**

* **Continue Progressive Overload:**  The key to continued progress is consistently challenging your muscles.  Gradually increase the weight, reps, or sets over time.
* **Vary Your Routine:**  To prevent plateaus and keep things interesting, periodically change your exercises, rep ranges, or training style.
* **Prioritize Recovery:**  Don't underestimate the importance of rest and recovery.  Listen to your body and take rest days when needed.
* **Stay Consistent:**  Consistency is the most important factor in achieving your fitness goals.  Make exercise a regular part of your lifestyle.
* **Enjoy the Process:**  Find activities you enjoy and make fitness a fun and rewarding experience!
