## Two-Week Beginner Yoga for Muscle Gain & Health Improvement – Guided by Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for beginners looking to build muscle, improve overall health, and experience the incredible benefits of yoga. We’ll focus on foundational poses, mindful movement, and building a consistent practice. Remember to listen to your body, modify poses as needed, and prioritize proper form over depth. Consistency is key!

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily, especially before, during, and after practice. Consider adding electrolytes if you sweat heavily.
* **Nutrition:**  Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein (aim for 0.8-1 gram per pound of bodyweight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a plant-based protein supplement post-workout to aid muscle recovery.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep each night.  Foam rolling and gentle stretching on rest days will enhance recovery.  Epsom salt baths are also beneficial.
* **Modifications:** I will indicate modifications where appropriate. Don’t hesitate to use props (blocks, straps, blankets) to support your practice.
* **Breathing (Pranayama):**  Ujjayi breath (ocean breath) will be utilized throughout the practice.  Focus on deep, even breaths.
* **Disclaimer:** Consult your doctor before starting any new exercise program.



---

**Week 1: Foundations & Building Strength**

**Day 1 (Monday) – Gentle Flow & Core Activation (65 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Cat-Cow (10 reps), Gentle Neck Rolls (5 each direction), Wrist & Ankle Rotations (10 each direction), Sun Salutation A (3 rounds – slow and mindful).
* **Workout (45 mins):**
    * **Mountain Pose (Tadasana):** 5 breaths, focusing on grounding.
    * **Warrior I (Virabhadrasana I):** 3 sets of 8 reps per side, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Shorten your stance if needed.*
    * **Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II):** 3 sets of 8 reps per side, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Keep a slight bend in the front knee.*
    * **Triangle Pose (Trikonasana):** 3 sets of 6 reps per side, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Use a block to support your hand.*
    * **Plank:** 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Drop to your knees.*
    * **Boat Pose (Navasana):** 3 sets of 5-8 reps, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Keep your knees bent.*
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Child’s Pose (2 mins), Reclined Spinal Twist (1 min per side), Savasana (Corpse Pose - 5 mins).
* **Notes:** Focus on engaging your core throughout the practice.



**Day 2 (Wednesday) – Hip Opening & Back Strengthening (70 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Cat-Cow (10 reps), Hip Circles (10 each direction), Sun Salutation B (3 rounds – slow and mindful).
* **Workout (50 mins):**
    * **Pigeon Pose (Eka Pada Rajakapotasana):** 3 sets, hold for 60 seconds per side, 45 sec rest. *Modification: Use a blanket under your hip for support.*
    * **Low Lunge (Anjaneyasana):** 3 sets of 8 reps per side, 30 sec rest.
    * **Bridge Pose (Setu Bandhasana):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Place a block under your sacrum for support.*
    * **Locust Pose (Salabhasana):** 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 30 sec rest. *Modification: Keep your arms by your sides.*
    * **Bow Pose (Dhanurasana):** 3 sets of 5-8 reps, 45 sec rest. *Modification: Start with a gentle backbend.*
* **Cool-down (10 mins):** Happy Baby Pose (1 min), Knees-to-Chest Pose (1 min), Savasana (Corpse Pose - 8 mins).
* **Notes:**  Pay attention to your breath and avoid forcing any poses.



**Day 3 (Friday) – Full Body Flow & Balance (60 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 mins):** Sun Salutations A & B (2 rounds each).
* **Workout (40 mins):**
    * **Chair Pose (Utkatasana):** 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 30 sec rest.
    * **Tree Pose (Vrksasana):** 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds per side, 45 sec rest. *Modification: Keep your foot lower on your leg.*
    * **Reverse Warrior (Viparita Virabhadrasana):** 3 sets of 6 reps per side, 30 sec rest.
    * **Extended Side Angle Pose (Utthita Parsvakonasana):** 3 sets of 6 reps per side, 30 sec rest.
    * **Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana):** 5 breaths, repeat 3 times, 30 sec rest between sets.
* **Cool-down (10 mins):**  Forward Fold (Uttanasana - 1 min), Seated Forward Fold (Paschimottanasana - 1 min), Savasana (Corpse Pose - 8 mins).
* **Notes:**  Engage your core for balance and stability.

## Ivan Orlov's 10-Week Dance-Focused Flexibility & Muscle Gain Program (Intermediate)

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Activity:** Dancing (Varied Styles - Contemporary, Jazz Funk, Ballet-Inspired)
**Goal:** Flexibility Improvement & Muscle Gain
**Level:** Intermediate (Comfortable with basic dance steps, some strength training experience)
**Average Duration:** 60-90 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 2 times per week.  (Adjust rest days based on individual recovery needs. Active recovery – light walking, yoga – is encouraged on off-days.)

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Listen to your body:**  Pain is a signal. Modify exercises or rest if needed. Don’t push through sharp pain.
* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days. Consider electrolytes if sweating heavily.
* **Nutrition:**  Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein (0.8-1 gram per pound of body weight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a creatine supplement (3-5g daily) to aid muscle recovery and growth (consult with a healthcare professional).
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Foam rolling and stretching on rest days will enhance recovery.
* **Footwear:** Wear supportive dance shoes appropriate for the style being practiced.
* **Space:** Ensure you have a clear, safe space to move without obstructions.
* **Warm-up & Cool-down are NON-NEGOTIABLE:** They are crucial for injury prevention and maximizing results.



---

**Week 1: Foundations & Mobility**

*Focus: Establishing a baseline, improving range of motion, and activating key muscle groups.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Contemporary Dance & Flexibility Focus (75 mins)**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):**  Cardio - Light jogging in place, jumping jacks (2 mins). Dynamic Stretching – Arm circles, leg swings (forward, backward, side), torso twists, hip circles (8 mins).
    * **Dance Segment (30 mins):** Contemporary floor work - rolls, contractions, releases.  Focus on fluidity and connecting breath to movement. Basic contemporary steps – chassé, relevé, plié.
    * **Flexibility (20 mins):**  Hamstring stretches (seated forward fold, standing hamstring stretch - 3 sets of 30 sec hold each leg). Quad stretches (standing quad stretch, kneeling quad stretch - 3 sets of 30 sec hold each leg). Hip flexor stretches (lunge stretch, pigeon pose - 3 sets of 30 sec hold each side).
    * **Cool-down (15 mins):** Static stretching – holding each stretch for 60 seconds. Focus on major muscle groups worked. Deep breathing exercises.
    * **Hydration:** 16oz water before, during, and after.
    * **Note:** Focus on proper form over speed.

* **Day 2 (Thursday): Jazz Funk & Core Strengthening (65 mins)**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):**  Cardio – Marching in place with arm variations, grapevine (2 mins). Dynamic Stretching –  Torso twists, hip rotations, shoulder shrugs (8 mins).
    * **Dance Segment (25 mins):**  Basic Jazz Funk steps – heel-toe, jazz square, pivot turns.  Short choreography incorporating these steps.
    * **Core (20 mins):** Plank (3 sets of 30-60 sec hold). Crunches (3 sets of 15-20 reps). Russian twists (3 sets of 15-20 reps per side). Leg raises (3 sets of 15-20 reps).
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching focusing on core and lower body.  Deep breathing.
    * **Hydration:** 16oz water before, during, and after.
    * **Note:** Engage your core throughout the dance segment.



---

**Week 2: Building Strength & Control**

*Focus: Increasing muscle endurance and refining technique.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Ballet-Inspired & Leg Strength (80 mins)**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** Barre work preparation - pliés, tendus, dégagés (5 mins). Dynamic Stretching – Leg swings, hip circles, ankle rotations (5 mins).
    * **Ballet Segment (30 mins):** Basic ballet positions (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 5th).  Plié combinations, tendu combinations, dégagé combinations.  Focus on turnout and posture.
    * **Leg Strength (30 mins):** Squats (3 sets of 12-15 reps). Lunges (3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg). Calf raises (3 sets of 15-20 reps). Glute bridges (3 sets of 15-20 reps).
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching focusing on legs and back.
    * **Hydration:** 16oz water before, during, and after.
    * **Note:**  Maintain proper alignment during ballet exercises.

* **Day 2 (Thursday): Contemporary & Upper Body Strength (70 mins)**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** Cardio – Jogging in place with arm variations, jumping jacks (2 mins). Dynamic Stretching – Arm circles, torso twists, shoulder rotations (8 mins).
    * **Dance Segment (25 mins):**  Contemporary improvisation - exploring different levels and qualities of movement.  Focus on emotional expression.
    * **Upper Body Strength (25 mins):** Push-ups (3 sets of as many reps as possible).  Dumbbell rows (3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm – use light to moderate weight).  Bicep curls (3 sets of 10-12 reps – use light to moderate weight). Tricep dips (3 sets of 10-12 reps).
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** Static stretching focusing on upper body and core.
    * **Hydration:** 16oz water before, during, and after.
    * **Note:** Control your breathing during strength exercises.



---

**(Weeks 3-10 follow a similar structure, progressively increasing intensity and complexity.  Here's a summary of the progression. Detailed daily breakdowns would be too extensive for this response, but this provides the framework.)**

**Weeks 3-4:  Increased Choreography & Plyometrics**
* Introduction of more complex choreography in each style.
* Incorporation of plyometric exercises (jump squats, box jumps, burpees) to enhance power and explosiveness.
* Increase sets/reps for strength exercises.
* Introduction of interval training during cardio warm-ups.

**Weeks 5-6:  Focus on Turns & Balance**
* Dedicated practice of turns (pirouettes, fouetté turns, jazz turns).
* Balance exercises (single-leg stands, balance board work).
* Strength exercises targeting core and stabilizing muscles.
* Introduction of resistance bands for added challenge.

**Weeks 7-8:  Advanced Flexibility & Conditioning**
*  Partner stretching (if available and safe).
*  Active flexibility drills (dynamic stretching with controlled movements).
*  Longer dance combinations requiring stamina and endurance.
*  Increased focus on cardiovascular conditioning through interval training.

**Weeks 9-10:  Performance & Refinement**
*  Development of a short dance piece incorporating elements from all three styles.
*  Refinement of technique and artistry.
*  Video recording and self-assessment.
*  Maintenance of strength and flexibility gains.  Tapering volume slightly to allow for peak performance.



**General Weekly Structure (Weeks 3-10):**

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Style-Specific Dance (40-50 mins) + Strength Training (30-40 mins) focusing on muscle groups relevant to that style.
* **Day 2 (Thursday):**  Cross-Training Dance (Mixing Styles) (30-40 mins) + Flexibility & Core (30-40 mins) with a focus on active stretching and dynamic movement.

**Ongoing Considerations:**

* **Supplements:** Consider a multivitamin and omega-3 fatty acids for overall health.
* **Active Recovery:** Incorporate yoga, Pilates, or light walking on rest days.
* **Mindfulness:** Practice mindfulness and meditation to reduce stress and improve focus.
* **Progression:** Continuously challenge yourself by increasing the intensity, duration, or complexity of your workouts.
* **Enjoy the Process:**  Dance should be fun!  Choose music you love and celebrate your progress.



This program is a guideline.  Individual needs and progress may vary.  It is always best to consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new fitness program.  Good luck, and enjoy the journey!

## The Orlov Aquatic Strength Program: 10-Week Muscle Gain for Intermediate Swimmers

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Goal:** Muscle Gain
**Activity:** Swimming
**Level:** Intermediate
**Duration:** 60-90 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 2 times per week

**Program Philosophy:** This program focuses on leveraging the unique resistance of water to build muscle mass and strength. It combines varied swim sets with specific drills to target different muscle groups. We’ll prioritize technique, progressive overload, and recovery to maximize results.  Remember, consistent effort and proper form are key.  Listen to your body, and don’t hesitate to adjust if needed. This isn't just about swimming laps; it's about *intentional* swimming for strength.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink 16-24oz of water *before* each session, sip throughout, and replenish post-workout. Consider an electrolyte drink for longer or particularly intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:**  Muscle gain requires a caloric surplus and adequate protein intake (approximately 0.8-1 gram per pound of bodyweight). Focus on lean proteins, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine monohydrate (3-5g daily) can aid muscle growth and performance.  Whey protein post-workout can assist with recovery. *Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) on off-days is encouraged.  Foam rolling can help alleviate muscle soreness.



---

**Week 1: Building the Foundation**

*Focus: Technique refinement, establishing baseline strength, and getting comfortable with the program’s structure.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m easy freestyle, 200m pull with pull buoy, 200m kick with kickboard.
    * **Main Set (40 mins):**
        * 8 x 50m freestyle @ moderate pace, 15 sec rest (Focus: High Elbow Catch)
        * 6 x 75m freestyle @ slightly faster pace, 20 sec rest (Focus: Body Rotation)
        * 4 x 100m freestyle @ challenging pace, 30 sec rest (Focus: Maintaining form)
        * 4 x 50m IM @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest (Focus: Transitions)
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, 100m pull, stretching (shoulders, back, legs).
    * **Notes:** Focus on maintaining good technique throughout.  Don't push too hard – this week is about establishing a baseline.

* **Day 2 (Thursday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m easy freestyle, 200m drill (fingertip drag), 200m kick.
    * **Main Set (40 mins):**
        * 6 x 100m freestyle pull with pull buoy @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest (Focus: Core engagement)
        * 4 x 75m kick with kickboard @ moderate pace, 15 sec rest (Focus: Streamline and powerful kick)
        * 8 x 25m sprint freestyle @ maximum effort, 30 sec rest (Focus: Explosive power)
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, 100m stretch.
    * **Notes:** Pay attention to your core engagement during the pull set.  The sprint set is about short bursts of maximum effort.



---

**Week 2: Increasing Volume & Introducing Resistance**

*Focus: Gradually increasing the total distance swum and introducing resistance with fins.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m freestyle, 200m pull, 200m kick.
    * **Main Set (45 mins):**
        * 10 x 50m freestyle @ moderate pace, 15 sec rest
        * 8 x 75m freestyle @ slightly faster pace, 20 sec rest
        * 6 x 100m freestyle @ challenging pace, 30 sec rest
        * 4 x 50m IM @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, stretching.

* **Day 2 (Thursday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m freestyle, 200m drill, 200m kick.
    * **Main Set (45 mins):**
        * 8 x 100m freestyle pull with fins @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest (Fins add resistance)
        * 6 x 75m kick with fins @ moderate pace, 15 sec rest (Fins increase kick power)
        * 6 x 50m sprint freestyle with fins @ maximum effort, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, stretching.



---

**Weeks 3-10: Progressive Overload & Specialization**

*(The following weeks build on the previous structure, increasing volume, intensity, and introducing more complex sets.  The core principle is progressive overload – gradually increasing the demands on your muscles to stimulate growth.)*

**Weeks 3 & 4:  Focus on Endurance & Pull Strength**

* Increase main set distances by 25-50m per interval.
* Add sets focused on pull work (using pull buoy and paddles – *introduce paddles gradually*).  Example: 6 x 150m pull with paddles, 20 sec rest.
* Introduce hypoxic sets (breathing every 3, 5, or 7 strokes) for short distances (25-50m).

**Weeks 5 & 6: Focus on Kick Strength & Speed**

* Increase kickboard sets, incorporating varied kick types (flutter, dolphin).  Example: 8 x 100m dolphin kick with fins, 20 sec rest.
* Introduce sprint kick sets with short rest intervals. Example: 10 x 25m sprint kick, 15 sec rest.
* Continue increasing freestyle distances.

**Weeks 7 & 8:  Focus on IM & Interval Training**

* Increase the complexity of IM sets, adding more strokes and distances. Example: 4 x 200m IM, 30 sec rest.
* Incorporate interval training with varying intensities and rest intervals. Example: 6 x 100m fast, 15 sec rest, followed by 4 x 50m easy, 10 sec rest.
* Focus on smooth transitions between strokes in the IM.

**Weeks 9 & 10: Peak & Taper**

* **Week 9 (Peak):**  Highest volume and intensity of the program.  Longer sets, shorter rest intervals.  Example: 12 x 100m freestyle @ challenging pace, 20 sec rest.
* **Week 10 (Taper):**  Reduce volume by 30-50% to allow for recovery and supercompensation. Maintain intensity, but with longer rest intervals.  Focus on technique and feeling strong.  This is about being ready to perform, not breaking down.  Example: 6 x 50m freestyle @ fast pace, 30 sec rest.



---

**Sample Week 7 Schedule (Illustrative):**

* **Day 1 (Monday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m freestyle, 200m pull, 200m kick.
    * **Main Set (50 mins):**
        * 6 x 100m freestyle @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest
        * 4 x 150m freestyle pull with pull buoy and paddles @ moderate pace, 25 sec rest
        * 4 x 50m hypoxic freestyle (breathing every 5 strokes), 20 sec rest
        * 4 x 200m IM @ challenging pace, 30 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, stretching.

* **Day 2 (Thursday):**
    * **Warm-up (10 mins):** 400m freestyle, 200m drill, 200m kick.
    * **Main Set (50 mins):**
        * 8 x 100m kick with fins @ moderate pace, 20 sec rest
        * 6 x 75m sprint kick with fins, 15 sec rest
        * 8 x 50m freestyle sprint with fins, 30 sec rest
        * 4 x 100m freestyle @ fast pace, 25 sec rest
    * **Cool-down (10 mins):** 200m easy freestyle, stretching

## 10-Week Advanced Cycling Program for Weight Loss - With Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for experienced cyclists looking to maximize weight loss through focused, high-intensity cycling workouts.  We'll be combining interval training, endurance rides, and strength work to boost your metabolism, build lean muscle, and achieve your goals. Remember consistency is key!  Listen to your body, prioritize recovery, and enjoy the ride.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after rides. Consider electrolyte drinks for longer or particularly intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** This program works best when paired with a healthy, calorie-controlled diet. Focus on lean protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consult a registered dietitian for personalized nutrition guidance.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Consider a multivitamin, creatine (for recovery - consult your doctor), and potentially branched-chain amino acids (BCAAs) post-workout.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Incorporate active recovery days (light walking, stretching) and foam rolling.
* **Bike Fit:** Ensure your bike is properly fitted to prevent injuries.
* **Safety:** Always wear a helmet and follow traffic laws.  Be aware of your surroundings.
* **RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion):**  We'll use RPE on a scale of 1-10, where 1 is very easy and 10 is maximal effort.



---

**Week 1: Building a Base & Introduction to Intervals**

*Focus: Re-establishing a solid cycling base and introducing short, sharp intervals.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Endurance Ride - 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning.  Main: 20 minutes at RPE 5-6 (conversational pace). Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning.  *Hydration: 500ml water during ride.*
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** Interval Training - 25 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 8 x 30 seconds high intensity (RPE 8-9) with 60 seconds recovery spinning. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning. *Supplement: Consider a small protein shake post-workout.*
* **Day 3 (Friday):** Active Recovery - 20 minutes easy spinning, focusing on high cadence (90-100 RPM). *Focus on light effort and enjoying the ride.*

**Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Strength Introduction**

*Focus:  Increasing the duration of intervals and introducing off-bike strength training.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Endurance Ride - 35 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 25 minutes at RPE 5-6. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning. *Hydration: 750ml water during ride.*
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** Interval Training - 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 10 x 45 seconds high intensity (RPE 8-9) with 75 seconds recovery spinning. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning. *Supplement: BCAA post-workout.*
* **Day 3 (Friday):** Strength Training - 30 minutes. Squats (3 sets of 12 reps), Lunges (3 sets of 10 reps per leg), Plank (3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds), Push-ups (3 sets to failure). *Rest 60 seconds between sets. Focus on proper form.*

**Week 3:  Hill Repeats & Core Work**

*Focus: Adding hill repeats to build strength and endurance, and incorporating core work.*

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Hill Repeats - 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 6-8 hill repeats (30-60 seconds each, RPE 7-8) with easy spinning descent for recovery. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning. *Focus on maintaining good form while climbing.*
* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** Interval Training - 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 6 x 60 seconds high intensity (RPE 8-9) with 90 seconds recovery spinning. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning.
* **Day 3 (Friday):** Core & Strength - 30 minutes. Crunches (3 sets of 15 reps), Russian Twists (3 sets of 15 reps per side), Leg Raises (3 sets of 15 reps), Plank (3 sets, hold for 45-60 seconds), Squats (3 sets of 12 reps). *Rest 60 seconds between sets.*

*Focus: Building endurance with a longer ride and prioritizing recovery.*

* **Day 2 (Wednesday):** Interval Training - 35 minutes. Warm-up: 5 min easy spinning. Main: 5 x 2 minutes high intensity (RPE 8-9) with 2 minutes recovery spinning. Cool-down: 5 min easy spinning.
* **Day 3 (Friday):** Active Recovery - 30 minutes easy spinning, focusing on high cadence. Foam rolling for legs and back. *Prioritize gentle movement and muscle recovery.*

**Week 5:  Tempo Ride & Strength Focus**

*Focus: Introducing tempo rides and increasing strength training intensity.*

## Functional Fitness for Weight Loss: 5-Week Adaptive Program – with Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Welcome!** I’m Ivan Orlov, and I’m thrilled you’ve chosen to embark on this 5-week functional fitness journey with me. This program is designed for *all* levels, meaning we'll adapt exercises to suit your current fitness. The focus is on building a strong, capable body through functional movements – exercises that mimic everyday life – while effectively burning calories and achieving your weight loss goals. Remember consistency is key! Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and enjoy the process.

**Important Notes Before You Begin:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** This program is most effective when combined with a healthy, balanced diet. Focus on whole, unprocessed foods. Consider consulting a registered dietitian for personalized nutrition guidance.
* **Supplements (Optional):** A multivitamin and Omega-3 fatty acids can be beneficial. Protein powder can aid muscle recovery, especially after intense workouts.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep each night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Adaptive Nature:**  I’ll provide modifications for each exercise. Beginners, choose the easier modification. Intermediate/Advanced, challenge yourselves with the more difficult options.
* **Listen to Your Body:** Pain is a signal. Stop if you feel sharp pain and consult a healthcare professional.
* **Warm-up:** 5-10 minutes of dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists, high knees, butt kicks).
* **Cool-down:** 5-10 minutes of static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds).



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Mobility**

**Focus:** Establishing proper form, building core strength, and improving mobility.

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body Circuit – Beginner Focus**
    * Warm-up
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Modification: Chair Squats)
    * Push-ups: 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Modification: Knee Push-ups)
    * Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg (Modification: Stationary Lunges)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Modification: Plank on knees)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (Use light weights - 5-10lbs)
    * Rest: 60-90 seconds between sets.
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Focus on controlled movements.  Hydrate well.

* **Day 2 (Wednesday): Core & Cardio**
    * Warm-up
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Modification: Feet on the ground)
    * Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10 reps per side
    * Jumping Jacks: 3 sets of 30 seconds (Modification: Step Jacks)
    * High Knees: 3 sets of 30 seconds
    * Rest: 45-60 seconds between sets.
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Engage your core throughout all exercises.

* **Day 3 (Friday): Upper Body & Flexibility**
    * Warm-up
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Light weights - 5-8lbs)
    * Dumbbell Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Light weights - 5-8lbs)
    * Dumbbell Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Light weights - 5-8lbs)
    * Superman: 3 sets of 15 reps
    * Cat-Cow Stretch: 10 reps
    * Child’s Pose: Hold for 60 seconds
    * Rest: 60-90 seconds between sets.
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Focus on controlled movements and proper form.



---

### **Week 2: Increasing Intensity & Compound Movements**

**Focus:** Introducing more challenging variations and incorporating compound exercises.

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body Strength**
    * Warm-up
    * Goblet Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell close to your chest)
    * Incline Push-ups: 3 sets of AMRAP (Hands elevated on a bench or step)
    * Reverse Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg
    * Plank with Shoulder Taps: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds
    * Dumbbell Deadlifts: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Moderate weight – 10-15lbs)
    * Rest: 60-90 seconds between sets.
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:*  Maintain a neutral spine during deadlifts.

    * Mountain Climbers: 3 sets of 30 seconds
    * Plank Jacks: 3 sets of 20 reps
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps
    * Hollow Body Hold: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds
    * Rest: 45-60 seconds between sets.
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Push yourself during HIIT intervals.

* **Day 3 (Friday): Upper Body & Mobility**

    * *Note:* Focus on controlled movements and proper form.



---

### **Week 3: Progressive Overload & Functional Patterns**

**Focus:** Increasing weight, reps, or sets, and incorporating exercises that mimic real-life movements.

## Pilates Competition Preparation: 2-Week Beginner Program – with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen this program to prepare for your Pilates competition. This 2-week plan is designed for beginners, focusing on building foundational strength, control, and technique crucial for success. Remember, consistency and proper form are *far* more important than pushing yourself too hard, especially in the beginning. Listen to your body, modify exercises as needed, and enjoy the process!

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a small protein snack (e.g., Greek yogurt, handful of almonds) within 30-60 minutes post-workout to aid recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Magnesium can aid muscle recovery. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery (light walking, stretching) on rest days is encouraged.
* **Form over Quantity:**  I cannot stress this enough.  Watch videos of proper form for each exercise (I’ll suggest resources below) and focus on quality of movement.  If you're unsure, film yourself and compare to the examples.
* **Resources:**  Pilates Anytime ([https://www.pilatesanytime.com/](https://www.pilatesanytime.com/)) and Blogilates ([https://blogilates.com/](https://blogilates.com/)) are excellent resources for form and modifications.



---

### **Week 1: Foundation & Core Engagement**

**Focus:** Establishing a strong core connection, learning fundamental Pilates principles (centering, concentration, control, precision, breath, flow), and building basic strength.

**Day 1 (Monday): Core Awakening & Spinal Mobility (65 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):**  Gentle spinal articulation (cat-cow stretch - 10 reps), pelvic tilts (15 reps), arm circles (forward & backward - 10 reps each), shoulder rolls (10 reps).
* **Workout (45 minutes):**
    * **Hundred:** 5 sets of 10 pumps (inhale 5 pumps, exhale 5 pumps). Rest 30 seconds between sets. *Modification: Keep feet on the floor.*
    * **Roll Up:** 5 reps. Rest 30 seconds. *Modification: Use arms to assist, or perform a partial roll-up.*
    * **Single Leg Circles:** 5 reps each leg, clockwise & counterclockwise. Rest 20 seconds between each direction.
    * **Rolling Like a Ball:** 8 reps. Rest 30 seconds. *Modification: Keep hands on shins, maintain a C-curve in the spine.*
    * **Spine Stretch Forward:** 8 reps. Rest 20 seconds.
    * **Swan Dive Prep:** 8 reps. Rest 20 seconds. *Focus on controlled extension, engaging back muscles.*
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Child’s pose (60 seconds), gentle spinal twists (30 seconds each side), hamstring stretch (30 seconds each leg).
* **Notes:** Focus on drawing your navel towards your spine throughout all exercises.  Breathing is key – inhale to prepare, exhale during the effort.

**Day 2 (Wednesday): Lower Body Strength & Stability (60 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):**  Hip circles (10 reps each direction), leg swings (forward & sideways - 10 reps each leg), ankle rotations (10 reps each ankle).
* **Workout (40 minutes):**
    * **Pilates Squats:** 10 reps, 3 sets. Rest 45 seconds between sets. *Focus on maintaining a neutral spine and engaging glutes.*
    * **Side Leg Series:** (Side Kicks – 8 reps each leg, Small Circles – 8 reps each leg, Leg Lifts – 8 reps each leg). Rest 30 seconds between each exercise.
    * **Clamshells:** 12 reps each side, 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds. *Use a resistance band for added challenge.*
    * **Hip Rolls:** 10 reps, 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Footwork (Pilates Footwork Series):** 8-10 reps each exercise (heel presses, ball of foot presses, arches, toes). 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):**  Hamstring stretch, quad stretch, calf stretch (30 seconds each leg), hip flexor stretch (30 seconds each side).
* **Notes:**  Pay attention to alignment – avoid letting knees cave in during squats.

**Day 3 (Friday): Upper Body & Core Integration (70 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):** Arm circles, shoulder blade squeezes, wrist rotations, thoracic spine rotations.
* **Workout (50 minutes):**
    * **Pilates Push-ups:** 5-8 reps, 3 sets. *Modification: Perform on knees.* Rest 45 seconds.
    * **Swimming:** 10 reps, 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds. *Focus on lengthening the spine and engaging back muscles.*
    * **Saw:** 8 reps each side, 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Teaser Prep:** 5 reps. Rest 45 seconds. *Modification: Start with knees bent.*
    * **Shoulder Bridge:** 10 reps, 3 sets. Rest 30 seconds. *Focus on squeezing glutes at the top.*
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Chest stretch, triceps stretch, shoulder stretch, gentle neck stretches.
* **Notes:**  Maintain a strong core throughout all upper body exercises.



---

### **Week 2: Building Endurance & Control**

**Focus:** Increasing repetitions, holding positions for longer durations, and refining technique. Introducing slightly more challenging variations.

**Day 4 (Monday): Core Challenge & Flow (75 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):**  Repeat Day 1 warm-up.
* **Workout (55 minutes):**
    * **Hundred:** 8 sets of 10 pumps. Rest 30 seconds between sets.
    * **Roll Up:** 8 reps. Rest 30 seconds. *Try to perform without arm assistance.*
    * **Single Leg Circles:** 8 reps each leg, clockwise & counterclockwise. Rest 20 seconds between each direction.
    * **Rolling Like a Ball:** 10 reps. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Spine Stretch Forward:** 10 reps. Rest 20 seconds.
    * **Swan Dive Prep:** 10 reps. Rest 20 seconds.
    * **Corkscrew:** 5 reps each side. Rest 30 seconds. *Focus on controlled rotation.*
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Repeat Day 1 cool-down.
* **Notes:**  Focus on maintaining a strong core connection throughout the entire workout.

**Day 5 (Wednesday): Lower Body Power & Precision (65 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):** Repeat Day 2 warm-up.
* **Workout (45 minutes):**
    * **Pilates Squats:** 12 reps, 4 sets. Rest 45 seconds between sets. *Add a pulse at the bottom for increased challenge.*
    * **Side Leg Series:** (Side Kicks – 10 reps each leg, Small Circles – 10 reps each leg, Leg Lifts – 10 reps each leg). Rest 30 seconds between each exercise. *Increase resistance band strength.*
    * **Clamshells:** 15 reps each side, 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Hip Rolls:** 12 reps, 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Footwork (Pilates Footwork Series):** 10-12 reps each exercise. 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
* **Cool-down (10 minutes):** Repeat Day 2 cool-down.
* **Notes:**  Focus on controlled movements and engaging the correct muscles.

**Day 6 (Friday): Full Body Integration & Control (70 minutes)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes):** Repeat Day 3 warm-up.
* **Workout (50 minutes):**
    * **Pilates Push-ups:** 8-10 reps, 4 sets. Rest 45 seconds.
    * **Swimming:** 12 reps, 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Saw:** 10 reps each side, 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds.
    * **Teaser Prep:** 8 reps. Rest 45 seconds. *Try to straighten legs slightly.*
    * **Shoulder Bridge:** 12 reps, 4 sets. Rest 30 seconds. *Add a leg lift for increased challenge.*

## 5-Week Dance Endurance & Flexibility Program - with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** I'm Maria Kuznetsova, and I'm thrilled you've chosen this program to boost your endurance and flexibility through the joy of dance. This program is designed for intermediate dancers, meaning you have some existing dance experience and a reasonable level of fitness. We’ll focus on building stamina, improving range of motion, and having *fun* while doing it! Remember to listen to your body, modify exercises as needed, and prioritize proper form. Consistency is key!

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink water *before*, *during*, and *after* each session. Aim for at least 8 glasses of water daily.
* **Nutrition:** Fuel your body with a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and whole grains. Consider a post-workout snack with protein and carbohydrates (e.g., Greek yogurt with berries) to aid recovery.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Magnesium can help with muscle recovery. Discuss with your doctor before starting any new supplement regime.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night. Active recovery days (light walking, stretching) are crucial.
* **Footwear:** Wear supportive athletic shoes designed for dance or cross-training.
* **Space:** Ensure you have a clear, safe space to move without obstacles.
* **Music:** Create playlists that motivate you! Vary the tempo and genre to keep things interesting.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Flow (Focus: Building Base Endurance & Dynamic Stretching)**

**Day 1: Rhythm & Warm-up (25 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Light cardio - marching in place, arm circles, torso twists. Dynamic stretches: leg swings (forward/backward, side-to-side), arm swings, torso rotations.
* **Exercise:** Salsa Basic Steps - 3 sets of 16 reps each side (30 sec rest)
* **Exercise:** Cha-Cha Basic Steps - 3 sets of 16 reps each side (30 sec rest)
* **Exercise:** Merengue Basic Steps - 3 sets of 16 reps (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches - hamstring stretch, quad stretch, calf stretch, tricep stretch, shoulder stretch (hold each for 30 seconds).
* **Note:** Focus on proper footwork and maintaining a consistent rhythm.

**Day 2: Flexibility Focus (30 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Gentle cardio - light jogging in place, shoulder rolls, neck rotations.
* **Exercise:**  Standing Forward Fold - 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds.
* **Exercise:**  Butterfly Stretch - 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds.
* **Exercise:**  Pigeon Pose (modified if needed) - 2 sets per side, hold for 30 seconds.
* **Exercise:**  Spinal Twist (seated) - 2 sets per side, hold for 30 seconds.
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Relaxation and deep breathing exercises.
* **Note:**  Breathe deeply throughout each stretch.  Don't force anything.

**Day 3:  Cardio Burst (20 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Similar to Day 1.
* **Exercise:**  Freestyle Dance (upbeat music) - 10 minutes.  Focus on keeping your heart rate elevated.
* **Exercise:**  Jump Rope (or jumping jacks) - 3 sets of 30 seconds (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):**  Static stretches, focusing on legs and core.

**Day 4: Rest or Active Recovery (Light walk 20-30 mins)**

**Day 5:  Combination Practice (25 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Dynamic stretching.
* **Exercise:** Salsa & Merengue Combo - 4 sets of 8 counts each (45 sec rest) – Create a short sequence combining steps from both dances.
* **Exercise:**  Cha-Cha & Salsa Transitions - 3 sets of 4 transitions (45 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretching.

**Day 6:  Core & Control (20 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Gentle core activation – pelvic tilts, cat-cow stretch.
* **Exercise:** Plank - 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (30 sec rest)
* **Exercise:** Crunches - 3 sets of 15-20 reps (30 sec rest)
* **Exercise:** Russian Twists (with or without weight) - 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (30 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Gentle back stretches.




---

**Week 2:  Building Stamina & Range of Motion**

**Day 8:  Salsa Endurance (30 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):**  Dynamic stretching.
* **Exercise:**  Salsa Basic Steps (faster tempo) - 4 sets of 32 reps each side (45 sec rest)
* **Exercise:**  Salsa Turns (right & left) - 3 sets of 8 turns each side (45 sec rest)
* **Cool-down (5 mins):** Static stretches.

**Day 9:  Flexibility & Flow (30 mins)**
* **Warm-up (5 mins):** Gentle cardio.
* **Exercise:**  Hamstring Stretch with Strap - 3 sets, hold for 45 seconds.

## 10-Week Health Improvement Bodybuilding Program – With Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for all fitness levels, aiming to improve your overall health, build strength, and enhance your physique. It’s adaptable, meaning you can adjust the weight/resistance based on your current capabilities. Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and stay consistent.  Remember, progress, not perfection, is the key.

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily. Increase intake on workout days.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a balanced diet rich in protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Consider a daily multivitamin.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  Creatine (3-5g daily) can aid in strength and muscle recovery. Whey protein can help meet protein goals. *Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen.*
* **Recovery:** Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, stretching) is encouraged on rest days.
* **Form Over Weight:** Always prioritize proper form to prevent injuries. Watch videos and practice in front of a mirror.
* **Progression:**  As you get stronger, gradually increase the weight/resistance, reps, or sets.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Familiarization (3 workouts)**

**Day 1: Full Body – Introduction**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):**  Jumping jacks (30 sec), High knees (30 sec), Butt kicks (30 sec), Arm circles (forward & backward - 30 sec each), Dynamic stretches (leg swings, torso twists - 60 sec)
* **Workout:**
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP) (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-60 seconds (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches (holding each stretch for 30 seconds) - hamstring stretch, quad stretch, triceps stretch, chest stretch.
* **Note:** Focus on learning the correct form for each exercise.  Start with lighter weights.

**Day 2: Cardio & Core**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light jogging in place, arm circles, torso twists.
* **Workout:**
    * Brisk Walking/Jogging: 20-30 minutes at a moderate intensity.
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Russian Twists: 3 sets of 15-20 reps per side (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Leg Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 45 sec)
    * Bird Dog: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side (Rest: 45 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches - lower back stretch, abdominal stretch.
* **Note:** Maintain good posture during core exercises.

**Day 3: Upper Body – Light Weight**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Arm circles, shoulder rotations, wrist stretches.
* **Workout:**
    * Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
    * Face Pulls: 3 sets of 15-20 reps (Rest: 60 sec)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches – triceps stretch, biceps stretch, shoulder stretch.
* **Note:** Use a weight that allows you to maintain good form throughout the set.



---

**Week 2-4: Building Strength & Endurance (3-4 workouts/week)**

*(This section will follow a similar structure to Week 1, but with increased intensity and complexity. Each week will progressively increase weight/resistance, reps, or sets. Exercises will also be slightly modified or new ones introduced.  Here's a summary of changes)*

* **Weeks 2-3:** Increase weight/resistance by 5-10% if possible. Introduce variations of exercises (e.g., incline dumbbell bench press, walking lunges).  Add one additional set to each exercise.
* **Week 4:**  Deload week - reduce weight/resistance by 20-30% to allow for recovery. Focus on form and technique.
* **Exercises Added/Modified:**
    * **Lower Body:** Lunges, Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs), Calf Raises
    * **Upper Body:** Pull-ups (assisted if needed), Overhead Press variations, Hammer Curls
    * **Core:**  Hanging Leg Raises, Plank Variations (side plank, plank with arm/leg lift)
* **Cardio:** Increase duration to 30-40 minutes and/or introduce interval training (alternating between high and low intensity).



---

**Week 5-7: Increasing Volume & Intensity (4 workouts/week)**

* **Workout Split:**  Divide workouts into specific muscle groups:
    * **Day 1: Chest & Triceps**
    * **Day 2: Back & Biceps**
    * **Day 3: Legs & Shoulders**
    * **Day 4: Full Body Circuit (Light Weight, High Reps)**
* **Sets/Reps:** 4 sets of 8-12 reps for most exercises.
* **Rest:** 60-90 seconds between sets.
* **Exercises:**  Introduce more challenging variations of exercises.  For example:
    * **Chest:** Barbell Bench Press, Decline Dumbbell Press
    * **Back:**  Barbell Rows, Lat Pulldowns
    * **Legs:**  Squats (Barbell or Dumbbell), Deadlifts (light to moderate weight), Leg Press
    * **Shoulders:** Arnold Press, Lateral Raises
* **Cardio:** Incorporate HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training) 1-2 times per week.



---

**Week 8-10: Peak & Maintain (3-4 workouts/week)**

* **Workout Split:**  Maintain the muscle group split from Weeks 5-7, but focus on progressive overload.
* **Sets/Reps:**  Vary sets and reps:
    * **Strength Focus (2 workouts):** 3-4 sets of 6-8 reps with heavier weight.
    * **Hypertrophy Focus (1-2 workouts):** 3-4 sets of 10-15 reps with moderate weight.
* **Rest:** 90-120 seconds between sets for strength focus, 60-90 seconds for hypertrophy focus.
* **Exercises:** Continue to challenge yourself with variations and increased weight.
* **Week 9:** Deload week - similar to Week 4, reduce intensity to allow for recovery.
* **Week 10:**  Focus on maintaining strength and muscle mass.  Reduce volume slightly and prioritize form.  Reflect on your progress and set new goals.
* **Cardio:** Continue HIIT 1-2 times per week, or maintain moderate-intensity cardio.



---

**Final Thoughts:**

Congratulations on completing this 10-week program! Remember that fitness is a journey, not a destination. Continue to prioritize your health, listen to your body, and stay consistent with your workouts and nutrition. Don’t be afraid to experiment with new exercises and activities to keep things interesting.  I am here to support you on your continued fitness journey.  Keep pushing, keep growing, and keep striving for a healthier, stronger you!



**Disclaimer:** This program is a general guideline and may not be suitable for everyone. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program, especially if you have any underlying health conditions.  I, Maria Kuznetsova, am providing this program as a basic fitness coach and am not a medical professional.

## The "Resilient Body, Calm Mind" - 10 Week Strength Training Program

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Goal:** Weight Loss & Stress Relief
**Level:** Intermediate
**Duration:** 30-45 minutes/session
**Frequency:** 5-6 times/week

**Program Philosophy:** This program combines strength training with mindful recovery to not only build a leaner, stronger physique but also to cultivate mental resilience and reduce stress. We focus on compound movements to maximize calorie burn and hormonal response, coupled with targeted accessory work.  Listen to your body, prioritize form over weight, and embrace the process.  Consistency is key!

**Important Notes:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** This program works best when paired with a balanced diet focused on whole foods, lean protein, and healthy fats. Consider consulting a registered dietitian for personalized guidance.
* **Supplements (Optional):** Creatine (3-5g daily) can aid recovery and strength gains.  A daily multivitamin ensures you're meeting micronutrient needs. Consult your doctor before starting any new supplement.
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery days (walking, yoga) are crucial.  Consider foam rolling or massage to address muscle soreness.
* **Form Check:** Watch videos of each exercise to ensure proper form. If possible, record yourself and compare to instructional videos. Don’t hesitate to reduce weight if form breaks down.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Familiarization**

*Focus: Establishing proper form and building a base level of strength.*

* **Day 1 (Monday): Full Body**
    * Warm-up: 5 minutes of light cardio (jogging in place, jumping jacks) & dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings).
    * Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * Push-ups (on knees if needed): 3 sets of as many reps as possible (AMRAP), 60 sec rest.
    * Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm, 60 sec rest.
    * Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30-45 seconds, 60 sec rest.
    * Cool-down: 5 minutes of static stretching (holding each stretch for 30 seconds).
* **Day 2 (Tuesday): Active Recovery** - 30-minute brisk walk or yoga session. Focus on mindful breathing.
* **Day 3 (Wednesday): Upper Body**
    * Warm-up: Similar to Day 1.
    * Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * Overhead Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 45 sec rest.
    * Triceps Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 45 sec rest.
    * Cool-down: Static stretching.
* **Day 4 (Thursday): Rest** – Complete rest. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
* **Day 5 (Friday): Lower Body & Core**
    * Warm-up: Similar to Day 1.
    * Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg, 60 sec rest.
    * Romanian Deadlifts (RDLs): 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60 sec rest.
    * Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 45 sec rest.
    * Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps, 30 sec rest.
    * Cool-down: Static stretching.
* **Day 6 (Saturday): Optional - Light Cardio:** 20-30 minutes of cycling or swimming.
* **Day 7 (Sunday): Rest** – Complete rest.

---

**Week 2-3: Progressive Overload & Intensity**

*Focus: Increasing weight, reps, or sets to challenge the muscles.*

* Continue the same structure as Week 1, but aim to:
    * Increase weight by 2.5-5lbs when possible.
    * If weight increase isn’t possible, increase reps by 1-2 per set.
    * Reduce rest intervals to 45-60 seconds.
    * Introduce a new exercise each week: Week 2 - Glute Bridges (3x15-20), Week 3 - Face Pulls (3x15-20).
*  Incorporate mindful breathing exercises (box breathing: inhale for 4, hold for 4, exhale for 4, hold for 4) during rest periods to enhance stress relief.

---

**Week 4-5:  Deload & Variation**

*Focus: Reducing intensity to allow for recovery and preventing plateaus.*

* **Deload Week (Week 4):** Reduce weight by 20-30%. Maintain sets and reps. Focus on perfect form and controlled movements.  This week is about recovery and mental rejuvenation.
* **Week 5:** Introduce variations of existing exercises:
    * Squats -> Goblet Squats
    * Push-ups -> Incline Push-ups
    * Dumbbell Rows -> Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows
    * Add a circuit training day: 3 rounds of 10 reps each of Squats, Push-ups, Lunges, Plank, Dumbbell Rows, 60 sec rest between rounds.

---

**Week 6-7:  Strength & Endurance Focus**

*Focus: Building both strength and muscular endurance.*

*  Increase weight back to Week 3 levels.
*  Introduce pyramid sets:
    * Set 1: 8 reps (heavier weight)
    * Set 2: 10 reps (moderate weight)
    * Set 3: 12 reps (lighter weight)
*  Add a HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training) session (20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest) for 15-20 minutes, focusing on bodyweight exercises (burpees, mountain climbers, jumping jacks).  Do this on your active recovery day.

---

**Week 8-9:  Power & Functional Movement**

*Focus: Developing explosive power and improving functional strength.*

*  Introduce plyometric exercises (jump squats, box jumps – start with a low box), 2-3 sets of 8-10 reps.
*  Incorporate exercises that mimic real-life movements:
    * Farmer's Walks (holding dumbbells while walking)
    * Wood Chops (using a cable machine or resistance band)
*  Increase the intensity of HIIT sessions – 30 seconds work, 10 seconds rest.

---

**Week 10:  Peak & Assessment**

*Focus: Testing your progress and solidifying gains.*

* **Days 1-3:**  Repeat your favorite workouts from the past 9 weeks, aiming for personal bests.
* **Day 4:**  Assessment Day:
    * Measure your weight and body circumference (waist, hips, thighs).
    * Perform a maximum rep test for Squats, Push-ups, and Dumbbell Rows to track strength gains.
    * Reflect on your stress levels and overall well-being.
* **Day 5:** Active Recovery - Long walk in nature.
* **Day 6-7:** Rest and celebrate your accomplishments! Plan for continued fitness maintenance.

**Final Thoughts:**

This program is a starting point.  Adapt it to your individual needs and preferences.  Remember to listen to your body, prioritize recovery, and enjoy the journey towards a resilient body and a calm mind.  Consistency, coupled with a positive mindset, will yield incredible results.  Don’t be afraid to challenge yourself, but always prioritize safety and proper form.  Congratulations on completing the 10-week program!  Keep moving forward!

## CrossFit for Stress Relief & Muscle Gain: 10-Week Advanced Program - Coached by Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)

**Welcome!** This 10-week CrossFit program is designed for advanced athletes looking to build muscle, enhance strength, and – crucially – manage stress through focused, challenging workouts. We’ll blend classic CrossFit movements with strategies to promote recovery and mental wellbeing. Remember to listen to your body, prioritize form, and don't hesitate to scale workouts when needed.  Hydration and nutrition are *critical* – treat them as pillars of your success.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Warm-up:**  5-10 minutes of dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings, torso twists, high knees, butt kicks) and light cardio (jumping jacks, rowing) before *every* workout.
* **Cool-down:** 5-10 minutes of static stretching (holding stretches for 30 seconds each) focusing on muscles worked.
* **Hydration:** Drink at least 1 gallon of water daily, especially around workouts. Consider electrolytes during and after intense sessions.
* **Nutrition:** Focus on a protein-rich diet (1 gram per pound of bodyweight), complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats.  Consider a creatine supplement (5g daily) to support muscle gain, and magnesium for stress management (consult with your doctor first).
* **Recovery:** Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep per night.  Active recovery (light cardio, yoga) is encouraged on rest days. Foam rolling and massage are also beneficial.
* **Scaling:**  If an exercise is too difficult, modify it.  Reduce weight, decrease reps, or choose a simpler variation.  Maintaining good form is paramount.



---

**Week 1: Foundation & Assessment**

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Back Squat: 5 sets of 5 reps @ 75% 1RM. Rest 2 minutes between sets.
    * Strict Press: 3 sets of 8 reps. Rest 1.5 minutes.
    * Muscle-up Skill Work: 3 sets of max effort attempts.  (Scaling: Ring Rows, Pull-ups + Dips)
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* Focus on perfect form.  This is an assessment week – don’t push to failure.
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon - AMRAP 12 Minutes
    * 5 Burpees
    * 10 Toes-to-Bar (Scaling: Knee Raises)
    * 15 Wall Balls (20/14 lbs)
    * *Note:* Pace yourself. This is about consistent movement, not speed.

---

**Week 2: Building Strength & Endurance**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Deadlift: 3 sets of 3 reps @ 80% 1RM. Rest 3 minutes.
    * Front Squats: 4 sets of 6 reps. Rest 2 minutes.
    * Handstand Push-up Skill Work: 3 sets of max effort attempts. (Scaling: Pike Push-ups)
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon - For Time
    * 400m Run
    * 30 Power Snatches (75/55 lbs)
    * 400m Run
    * *Note:* Break up the power snatches into manageable sets. Focus on technique.

---

**Week 3: Increasing Volume & Complexity**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Overhead Squats: 4 sets of 4 reps @ 65% 1RM. Rest 2.5 minutes.
    * Push Jerk: 3 sets of 5 reps. Rest 2 minutes.
    * Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups: 3 sets of max reps. (Scaling: Jumping Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups)
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon - 3 Rounds For Time
    * 21 Kettlebell Swings (53/35 lbs)
    * 15 Box Jumps (24/20 inches)
    * 9 Thrusters (75/55 lbs)
    * *Note:* Choose a box height that challenges you, but allows for safe landings.

---

**Week 4:  Deload & Recovery Focus**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Active Recovery – Yoga/Mobility (45 minutes)
    * Focus on deep stretching, foam rolling, and mindful breathing.
    * *Note:* This week is about recovery. Reduce intensity and volume.
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Light Metcon – AMRAP 10 Minutes
    * 10 Air Squats
    * 8 Push-ups
    * 6 Sit-ups
    * *Note:*  Maintain a conversational pace.



---

**Week 5:  Returning to Intensity – Compound Lifts**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Back Squat: 5 sets of 3 reps @ 85% 1RM. Rest 3 minutes.
    * Strict Press: 4 sets of 5 reps. Rest 2 minutes.
    * Ring Muscle-ups: 5 sets of max effort attempts.
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon -  "Fran" (For Time)
    * 21-15-9 reps of:
        * Thrusters (75/55 lbs)
        * Pull-ups
    * *Note:* A classic CrossFit benchmark.  Pace yourself and break up the sets.

---

**Week 6:  Olympic Lifting Focus**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Clean & Jerk: 3 sets of 2 reps @ 70% 1RM. Rest 3 minutes.
    * Snatch: 3 sets of 2 reps @ 65% 1RM. Rest 3 minutes.
    * Pistol Squats: 3 sets of max reps per leg. (Scaling: Assisted Pistol Squats)
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon - For Time
    * 50 Wall Balls (20/14 lbs)
    * 40 Box Jump Overs (24/20 inches)
    * 30 Clean & Jerks (75/55 lbs)
    * *Note:* Maintain a consistent pace and focus on technique.

---

**Week 7:  High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Deadlift: 5 sets of 1 rep @ 90% 1RM. Rest 4 minutes.
    * Romanian Deadlifts: 3 sets of 8 reps. Rest 2 minutes.
    * Handstand Walk Practice: 3 sets of max distance. (Scaling: Handstand Holds)
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon -  Tabata Style (8 Rounds, 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest)
    * Burpees
    * Kettlebell Snatches (53/35 lbs)
    * Box Jumps
    * Rowing (Calorie Target - 100 calories per round)
    * *Note:* Push yourself to maximum effort during the work intervals.

---

**Week 8:  Mixed Modalities & Endurance**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill
    * Warm-up
    * Overhead Squats: 4 sets of 3 reps @ 75% 1RM. Rest 2.5 minutes.
    * Push Jerk: 4 sets of 3 reps. Rest 2 minutes.
    * Double-Unders: 5 sets of max reps. (Scaling: Single Unders)
    * Cool-down
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon -  "Helen" (3 Rounds For Time)
    * 400m Run
    * 21 Kettlebell Swings (53/35 lbs)
    * 12 Pull-ups
    * *Note:*  Another CrossFit classic. Focus on transitions between exercises.

---

**Week 9:  Peak Performance & Testing**

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Strength & Skill - Max Effort Testing
    * Warm-up
    * 1RM Back Squat Test
    * 1RM Strict Press Test
    * Max Rep Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups
    * Cool-down
    * *Note:* This is your opportunity to see how much you’ve improved!
* **Day 2 (Thursday):** Metcon -  "Cindy" (AMRAP 20 Minutes)
    * 5 Pull-ups
    * 10 Push-ups
    * 15 Air Squats
    * *Note:* Push for as many rounds as possible.  This is a test of muscular endurance.

## 10-Week Beginner Weight Loss Cardio Program – Coached by Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Welcome!** This program is designed for beginners looking to kickstart their weight loss journey through consistent cardio.  I, Ivan Orlov, will guide you through these 10 weeks. Remember, consistency is key!  Listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and don't be afraid to modify exercises as needed.  We're building a sustainable habit, not aiming for overnight miracles.  This program is structured for 5-6 workouts per week, with active recovery days built in.

**Important Considerations:**

* **Hydration:** Drink at least 2-3 liters of water daily, especially before, during, and after workouts.
* **Nutrition:** Cardio is fantastic, but weight loss is 80% nutrition. Focus on a balanced diet rich in whole foods, lean protein, fruits, and vegetables. Consider consulting a registered dietitian for personalized guidance.
* **Supplements (Optional):**  A multivitamin can be helpful.  Consider a branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) supplement for muscle recovery, especially on tougher days.  Always consult with your doctor before starting any new supplement regimen.
* **Recovery:**  Prioritize 7-9 hours of sleep each night.  Active recovery (walking, stretching, yoga) is crucial on rest days.  Foam rolling can also aid muscle recovery.
* **Form over Speed:**  Focus on maintaining proper form throughout each exercise to prevent injuries.  Watch videos and practice in front of a mirror if needed.
* **Listen to Your Body:** If you experience pain, STOP. Modify the exercise or rest.  Don't push yourself too hard, especially in the beginning.



---

### **Week 1: Building a Foundation**

**Focus:** Establishing a routine and building a base level of cardiovascular fitness.

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Brisk Walking - 40 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes of light marching in place and arm circles. Cool-down: 5 minutes of static stretching (hamstrings, quads, calves). *Note: Maintain a pace where you can hold a conversation, but are slightly breathless.*
* **Day 2 (Tuesday):** Rest/Active Recovery – 30-minute leisurely walk. Focus on enjoying the outdoors.
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):** Cycling (Stationary or Outdoor) – 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes of easy pedaling. Cool-down: 5 minutes of static stretching (hamstrings, quads, hip flexors). *Note: Maintain a comfortable resistance level.*
* **Day 4 (Thursday):**  Brisk Walking – 45 minutes.  Focus on maintaining consistent pace.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** Rest
* **Day 6 (Saturday):**  Low-Impact Aerobics (YouTube video - search "beginner low impact aerobics") – 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes of light cardio (marching, jogging in place). Cool-down: 5 minutes of static stretching.
* **Day 7 (Sunday):**  Rest/Light Stretching

---

### **Week 2: Increasing Intensity**

**Focus:**  Gradually increasing the duration and intensity of workouts.

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Brisk Walking – 50 minutes. Include 5 x 30-second intervals of slightly faster walking, with 60 seconds recovery.
* **Day 2 (Tuesday):** Active Recovery – Yoga for Beginners (30 minutes).
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):** Cycling – 35 minutes. Increase resistance slightly.
* **Day 4 (Thursday):**  Brisk Walking – 55 minutes.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** Rest
* **Day 6 (Saturday):** Low-Impact Aerobics – 35 minutes.  Focus on following the instructor’s cues.
* **Day 7 (Sunday):** Rest/Light Stretching

---

### **Week 3: Introducing Intervals**

**Focus:** Incorporating interval training to boost calorie burn and improve cardiovascular fitness.

* **Day 1 (Monday):** Walking Intervals – 40 minutes total. Warm-up: 5 minutes.  Workout: 8 rounds of 2 minutes brisk walking, 1 minute jogging (or fast walking), 1-minute recovery walk. Cool-down: 5 minutes.
* **Day 2 (Tuesday):** Active Recovery – 40-minute leisurely bike ride.
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):** Cycling Intervals – 40 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes. Workout: 6 rounds of 3 minutes moderate resistance, 1 minute high resistance, 1 minute recovery. Cool-down: 5 minutes.
* **Day 4 (Thursday):**  Brisk Walking – 60 minutes.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** Rest
* **Day 6 (Saturday):**  Low-Impact Aerobics – 40 minutes.
* **Day 7 (Sunday):** Rest/Foam Rolling

---

### **Week 4: Building Endurance**

**Focus:**  Increasing the overall duration of cardio sessions.

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Brisk Walking – 60 minutes.
* **Day 2 (Tuesday):** Active Recovery – Swimming (30 minutes) or Water Aerobics.
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):** Cycling – 45 minutes. Maintain a consistent moderate resistance.
* **Day 4 (Thursday):** Walking Intervals – 45 minutes total.  Workout: 10 rounds of 2 minutes brisk walking, 1 minute jogging, 1-minute recovery walk.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** Rest
* **Day 6 (Saturday):**  Low-Impact Aerobics – 45 minutes.
* **Day 7 (Sunday):** Rest/Light Stretching

---

### **Week 5:  Adding Variety**

**Focus:** Introducing new cardio modalities to prevent boredom and challenge different muscle groups.

* **Day 1 (Monday):**  Elliptical Trainer – 40 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes. Cool-down: 5 minutes. *Note: Focus on a smooth, controlled motion.*
* **Day 2 (Tuesday):** Active Recovery – Gentle Hike (45 minutes).
* **Day 3 (Wednesday):**  Rowing Machine – 30 minutes. Warm-up: 5 minutes. Cool-down: 5 minutes. *Note: Proper form is crucial. Watch a tutorial video.*
* **Day 4 (Thursday):**  Brisk Walking – 60 minutes.
* **Day 5 (Friday):** Rest
