**Anna Smirnova's 5-Week Advanced Strength Training Program for Weight Loss**

As your personal trainer, I'm excited to guide you through this 5-week program. Before we begin, make sure to:

* Consult with your doctor or a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program.
* Warm up properly before each workout and cool down afterwards to prevent injury and promote recovery.
* Listen to your body and rest when needed. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise immediately.
* Stay hydrated by drinking at least 8-10 glasses of water per day.
* Take your supplements as recommended to support your weight loss journey.

**Week 1: Building Foundation**

**Day 1: Chest and Triceps**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks), dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Barbell Bench Press**: 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Incline Dumbbell Press**: 3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Cable Flyes**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Tricep Pushdowns**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Overhead Dumbbell Extension**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (chest, triceps)
* **Hydration and Supplements**: Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water, take your recommended supplements (e.g., protein powder, multivitamin)

**Day 2: Back and Biceps**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio, dynamic stretching
* **Pull-ups**: 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest (or Assisted Pull-ups)
* **Barbell Rows**: 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Lat Pulldowns**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Dumbbell Bicep Curls**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Hammer Curls**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (back, biceps)
* **Hydration and Supplements**: Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water, take your recommended supplements

**Day 3: Rest Day**

Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your muscles to recover.

**Day 4: Legs**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio, dynamic stretching
* **Squats**: 3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Leg Press**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Lunges**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg), 60-90 seconds rest
* **Leg Extensions**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Leg Curls**: 3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (legs)
* **Hydration and Supplements**: Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water, take your recommended supplements

**Day 5: Shoulders and Abs**

**Bodybuilding for Muscle Gain Program**
**Duration:** 2 weeks (14 days)
**Goal:** Muscle Gain
**Level:** Intermediate
**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)

**Important Notes:**

* Warm-up and cool-down exercises will be performed at the beginning and end of each workout.
* Rest for 60-90 seconds between sets, and 120-180 seconds between exercises.
* Adjust the weight and reps according to your fitness level and goals.
* Stay hydrated by drinking at least 8-10 glasses of water per day.
* Take a multivitamin and a protein shake after each workout.
* Get at least 7-8 hours of sleep each night to aid in muscle recovery.

**Week 1**

### **Day 1: Chest and Triceps**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Barbell Bench Press (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Lie on a flat bench and grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower the bar to your chest, then press it back up to the starting position.
* **Incline Dumbbell Press (3 sets, 10-15 reps):** Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand. Press the dumbbells upwards towards the ceiling, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Tricep Pushdowns (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Hold a barbell or rope attachment with your hands shoulder-width apart. Extend the bar downwards, then return it to the starting position.
* **Tricep Dips (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Sit on the edge of a bench or chair and place your hands next to your hips. Lower your body down by bending your elbows, then straighten your arms to return to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the chest and triceps

### **Day 2: Back and Biceps**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Deadlifts (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lift the bar up to hip level, then lower it back down to the starting position.
* **Bent-Over Barbell Rows (3 sets, 8-12 reps):** Hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart and bend over at the waist. Lift the bar up to your chest, then lower it back down to the starting position.
* **Dumbbell Bicep Curls (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Hammer Curls (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing towards your body. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the back and biceps

### **Day 3: Legs**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Squats (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body down into a squat, then stand up to the starting position.
* **Leg Press (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Sit in a leg press machine and push the platform away from you with your feet. Lower the platform down, then press it back up to the starting position.
* **Lunges (3 sets, 10-12 reps per leg):** Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot. Lower your body down into a lunge, then stand up to the starting position. Alternate legs.
* **Leg Extensions (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Sit in a leg extension machine and lift the weight up with your legs. Lower the weight back down to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the legs

### **Day 4: Shoulders and Abs**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Dumbbell Shoulder Press (3 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Press the dumbbells straight up, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Lateral Raises (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Planks (3 sets, 30-60 seconds):** Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and hold a plank for the specified time.
* **Russian Twists (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Sit on the floor with your knees bent and hold a weight or medicine ball in front of your chest. Twist your torso to left and right, touching the weight to the ground each time.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the shoulders and abs

### **Day 5: Chest and Triceps**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Incline Bench Press (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Lie on an incline bench and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower the bar to your chest, then press it back up to the starting position.
* **Cable Flyes (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Stand facing a cable machine with the cables at chest height. Hold a handle in each hand and press the cables out to the sides, then return to the starting position.
* **Tricep Dips (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Sit on the edge of a bench or chair and place your hands next to your hips. Lower your body down by bending your elbows, then straighten your arms to return to the starting position.
* **Overhead Dumbbell Extension (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand overhead with your arms extended. Lower the dumbbells behind your head, then raise them back up to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the chest and triceps

### **Day 6: Back and Biceps**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Deadlifts (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lift the bar up to hip level, then lower it back down to the starting position.
* **Pull-Ups (3 sets, 8-12 reps):** Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar. Lower yourself back down to the starting position.
* **Dumbbell Bicep Curls (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Hammer Curls (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing towards your body. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the back and biceps

**Week 2**

### **Day 7: Legs**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Squats (4 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body down into a squat, then stand up to the starting position.
* **Leg Press (3 sets, 10-12 reps):** Sit in a leg press machine and push the platform away from you with your feet. Lower the platform down, then press it back up to the starting position.
* **Lunges (3 sets, 10-12 reps per leg):** Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot. Lower your body down into a lunge, then stand up to the starting position. Alternate legs.
* **Leg Extensions (3 sets, 12-15 reps):** Sit in a leg extension machine and lift the weight up with your legs. Lower the weight back down to the starting position.
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for the legs

### **Day 8: Shoulders and Abs**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Jumping jacks, arm circles, and leg swings
* **Dumbbell Shoulder Press (3 sets, 8-12 reps):** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Press the dumbbells straight up, then lower them back down to the starting position.

**Pilates for Flexibility Improvement**
**Trainer: Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)**
**Duration: 14 Days**
**Frequency: 1-2 times/week**
**Avg Duration: Up to 30 minutes**

### **Week 1**
#### **Day 1**
**Warm-up (5 minutes)**

* Leg swings (front and back)
* Hip circles (clockwise and counterclockwise)
* Torso twists (left and right)

**Pilates Exercises (20 minutes)**

1. **Knee Folds** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the mat
	* Slowly bring one knee towards your chest and then lower it back down
	* Alternate legs
2. **Spine Stretch** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your stomach with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly lift your arms, shoulders, and upper back off the mat
	* Hold for a few seconds and then lower back down
3. **Leg Raises** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your back with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly lift one leg towards the ceiling and then lower it back down
	* Alternate legs

**Cool-down (5 minutes)**

* Static stretches for hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip flexors

**Notes:**

* Drink plenty of water throughout the day
* Focus on proper breathing and engage your core muscles throughout the exercises
* Start slow and gradually increase the number of reps and sets as you build flexibility and strength

#### **Day 3**
**Warm-up (5 minutes)**

* Leg swings (front and back)
* Hip circles (clockwise and counterclockwise)
* Torso twists (left and right)

**Pilates Exercises (20 minutes)**

1. **Teaser** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your back with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly lift your shoulders and upper back off the mat
	* Hold for a few seconds and then lower back down
2. **Chest Stretch** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your stomach with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly bring one arm towards the opposite shoulder and then lower it back down
	* Alternate arms
3. **Shoulder Rolls** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Sit on the mat with your back straight
	* Roll your shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion

**Cool-down (5 minutes)**

* Static stretches for shoulders, chest, and back

**Notes:**

* Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the exercises
* Take breaks as needed to avoid fatigue
* Practice deep breathing exercises to relax and center yourself

### **Week 2**
#### **Day 4**
**Warm-up (5 minutes)**

* Leg swings (front and back)
* Hip circles (clockwise and counterclockwise)
* Torso twists (left and right)

**Pilates Exercises (20 minutes)**

1. **Bridging** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the mat
	* Slowly lift your hips off the mat and then lower them back down
2. **Side Bends** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your side with feet stacked
	* Slowly bring one arm towards the opposite shoulder and then lower it back down
	* Alternate arms
3. **Seated Twist** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Sit on the mat with your back straight
	* Twist your torso to one side and then the other

**Cool-down (5 minutes)**

* Static stretches for hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip flexors

**Notes:**

* Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the exercises
* Take breaks as needed to avoid fatigue
* Practice deep breathing exercises to relax and center yourself

#### **Day 6**
**Warm-up (5 minutes)**

* Leg swings (front and back)
* Hip circles (clockwise and counterclockwise)
* Torso twists (left and right)

**Pilates Exercises (20 minutes)**

1. **Swimming** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your stomach with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly lift your arms and legs off the mat in a swimming motion
2. **Chest Expansion** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Lie on your stomach with arms extended overhead
	* Slowly bring one arm towards the opposite shoulder and then lower it back down
	* Alternate arms
3. **Shoulder Blade Squeezes** (3 sets of 10 reps, 30-second rest)
	* Sit on the mat with your back straight
	* Squeeze your shoulder blades together and then release

**Cool-down (5 minutes)**

* Static stretches for shoulders, chest, and back

**Notes:**

* Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the exercises
* Take breaks as needed to avoid fatigue
* Practice deep breathing exercises to relax and center yourself

**Anna Smirnova's Advanced Running Program**
=============================================

As an advanced runner, it's essential to maintain a consistent training schedule while allowing for active recovery days. This 5-week program will guide you through a mix of high-intensity interval training (HIIT), steady-state cardio, and strength exercises to support your running performance.

**Week 1**
----------

### Day 1: Monday - Run Day

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light jogging and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles, etc.)
* **Run (30 minutes)**: Steady-state cardio at moderate intensity
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip flexors)
* **Notes**: Hydrate with water and electrolyte-rich beverages during and after your run. Consider adding a post-run protein shake to aid in recovery.

### Day 2: Tuesday - Rest Day

* **Active Recovery**: Light yoga or a leisurely walk (30 minutes)
* **Notes**: Focus on foam rolling and self-myofascial release to aid in muscle recovery.

### Day 3: Wednesday - Strength Training

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Squats (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Lunges (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Alternate legs and keep your back straight
* **Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)**: Stand on a step or platform to target your calf muscles
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on legs and glutes)
* **Notes**: Incorporate strength training exercises 1-2 times per week to improve running efficiency and reduce injury risk.

### Day 4: Thursday - Run Day

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light jogging and dynamic stretching
* **Interval Training (30 minutes)**: Alternate between 5 minutes of high-intensity running and 5 minutes of active recovery (jogging or walking)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip flexors)
* **Notes**: Focus on proper breathing and pacing during interval training.

### Day 5: Friday - Rest Day

* **Active Recovery**: Light yoga or a leisurely walk (30 minutes)
* **Notes**: Continue to focus on foam rolling and self-myofascial release to aid in muscle recovery.

### Day 6: Saturday - Strength Training

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Deadlifts (3 sets of 8 reps)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Leg Press (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Target your quadriceps and glutes
* **Calf Raises (3 sets of 12 reps)**: Stand on a step or platform to target your calf muscles
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on legs and glutes)
* **Notes**: Continue to incorporate strength training exercises to improve running efficiency and reduce injury risk.

### Day 7: Sunday - Rest Day

* **Active Recovery**: Light yoga or a leisurely walk (30 minutes)
* **Notes**: Take a well-deserved rest day and focus on recovery.

**Rehabilitation and Competition Preparation HIIT Program**
**Designed by Anna Smirnova, ISSA Master Trainer**

**Week 1**

### **Day 1: Upper Body and Cardio Blast**
**Duration:** 70 minutes
**Warm-up:** 5 minutes of light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
**Cool-down:** 5 minutes of static stretching (focusing on upper body)

1. **Burpees** (20 reps, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then drop down into a squat position and place hands on ground.
	* From the squat position, kick back into a plank position, then do a push-up.
	* Quickly return to the squat position, then stand up and jump up in the air.
2. **Mountain Climbers** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Start in a plank position, bring one knee up towards your chest, then quickly switch to the other knee.
3. **Dumbbell Chest Press** (12 reps, 3 sets, 60 seconds rest)
	* Lie on a flat bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
	* Press the dumbbells upwards, extending your arms fully.
4. **Incline Dumbbell Press** (12 reps, 3 sets, 60 seconds rest)
	* Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
	* Press the dumbbells upwards, extending your arms fully.
5. **Plank Jumps** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Start in a plank position, then jump your feet up off the ground and land softly on the balls of your feet.
6. **Cardio Blast** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Choose a cardio machine (treadmill, stationary bike, rowing machine) and perform a high-intensity interval workout.

### **Day 2: Lower Body and Core Blast**
**Duration:** 65 minutes
**Warm-up:** 5 minutes of light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
**Cool-down:** 5 minutes of static stretching (focusing on lower body)

1. **Squats** (15 reps, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat position.
	* Push through your heels to return to standing.
2. **Lunges** (12 reps (per leg), 3 sets, 60 seconds rest)
	* Stand with feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower your body down into a lunge position.
	* Push through your front heel to return to standing.
3. **Calf Raises** (15 reps, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Stand on a step or platform and raise up onto your tiptoes, then lower back down.
4. **Glute Bridges** (12 reps, 3 sets, 60 seconds rest)
	* Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the ground, then lift your hips up towards the ceiling.
5. **Russian Twists** (15 reps, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, then lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side.
6. **Core Blast** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Perform a series of high-intensity core exercises (plank jacks, side plank jacks, etc.).

### **Day 3: Rest Day**

### **Day 4: Cardio and Abs Blast**
**Duration:** 60 minutes
**Warm-up:** 5 minutes of light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
**Cool-down:** 5 minutes of static stretching (focusing on core)

1. **Treadmill Sprints** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	* Choose a high-intensity interval workout on the treadmill (sprints, incline sprints, etc.).

5. **Leg Raises** (12 reps, 3 sets, 60 seconds rest)
	* Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and raise your legs up towards the ceiling.
6. **Abs Blast** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)

	* Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
	* Press the dumbbells upwards, extending your arms fully.

	* Start in a plank position, then jump your feet up off the ground and land softly on the balls of your feet.

**2-Week Boxing/Martial Arts Flexibility Improvement Program**
=====================================

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)
**Duration:** Up to 30 minutes per session
**Frequency:** 1-2 times per week
**Goal:** Flexibility Improvement
**Level:** All Levels (Adaptive Program)

**Important:** Before starting any new exercise program, consult with a healthcare professional to ensure you're healthy enough for physical activity.

### **Week 1**

#### **Day 1: Upper Body Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Neck Stretch:** Slowly tilt your head to the side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Shoulder Rolls:** Roll your shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Chest Stretch:** Stand in a doorway with your hands on the doorframe at shoulder height. Lean forward, stretching your chest. Hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Arm Circles:** Hold your arms straight out to the sides and make small circles with your hands. Gradually increase the size of the circles. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on upper body muscles)

#### **Day 2: Lower Body Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Hip Circles:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips. Move your hips in a large circle, first clockwise and then counterclockwise. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Leg Swings:** Stand with your feet together and swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Calf Stretch:** Stand facing a wall with one hand on the wall for balance. Step one foot back about a foot and a half, keeping your heel on the ground. Bend your front knee and lean forward, stretching your calf. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Ankle Rotations:** Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Lift one foot off the ground and rotate your ankle in a circle, first clockwise and then counterclockwise. Repeat for 30 seconds and switch to the other leg. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on lower body muscles)

#### **Day 3: Rest Day**

Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your muscles to recover.

#### **Day 4: Core Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Knee to Chest Stretch:** Lie on your back and bring one knee towards your chest. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Cat-Cow Stretch:** Start on your hands and knees. Arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling (like a cat). Then, round your back, tucking your chin to your chest and your tailbone towards the ground (like a cow). Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Seated Forward Fold:** Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Lean forward, reaching for your toes, and hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Side Bends:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips. Bend to one side, keeping your arms straight, and hold for 30 seconds. Repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on core muscles)

### **Week 2**

#### **Day 5: Upper Body Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Neck Stretch:** Slowly tilt your head to the side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Shoulder Rolls:** Roll your shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Chest Stretch:** Stand in a doorway with your hands on the doorframe at shoulder height. Lean forward, stretching your chest. Hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Arm Circles:** Hold your arms straight out to the sides and make small circles with your hands. Gradually increase the size of the circles. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on upper body muscles)

#### **Day 6: Lower Body Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Hip Circles:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips. Move your hips in a large circle, first clockwise and then counterclockwise. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Leg Swings:** Stand with your feet together and swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Calf Stretch:** Stand facing a wall with one hand on the wall for balance. Step one foot back about a foot and a half, keeping your heel on the ground. Bend your front knee and lean forward, stretching your calf. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Ankle Rotations:** Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Lift one foot off the ground and rotate your ankle in a circle, first clockwise and then counterclockwise. Repeat for 30 seconds and switch to the other leg. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on lower body muscles)

#### **Day 7: Rest Day**

Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your muscles to recover.

#### **Day 8: Core Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercises:**
	+ **Knee to Chest Stretch:** Lie on your back and bring one knee towards your chest. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
	+ **Cat-Cow Stretch:** Start on your hands and knees. Arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling (like a cat). Then, round your back, tucking your chin to your chest and your tailbone towards the ground (like a cow). Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Seated Forward Fold:** Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Lean forward, reaching for your toes, and hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
	+ **Side Bends:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips. Bend to one side, keeping your arms straight, and hold for 30 seconds. Repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching (focusing on core muscles)

### **Additional Tips and Reminders**

* **Hydration:** Drink plenty of water before, during, and after each workout.
* **Supplements:** Consider taking a daily multivitamin and a post-workout recovery supplement to aid in muscle recovery.
* **Recovery:** Allow your muscles time to recover between workouts. Rest and recovery are just as important as exercise.
* **Listen to Your Body:** If you experience any pain or discomfort during a workout, stop immediately and consult with a healthcare professional.

**Congratulations on completing the 2-week flexibility improvement program!** Remember to continue stretching regularly to maintain flexibility and prevent injury.

**Competition Preparation Stretching Program**
**Duration:** 5 weeks, 35 days
**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)
**Goal:** Competition Preparation
**Activity Type:** Stretching
**Level:** All Levels (Adaptive Program)
**Avg Duration:** 45-60 minutes
**Frequency:** 1-2 times/week

### **Week 1**
#### **Day 1 - Upper Body Stretching**
**Duration:** 45 minutes
**Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio, arm circles, and leg swings
**Stretching Routine (30 minutes):**
1. **Neck Stretch:** Slowly tilt head to the side, bringing ear towards shoulder. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
2. **Shoulder Rolls:** Roll shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
3. **Chest Stretch:** Stand in a doorway with arms extended overhead and hands on the doorframe. Lean forward, stretching chest. Hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
4. **Bicep Stretch:** Hold arm straight out in front of you and bend wrist, pointing hand towards floor. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
5. **Tricep Stretch:** Hold arm straight out behind you and bend wrist, pointing hand towards ceiling. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
6. **Side Stretch:** Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and stretch to one side, keeping arms extended. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
**Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for major muscle groups
**Note:** Stay hydrated throughout the workout and consider adding a post-workout protein shake.

#### **Day 2 - Lower Body Stretching**
**Duration:** 45 minutes
**Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio, leg swings, and hip circles
**Stretching Routine (30 minutes):**
1. **Quad Stretch:** Stand with one hand against a wall and lift one leg behind you, keeping knee straight. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
2. **Hamstring Stretch:** Sit on the floor with legs straight out in front of you. Lean forward, reaching for toes. Hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
3. **Calf Stretch:** Stand facing a wall with one hand on the wall for balance. Step one foot back about a foot and a half, keeping heel on the ground. Bend front knee and lean forward, stretching calf. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
4. **Glute Stretch:** Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Cross one foot over the other and lift hips off the ground, stretching glutes. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
5. **Hip Flexor Stretch:** Kneel on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips. Take one knee out to the side and rest it on the ground, stretching hip flexor. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
**Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for major muscle groups
**Note:** Focus on proper form and breathing throughout the workout.

#### **Day 3 - Core Stretching**
**Duration:** 45 minutes
**Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio, leg swings, and hip circles
**Stretching Routine (30 minutes):**
1. **Cobra Stretch:** Lie on your stomach with hands under shoulders. Press palms into the ground and lift chest and head off the ground, stretching chest and shoulders. Hold for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
2. **Cat-Cow Stretch:** Start on all fours. Arch back, lifting tailbone and head towards the ceiling. Then, round back, tucking chin towards chest and tailbone towards the ground. Repeat for 30 seconds. (3 sets)
3. **Seated Twist:** Sit on the floor with legs crossed. Twist torso to one side, keeping arms extended. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
4. **Leg Raises:** Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight. Lift one leg towards the ceiling, keeping straight. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
5. **Knee to Chest Stretch:** Lie on your back and bring one knee towards your chest. Hold for 30 seconds and repeat on the other side. (3 sets)
**Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretches for major muscle groups
**Note:** Engage your core throughout the workout to maintain proper form.

**14-Day Advanced Cardio Workout Program**
=============================================

**Trainer:** Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)
**Goal:** Endurance Improvement, Maintaining Fitness
**Level:** Advanced
**Duration:** 45-60 minutes
**Frequency:** 3-4 times/week

**Week 1**
----------

### **Day 1: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)**

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**
    *   Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
    *   Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
    *   Arm circles: 30 seconds (forward and backward)
*   **HIIT Circuit (30 minutes)**
    *   Sprints (30 seconds all-out effort) + rest (30 seconds)
    *   Burpees (12 reps) + rest (30 seconds)
    *   Jump squats (15 reps) + rest (30 seconds)
    *   Mountain climbers (30 seconds) + rest (30 seconds)
    *   Repeat the circuit for a total of 30 minutes
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
    *   Static stretches for legs, arms, and back
*   **Note:** Focus on proper form and technique throughout the workout. Stay hydrated by drinking water before, during, and after the workout.

### **Day 2: Steady-State Cardio**

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**
    *   Jogging in place: 30 seconds
    *   High knees: 30 seconds
    *   Butt kicks: 30 seconds
*   **Steady-State Cardio (30 minutes)**
    *   Jogging or cycling at a moderate intensity
    *   Aim for a steady state where you can maintain a conversation
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
    *   Static stretches for legs, arms, and back
*   **Note:** Listen to your body and adjust the intensity and duration based on how you feel. Make sure to stay hydrated throughout the workout.

### **Day 3: Rest Day**

*   **Note:** Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your body to recover. Engage in light activities like yoga or a leisurely walk if you feel like moving.

    *   Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
    *   Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
    *   Arm circles: 30 seconds (forward and backward)
*   **Tabata Workout (20 minutes)**
    *   Sprints (20 seconds all-out effort) + rest (10 seconds)

**Stress Relief Swimming Program with Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)**

**Week 1**

### Day 1: Monday (Easy Swimming)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Easy freestyle swimming, getting comfortable with the water and breathing technique
*   **Exercise 1: Kicking Drill (3 sets, 20 seconds each)**: Focus on leg kicking while holding onto the side of the pool or a kickboard
*   **Exercise 2: Arm Circles (3 sets, 15 seconds each)**: Hold your arms straight out to the sides and make small circles with your hands
*   **Exercise 3: Freestyle Swimming (3 sets, 1 minute each)**: Swim at a moderate pace, focusing on your breathing and stroke technique
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Easy freestyle swimming to relax and cool down

**Day 2: Tuesday (Upper Body Focus)**

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Easy freestyle swimming, getting comfortable with the water and breathing technique
*   **Exercise 1: Pulling Drill (3 sets, 20 seconds each)**: Use a pull buoy to focus on your arm stroke and engage your upper body
*   **Exercise 2: Shoulder Rolls (3 sets, 15 seconds each)**: Roll your shoulders forward and backward to loosen up your upper body
*   **Exercise 3: Freestyle Swimming (3 sets, 1 minute each)**: Swim at a moderate pace, focusing on your breathing and stroke technique

**Functional Training Rehabilitation Program**
**Duration: 2 Weeks**
**Frequency: 3-4 times/week**
**Trainer: Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)**

**Week 1**
================

### **Day 1: Monday - Upper Body Rehabilitation**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**
	+ Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks)
	+ Dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercise Routine**
	1. **Incline Dumbbell Press** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Lie on an incline bench and press dumbbells upwards
	2. **Lateral Raises** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand with dumbbells at shoulder height and raise them outwards
	3. **Cable Rows** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand facing a cable machine with the cable at chest height and pull it towards your body
	4. **Tricep Dips** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Sit on the edge of a bench and lower your body by bending your elbows
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
	+ Static stretching (focus on upper body muscles)
* **Additional Advice**
	+ Focus on controlled movements and proper form
	+ Use lighter weights and increase reps for a more intense workout
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout

### **Day 2: Tuesday - Lower Body Rehabilitation**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**
	+ Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks)
	+ Dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercise Routine**
	1. **Squats** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and lower your body down
	2. **Lunges** (3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg), 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot
	3. **Leg Press** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Sit in a leg press machine and push the platform away from you
	4. **Calf Raises** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand on a step or platform and raise up onto your tiptoes
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
	+ Static stretching (focus on lower body muscles)
* **Additional Advice**
	+ Focus on proper form and control throughout the workout
	+ Use lighter weights and increase reps for a more intense workout
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout

### **Day 3: Wednesday - Core Rehabilitation**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**
	+ Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks)
	+ Dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Exercise Routine**
	1. **Plank** (3 sets of 30-60 seconds, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart
	2. **Russian Twists** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat
	3. **Leg Raises** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead
	4. **Bicycle Crunches** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Lie on your back with your hands behind your head
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
	+ Static stretching (focus on core muscles)
* **Additional Advice**
	+ Focus on controlled movements and proper form
	+ Use lighter weights and increase reps for a more intense workout
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout

### **Day 4: Thursday - Functional Training**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**
	+ Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks)
	+ Dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Exercise Routine**
	1. **Step-Ups** (3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg), 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand in front of a step or platform and step up with one foot
	2. **Lateral Shuffles** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand with your feet together and shuffle sideways
	3. **Box Jumps** (3 sets of 10-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand in front of a box or platform and jump up onto it
	4. **Single-Leg Hops** (3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg), 60-90 seconds rest)
		- Stand on one leg and hop forward
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
	+ Static stretching (focus on functional muscles)
* **Additional Advice**
	+ Focus on controlled movements and proper form
	+ Use lighter weights and increase reps for a more intense workout
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout

**Pilates for Advanced Health Improvement and Stress Relief**
**Created by Maria Kuznetsova, NASM Certified Trainer**

**Program Overview:**
This 5-week program is designed to help advanced individuals improve their overall health and manage stress through Pilates exercises. Each week will build upon the previous one, increasing in intensity and difficulty. We will focus on engaging your core, improving flexibility, and enhancing balance.

**Week 1: Foundations and Fundamentals**
### Day 1: Monday (Core Focus)
* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Exercises:**
	+ Teaser (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Leg Circles (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Plank (30-second hold, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Bicycle Crunches (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching and deep breathing
* **Note:** Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout each exercise. Practice proper breathing techniques to maintain control.

### Day 2: Tuesday (Upper Body and Balance)
* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Exercises:**
	+ Chest Expansion (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Seated Row (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Single-Leg Stretch (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest per leg)
	+ Balance on a Foam Roller (30-second hold, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching and deep breathing
* **Note:** Focus on maintaining balance and engaging your upper body muscles.

### Day 3: Wednesday (Lower Body and Flexibility)
* **Warm-up (5 minutes):** Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Exercises:**
	+ Wall Squats (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Side Kicks (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest per leg)
	+ Seated Forward Fold (30-second hold, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
	+ Calf Raises (10 reps, 3 sets, 30-second rest)
* **Cool-down (5 minutes):** Static stretching and deep breathing
* **Note:** Focus on engaging your lower body muscles and increasing flexibility in your hips and hamstrings.

**5-Week CrossFit Weight Loss Program**
=====================================

**Trainer:** Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)
**Program Goal:** Weight Loss for Beginners
**Duration:** 35 days, 5-6 times/week, more than 60 minutes

**Week 1: Foundation and Building Blocks**
----------------------------------------

### **Day 1: Monday - Upper Body and Cardio**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**:
	+ Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	+ Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	+ Leg swings: 30 seconds
	+ High knees: 30 seconds
* **Workout (30 minutes)**:
	+ Burpees: 3 sets of 10 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Pull-ups (or assisted pull-ups): 3 sets of 8 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Dumbbell chest press: 3 sets of 12 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Incline dumbbell press: 3 sets of 10 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Mountain climbers: 3 sets of 20 reps, 30 seconds rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**:
	+ Static stretches for upper body: 15-30 seconds per muscle group

**Day 2: Tuesday - Lower Body and Power**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**:
	+ Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	+ Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds
	+ High knees: 30 seconds
	+ Butt kicks: 30 seconds
* **Workout (30 minutes)**:
	+ Box jumps: 3 sets of 10 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Goblet squats: 3 sets of 12 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Romanian deadlifts: 3 sets of 10 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Calf raises: 3 sets of 15 reps, 30 seconds rest
	+ Plank hold: 3 sets of 30-second hold, 30 seconds rest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**:
	+ Static stretches for lower body: 15-30 seconds per muscle group

* Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your body to recover.

**Rehabilitation Cardio Program by Anna Smirnova**
==============================================

**Program Overview**
-------------------

This 2-week rehabilitation cardio program is designed for intermediate-level individuals who aim to improve their cardiovascular health and endurance. The program consists of 1-2 cardio sessions per week, with a focus on low-impact exercises that are easy on the joints.

**Week 1**
---------

### Day 1: Brisk Walking

* **Duration:** 30 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute walk at a gentle pace
* **Exercise:** Brisk walking
	+ 5 minutes at a moderate pace
	+ 10 minutes at a brisk pace (incline: 1-2%)
	+ 5 minutes at a moderate pace
	+ 5 minutes at a gentle pace (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 2 minutes between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout
	+ Listen to your body and take extra breaks if needed
	+ Focus on proper posture and breathing techniques

### Day 2: Rest day

### Day 3: Swimming

* **Duration:** 45 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute gentle swimming (freestyle)
* **Exercise:** Swimming intervals
	+ 25 yards freestyle (moderate pace)
	+ 25 yards backstroke (brisk pace)
	+ 25 yards breaststroke (moderate pace)
	+ 25 yards freestyle (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 30 seconds between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Use a kickboard or pool noodle for added resistance
	+ Focus on engaging your core and maintaining proper technique
	+ Take breaks every 10-15 minutes to rest and rehydrate

### Day 4: Rest day

### Day 5: Cycling

* **Duration:** 30 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute gentle cycling
* **Exercise:** Cycling intervals
	+ 2 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)
	+ 2 minutes at a brisk pace (resistance: 3-4)
	+ 2 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)
	+ 5 minutes at a gentle pace (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 1 minute between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Use a stationary bike or outdoor bike with a comfortable seat
	+ Focus on proper pedaling technique and maintaining a steady pace
	+ Take breaks every 5-10 minutes to rest and rehydrate

### Day 6: Rest day

### Day 7: Elliptical Trainer

* **Duration:** 45 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute gentle elliptical training
* **Exercise:** Elliptical trainer intervals
	+ 3 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)
	+ 3 minutes at a brisk pace (resistance: 3-4)
	+ 3 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)
	+ 5 minutes at a gentle pace (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 30 seconds between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Adjust the resistance and stride length to suit your comfort level
	+ Focus on engaging your core and maintaining proper posture
	+ Take breaks every 10-15 minutes to rest and rehydrate

**Week 2**
---------

### Day 8: Brisk Walking

* **Duration:** 35 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute walk at a gentle pace
* **Exercise:** Brisk walking
	+ 5 minutes at a moderate pace
	+ 12 minutes at a brisk pace (incline: 1-2%)
	+ 5 minutes at a moderate pace
	+ 5 minutes at a gentle pace (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 2 minutes between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Incorporate short hills or inclines to challenge yourself
	+ Focus on proper posture and breathing techniques
	+ Stay hydrated throughout the workout

### Day 9: Rest day

### Day 10: Swimming

* **Duration:** 50 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute gentle swimming (freestyle)
* **Exercise:** Swimming intervals
	+ 30 yards freestyle (moderate pace)
	+ 30 yards backstroke (brisk pace)
	+ 30 yards breaststroke (moderate pace)
	+ 30 yards freestyle (cool-down)
* **Rest:** 30 seconds between intervals
* **Notes:**
	+ Increase the distance or add more intervals to challenge yourself
	+ Focus on engaging your core and maintaining proper technique
	+ Take breaks every 10-15 minutes to rest and rehydrate

### Day 11: Rest day

### Day 12: Cycling

* **Duration:** 40 minutes
* **Warm-up:** 5-minute gentle cycling
* **Exercise:** Cycling intervals
	+ 3 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)
	+ 3 minutes at a brisk pace (resistance: 3-4)
	+ 3 minutes at a moderate pace (resistance: 1-2)

**Additional Tips**
-------------------

**Ivan Orlov's 10-Week Competition Preparation Strength Training Program for Beginners**
====================================================================

**Program Overview**
-------------------

This 10-week strength training program is designed for beginners aiming to prepare for a competition. The program will focus on building overall muscle mass, improving strength, and enhancing endurance. As a beginner, it's essential to start with a moderate volume and intensity, gradually increasing the difficulty as you progress.

**Program Schedule**
-------------------

The program consists of 2-3 strength training sessions per week, with at least one day of rest in between. Each session will last approximately 30-45 minutes.

**Weeks 1-2: Building a Foundation**
--------------------------------

### **Week 1**

#### **Day 1: Chest and Triceps**
--------------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Barbell Bench Press** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Lie on a flat bench and grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Lower the bar to your chest, then press it back up to the starting position
3. **Incline Dumbbell Press** (3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand
	* Press the dumbbells upwards, extending your arms fully
4. **Tricep Pushdowns** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Hold a barbell or rope attachment with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Extend your arms fully, then lower the bar back to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for chest and triceps

#### **Day 2: Back and Biceps**
-----------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Pull-ups** (3 sets of as many reps as possible, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Pull yourself up until your chin clears the bar
3. **Barbell Rows** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips
	* Lift the bar to your chest, then lower it back to the starting position
4. **Dumbbell Bicep Curls** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand
	* Curl the dumbbells upwards, then lower them back to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for back and biceps

#### **Day 3: Legs**
----------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds
	* Calf raises: 30 seconds
2. **Squats** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Lower your body down into a squat, then push back up to the starting position
3. **Leg Press** (3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit in a leg press machine and push the platform away from you with your feet
	* Lower the platform down, then push it back up to the starting position
4. **Lunges** (3 sets of 12-15 reps (per leg), 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot
	* Lower your body down into a lunge, then push back up to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for legs

### **Week 2**

#### **Day 1: Chest and Triceps**
--------------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Incline Barbell Press** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit on an incline bench and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Press the bar upwards, extending your arms fully
3. **Cable Flyes** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand facing a cable machine with the cable at chest height
	* Hold a handle in each hand and press the cable out to the sides
4. **Tricep Dips** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit on the edge of a bench or chair and place your hands next to your hips
	* Lower your body down by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for chest and triceps

#### **Day 2: Back and Biceps**
-----------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Lat Pulldowns** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit at a lat pulldown machine and hold the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Pull the bar down towards your chest, then return it to the starting position
3. **Deadlifts** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Lift the bar up to hip level, then lower it back to the starting position
4. **Preacher Curls** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit at a preacher curl machine and hold a dumbbell in each hand
	* Curl the dumbbells upwards, then lower them back to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for back and biceps

#### **Day 3: Legs**
----------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds
	* Calf raises: 30 seconds
2. **Leg Extensions** (3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit at a leg extension machine and lift the weight up with your legs
	* Lower the weight back down to the starting position
3. **Leg Curls** (3 sets of 10-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Sit at a leg curl machine and lift the weight up with your legs
	* Lower the weight back down to the starting position
4. **Calf Raises** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand on a step or platform and raise up onto your tiptoes
	* Lower back down to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for legs

**Weeks 3-4: Building Strength**
---------------------------

### **Week 3**

#### **Day 1: Chest and Triceps**
--------------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Dumbbell Bench Press** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Lie on a flat bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand
	* Lower the dumbbells to your chest, then press them back up to the starting position
3. **Close-Grip Bench Press** (3 sets of 8-12 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Lie on a flat bench and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart
	* Press the bar upwards, extending your arms fully
4. **Overhead Dumbbell Extension** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand overhead
	* Lower the dumbbells behind your head, then raise them back up to the starting position
5. **Cool-down** (5 minutes):
	* Static stretches for chest and triceps

#### **Day 2: Back and Biceps**
-----------------------------

1. **Warm-up** (5 minutes):
	* Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
	* Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
	* Leg swings: 30 seconds (front and back)
2. **Pull-aparts** (3 sets of 12-15 reps, 60-90 seconds rest):
	* Stand facing a cable machine with the cable at chest height

**Trainer: Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic)**

### **Week 1: Building Endurance**

**Day 1: Monday (Cycling Endurance)**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cycling, dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)**:
	+ Sprints (30 seconds) @ 90% effort, followed by 30 seconds active recovery (low intensity)
	+ Repeat for 20 minutes
* **Endurance Ride**:
	+ Moderate intensity cycling (50-60% effort) for 20 minutes
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (hamstrings, quadriceps, hip flexors)
* **Hydration and Recovery**: Drink 1-2 glasses of water, consume a balanced meal within 30 minutes of finishing the workout, and rest for 60-90 minutes before the next activity

	+ Reps: 3 sets

**Anna Smirnova's 2-Week Boxing/Martial Arts Fitness Program**
===========================================================

**Week 1**
---------

### **Day 1: Monday - Cardio and Flexibility**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**:
  * Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
  * Dynamic stretching: leg swings, arm circles, hip circles
* **Cardio (20 minutes)**:
  * Jumping rope: 3 sets of 3 minutes, rest for 1 minute between sets
  * High knees: 3 sets of 30 seconds, rest for 30 seconds between sets
* **Boxing Drills (20 minutes)**:
  * Heavy bag: 3 sets of 3 minutes, rest for 1 minute between sets (focus on technique and speed)
  * Focus mitts: 3 sets of 3 minutes, rest for 1 minute between sets (work on hand speed and accuracy)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**:
  * Static stretching: focus on major muscle groups (hamstrings, quadriceps, chest, back, shoulders)
* **Hydration and Recovery**:
  + Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day
  + Take a post-workout protein shake with 20-30 grams of protein

### **Day 2: Tuesday - Strength Training**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**:
  * Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
  * Dynamic stretching: leg swings, arm circles, hip circles
* **Strength Training (30 minutes)**:
  * Squats: 3 sets of 8 reps, rest for 60 seconds between sets
  * Push-ups: 3 sets of 12 reps, rest for 60 seconds between sets
  * Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps (per leg), rest for 60 seconds between sets
  * Planks: 3 sets of 30-second hold, rest for 60 seconds between sets
* **Boxing Drills (20 minutes)**:
  * Heavy bag: 3 sets of 3 minutes, rest for 1 minute between sets (focus on power and endurance)
  * Focus mitts: 3 sets of 3 minutes, rest for 1 minute between sets (work on hand speed and accuracy)
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**:
  * Static stretching: focus on major muscle groups (hamstrings, quadriceps, chest, back, shoulders)

  + Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day
  + Take a post-workout protein shake with 20-30 grams of protein

**Flexible Fitness Program by Ivan Orlov (ACE, Advanced)**
===========================================================

**Week 1: Building Foundation**
---------------------------

### Day 1: Monday - Upper Body HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercise 1: Burpees (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then drop down into a squat position and kick back into a plank position
	+ From the plank, do a push-up, then quickly return to the squat position and jump up
* **Exercise 2: Mountain Climbers (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Start in a plank position, then bring one knee up towards your chest and quickly switch to the other knee
* **Exercise 3: Dumbbell Chest Press (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Lie on a flat bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand
	+ Press the dumbbells upwards, extending your arms fully, then lower them back down to the starting position
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on chest, shoulders, and triceps)

**Hydration and Recovery**: Drink at least 8 glasses of water throughout the day, and take a 10-minute walk after the workout to aid in recovery.

### Day 2: Tuesday - Lower Body HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercise 1: Squat Jumps (3 sets, 15 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower your body down into a squat position
	+ From the squat position, explosively jump up into the air, landing softly on the balls of your feet
* **Exercise 2: Calf Raises (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand on the edge of a step or curb with your heels hanging off the edge
	+ Raise up onto your tiptoes, then lower back down to the starting position
* **Exercise 3: Glute Bridges (3 sets, 15 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground
	+ Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on hamstrings, calves, and glutes)

**Supplements**: Consider taking a branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) supplement during the workout to aid in muscle recovery.

### Day 3: Wednesday - Core HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Exercise 1: Plank Jumps (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Start in a plank position, then jump your feet up off the ground and land in a squat position
	+ From the squat position, explosively jump up into the air, landing softly on the balls of your feet
* **Exercise 2: Russian Twists (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Sit on a stability ball or bench with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground
	+ Twist your torso to left and right, touching your hands to the ground each time
* **Exercise 3: Bicycle Crunches (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and alternate bringing your knees towards your chest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on core and back muscles)

### Day 4: Thursday - Upper Body HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercise 1: Push-ups (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Start in a plank position, then lower your body down until your chest nearly touches the ground
	+ Push back up to the starting position
* **Exercise 2: Dumbbell Rows (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Hold a dumbbell in each hand and bend your knees slightly
	+ Keeping your back straight, lift the dumbbells up to your sides until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle
* **Exercise 3: Tricep Dips (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands grasping the edge and your feet flat on the floor
	+ Lower your body down by bending your elbows, then straighten your arms to return to the starting position
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on chest, shoulders, and triceps)

### Day 5: Friday - Lower Body HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercise 1: Lateral Shuffles (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand with your feet together, then shuffle your feet from side to side
* **Exercise 2: Step-Ups (3 sets, 10 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand in front of a step or bench with your right foot on the step and your left foot on the ground
	+ Bring your left foot up to meet your right foot on the step, then step back down to the starting position
* **Exercise 3: Calf Raises on a Step (3 sets, 15 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Stand on the edge of a step or curb with your heels hanging off the edge
	+ Raise up onto your tiptoes, then lower back down to the starting position
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on hamstrings, calves, and glutes)

**Rest and Recovery**: Take a 10-minute walk after the workout and prioritize rest and recovery for the rest of the day.

### Day 6: Saturday - Core HIIT

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Exercise 1: Plank Jumps (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Start in a plank position, then jump your feet up off the ground and land in a squat position
	+ From the squat position, explosively jump up into the air, landing softly on the balls of your feet
* **Exercise 2: Russian Twists (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Sit on a stability ball or bench with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground
	+ Twist your torso to left and right, touching your hands to the ground each time
* **Exercise 3: Bicycle Crunches (3 sets, 20 reps, 30 seconds rest)**
	+ Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and alternate bringing your knees towards your chest
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on core and back muscles)

**Supplements**: Consider taking a post-workout protein shake to aid in muscle recovery.

**10-Week Endurance Improvement Dance Workout Program**
=====================================

**Program Overview**
-------------------

Welcome to this 10-week endurance improvement dance workout program designed by Maria Kuznetsova (NASM, Basic). This program is tailored to help you improve your dance endurance, increase your stamina, and enhance your overall fitness level. As an intermediate dancer, you'll engage in 1-2 dance sessions per week, with each session lasting up to 30 minutes.

**Week 1-2: Foundation Building**
-----------------------------

### **Week 1**

#### **Day 1: Monday**
* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Dance Exercise 1: Basic Step** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	+ Reps: 30 seconds of continuous movement
	+ Sets: 3 sets with 30 seconds rest in between
* **Dance Exercise 2: Side-to-Side Steps** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	+ Reps: 30 seconds of continuous movement
	+ Sets: 3 sets with 30 seconds rest in between
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (hamstrings, quadriceps, hip flexors)
* **Hydration and Recovery**: Drink 16-20 ounces of water after the workout. Focus on proper nutrition and aim for 7-9 hours of sleep.

#### **Day 3: Wednesday**
* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Dance Exercise 1: Forward and Backward Steps** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	+ Reps: 30 seconds of continuous movement
	+ Sets: 3 sets with 30 seconds rest in between
* **Dance Exercise 2: Turn and Leap** (30 seconds, 3 sets, 30 seconds rest)
	+ Reps: 30 seconds of continuous movement
	+ Sets: 3 sets with 30 seconds rest in between
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (hamstrings, quadriceps, hip flexors)
* **Hydration and Recovery**: Drink 16-20 ounces of water after the workout. Focus on proper nutrition and aim for 7-9 hours of sleep.

**10-Week Advanced Running Program for Flexibility Improvement**
**Trainer: Anna Smirnova (ISSA, Master)**

**Program Overview**
This 10-week program is designed for advanced runners who want to improve their flexibility. The program includes a mix of running, strength training, and stretching exercises to help increase flexibility and reduce the risk of injury. The program is tailored to advanced runners who can commit to 5-6 workouts per week, with a minimum of 30-45 minutes per session.

**Week 1: Building Foundation**
--------------------------------

### **Day 1: Monday (Running Day 1)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light jogging, leg swings, and dynamic stretching
* **Running (30 minutes)**: Easy run at a moderate pace
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Focus on proper running form, and don't forget to breathe!

### **Day 2: Tuesday (Strength Training)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Squats (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then bend knees and lower body down
* **Lunges (3 sets of 10 reps per leg)**: Stand with feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower body down
* **Leg Press (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Sit in a leg press machine and push the platform away from you
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Focus on proper form and engage your core throughout the exercises!

### **Day 3: Wednesday (Running Day 2)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light jogging, leg swings, and dynamic stretching
* **Running (35 minutes)**: Interval training with 5 minutes at a fast pace, followed by 5 minutes at a slow pace
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Pay attention to your breathing and try to maintain a consistent pace!

### **Day 4: Thursday (Yoga and Stretching)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light cardio and dynamic stretching
* **Yoga and Stretching (30 minutes)**: Focus on flexibility and balance exercises, such as downward-facing dog, warrior II, and pigeon pose
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Listen to your body and take breaks when needed!

### **Day 5: Friday (Running Day 3)**

* **Warm-up (10 minutes)**: Light jogging, leg swings, and dynamic stretching
* **Running (40 minutes)**: Hill repeats with 5 minutes at a fast pace, followed by 5 minutes at a slow pace
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Focus on proper running form and try to maintain a consistent pace!

### **Day 6: Saturday (Strength Training)**

* **Deadlifts (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend at the hips, and lift the weight up
* **Calf Raises (3 sets of 15 reps)**: Stand on a step or platform and raise up onto your tiptoes
* **Leg Extensions (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Sit in a leg extension machine and lift the weight up
* **Cool-down (10 minutes)**: Static stretching for legs and hips
* **Additional Advice**: Focus on proper form and engage your core throughout the exercises!

* **Additional Advice**: Take a well-deserved rest day and focus on recovery!

**Functional Training Program for Health Improvement**
=====================================================

**Program Overview**
-------------------

Welcome to this 2-week functional training program designed by Ivan Orlov, a certified ACE trainer. This program focuses on improving overall health and fitness through a mix of strength training, cardio, and flexibility exercises. As an intermediate-level program, it's perfect for those who have some experience with exercise but want to take their fitness journey to the next level.

**Program Schedule**
-------------------

### **Week 1**

#### **Day 1: Upper Body and Core**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (arm circles, leg swings)
* **Exercise 1: Push-ups (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Exercise 2: Incline Dumbbell Press (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Use a weight that allows you to complete the given reps with good form
* **Exercise 3: Bent-Over Rows (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Keep your back straight and engage your core
* **Exercise 4: Plank (3 sets, 30-second hold, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on upper body and core)

#### **Day 2: Lower Body and Cardio**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, hip circles)
* **Exercise 1: Squats (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Exercise 2: Lunges (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Alternate legs and focus on proper form
* **Exercise 3: Calf Raises (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Use a weight or bodyweight
* **Exercise 4: Jumping Jacks (3 sets, 30 seconds, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and high-intensity movement
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on lower body)

#### **Day 3: Rest Day**

#### **Day 4: Core and Balance**

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light cardio (jogging, jumping jacks) and dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
* **Exercise 1: Russian Twists (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Use a weight or medicine ball
* **Exercise 2: Leg Raises (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and engage your core
* **Exercise 3: Single-Leg Balance (3 sets, 30-second hold, 60 seconds rest)**: Focus on proper form and balance
* **Exercise 4: Single-Arm Row (3 sets, 12 reps, 60 seconds rest)**: Alternate arms and focus on proper form
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (focusing on core and balance)

**14-Day Running Program for Health Improvement and Weight Loss**
===========================================================

**Trainer:** Maria Kuznetsova, NASM Certified
**Duration:** 14 days
**Frequency:** 3-4 times a week
**Goal:** Health Improvement and Weight Loss
**Level:** Intermediate
**Avg Duration:** More than 60 minutes

**Week 1**
--------

### **Day 1: Monday - Long Run**
---------------------------

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**
	+ Light jogging
	+ Leg swings (front and back)
	+ Arm circles (forward and backward)
* **Run (45 minutes)**
	+ Start with a 5-minute warm-up jog
	+ Run at a moderate pace for 20 minutes
	+ Incorporate interval training: 4 minutes of high-intensity running, followed by 2 minutes of active recovery (jogging or walking)
	+ Repeat the interval 4 times
	+ Finish with a 10-minute cool-down jog
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**
	+ Static stretches for hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip flexors
* **Hydration and Nutrition:**
	+ Drink at least 16 ounces of water before, during, and after the run
	+ Consume a balanced meal or snack with complex carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats within 30-60 minutes after the run

---------------------------

**CrossFit Weight Loss Program for Beginners**
=============================================

**Program Overview**
-------------------

Welcome to this 2-week CrossFit weight loss program designed specifically for beginners. Our goal is to help you lose weight, build strength, and improve overall fitness in a fun and challenging way. This program is tailored to your needs, with a focus on weight loss and beginner-friendly exercises.

**Week 1**
----------

### Day 1: Monday ( Upper Body and Cardio)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**:
  * Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
  * Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
  * Leg swings: 30 seconds
  * Hip circles: 30 seconds
* **Workout (30 minutes)**:
  1. Burpees: 3 sets of 10 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  2. Mountain climbers: 3 sets of 30 seconds, 60 seconds rest between sets
  3. Dumbbell chest press: 3 sets of 12 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  4. Dumbbell rows: 3 sets of 12 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  5. Plank hold: 3 sets of 60 seconds, 60 seconds rest between sets
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**:
  * Static stretches for chest, back, and arms
* **Hydration and Supplements**:
  * Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day
  * Consider taking a pre-workout supplement to boost energy and performance
* **Note**: Listen to your body and rest when needed. If you're feeling tired, take an extra day off or modify the exercises to make them easier.

### Day 2: Wednesday (Lower Body and Cardio)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**:
  * Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
  * Dynamic leg swings: 30 seconds
  * Hip circles: 30 seconds
  * Calf raises: 30 seconds
* **Workout (30 minutes)**:
  1. Squats: 3 sets of 10 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  2. Box jumps: 3 sets of 10 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  3. Calf raises: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  4. Step-ups: 3 sets of 10 reps (per leg), 60 seconds rest between sets
  5. Plank hold: 3 sets of 60 seconds, 60 seconds rest between sets
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**:
  * Static stretches for legs and calves
* **Hydration and Supplements**:
  * Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day
  * Consider taking a post-workout supplement to aid in recovery

### Day 3: Friday (Core and Cardio)

* **Warm-up (5 minutes)**:
  * Jumping jacks: 30 seconds
  * Dynamic arm circles: 30 seconds
  * Leg swings: 30 seconds
  * Hip circles: 30 seconds
* **Workout (30 minutes)**:
  1. Russian twists: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  2. Bicycle crunches: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  3. Leg raises: 3 sets of 15 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
  4. Plank hold: 3 sets of 60 seconds, 60 seconds rest between sets
  5. Burpees: 3 sets of 10 reps, 60 seconds rest between sets
* **Cool-down (5 minutes)**:
  * Static stretches for core and back
* **Hydration and Supplements**:
  * Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day

**Anna Smirnova's Adaptive Running Program**
==============================================

**Week 1**
----------

### Day 1: Monday - Easy Run (20 minutes)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light jogging, dynamic stretching (leg swings, arm circles)
*   **Easy Run (15 minutes)**: Jog at a comfortable pace, focus on proper form and breathing
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching (hamstrings, quadriceps, hip flexors)
*   **Hydration**: Drink at least 8 oz of water before, during, and after the workout
*   **Note**: Listen to your body and adjust the pace as needed

### Day 2: Tuesday - Strength Training (20 minutes)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light jogging, dynamic stretching
*   **Squats (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, lower body down to a squat position, then stand up
*   **Lunges (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Alternate legs, step forward with one foot, lower body down to a lunge position, then stand up
*   **Leg Press (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Sit on a leg press machine, push the platform away from you with your feet
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching
*   **Supplements**: Consider taking a post-workout protein shake to aid in muscle recovery

### Day 3: Wednesday - Rest Day

*   **Note**: Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your body to recover

### Day 4: Thursday - Hill Sprints (20 minutes)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light jogging, dynamic stretching
*   **Hill Sprints (3 sets of 5 reps)**: Find a gentle hill, sprint up the hill at maximum effort, then walk back down to recover
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching
*   **Note**: Focus on proper form and technique, especially when sprinting uphill

### Day 5: Friday - Easy Run (20 minutes)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light jogging, dynamic stretching
*   **Easy Run (15 minutes)**: Jog at a comfortable pace, focus on proper form and breathing
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching
*   **Hydration**: Drink at least 8 oz of water before, during, and after the workout
*   **Note**: Listen to your body and adjust the pace as needed

### Day 6: Saturday - Flexibility Training (20 minutes)

*   **Warm-up (5 minutes)**: Light jogging, dynamic stretching
*   **Leg Swings (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Stand with feet hip-width apart, swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg
*   **Hip Circles (3 sets of 10 reps)**: Stand with feet together, move hips in a large circle, first clockwise and then counterclockwise
*   **Cool-down (5 minutes)**: Static stretching
*   **Note**: Focus on deep, controlled breathing and proper form

### Day 7: Sunday - Rest Day

*   **Note**: Take a well-deserved rest day to allow your body to recover
